\"Health\" Drink.flavorText: Do not exceed recommend daily serving size of 0 grams.

A Light in the Darkness.flavorText: Wait, how can you have a light in the dark? If you turn on a light while it’s dark, doesn’t that mean it’s no longer dark?

A. F. Kay.flavorText: Talk to the hand 'cause the mouth is sippin'.

Abominable Bowman.flavorText: Frosty the Bowman... was an angry hateful soul... with a fresh hewn bow and a missing nose...

Abomination.flavorText: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.

Absorbent Parasite.flavorText: Your beasts' iron levels are high, what have you been feeding them?

Abusive Sergeant.flavorText: ADD ME TO YOUR DECK, MAGGOT!

Abyssal Enforcer.flavorText: The Kabal print this on every package of illicit Mana Crystals: WARNING - DO NOT PUT WITHIN REACH OF ABYSSALS. THIS IS NOT APPROVED FOR USE BY FLAMING DEMONS OF ANY KIND.

Abyssal Wave.flavorText: Often followed up with a chasmic handshake.

Academic Espionage.flavorText: The tenth Pyroblast really felt like overkill.

Ace Hunter Kreen.flavorText: This grandmaster marksman loves winning tournaments and eating a bit of ice cream.

Acherus Veteran.flavorText: This is my Runeblade. There are many like it but this one is mine.

Acidmaw.flavorText: With the help of his trusty sidekick Dreadscale, the giant jormungar Acidmaw is ready to face any knight!

Acolyte of Agony.flavorText: It takes many years of practiced study in order to fully master agony.

Acolyte of Death.flavorText: "I see dead people. A LOT of dead people."

Acolyte of Pain.flavorText: He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.

Acornbearer.flavorText: You’d be nuts to mess with the squirrel squad.

Acrobatics.flavorText: He soars through the air with the greatest of fleas.

Activate the Obelisk.flavorText: A one-eyed, one stone, towering purple minion healer.

Adaptation.flavorText: Pray for salvation. If that fails, pray for extra horns or bigger teeth.

Adaptive Amalgam.flavorText: We've only explored 5% of the ocean. So there's like a 95% chance this is accurate.

Addled Grizzly.flavorText: Druids who spend too long in bear form are more susceptible to the whispers of the Old Gods. Right now they are whispering the lyrics to "La Bamba".

Adorable Infestation.flavorText: Some cards are strong by sheer power; others draw strength from love.

Aegwynn, the Guardian.flavorText: With Medivh as her son, nothing YOU do could ever disappoint her.

Aeon Reaver.flavorText: Ripping centuries asunder helps him manage his busy schedule.

Aerosoilizer.flavorText: Banned in Wild for opening a hole in the ozone layer.

Against All Odds.flavorText: Time to EVEN out the playing field.

Agency Espionage.flavorText: What gnomish monitoring devices lack in subtlety, they make up for in robustness.

Aggramar, the Avenger.flavorText: Formerly a trusted lieutenant of Sargeras, Aggramar helped him fight the demonic legions across many worlds before he was corrupted.

Air Guitarist.flavorText: Nailing that solo was a breeze.

Air Raid.flavorText: It's difficult to get an air raid together. You have to get twenty-five people, and they all want to play a paladin!

Airlock Breach.flavorText: Open the pod bay doors, Maladaar.

Akali, the Rhino.flavorText: Most trolls only get to “AAAAHHH!” and don’t make it to the “kali” part.

Akama.flavorText: "To many of my people, I am known as a traitor... as Illidan's lapdog. I will remain in the shadows, for now... Actually, maybe I'll just remain in the shadows forever."

Al'Akir the Windlord.flavorText: He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords. And the other three don't let him forget it.

Al'Akir, the Winds of Time.flavorText: Murozond sought unlikely allies in his fight against the Bronze Dragonflight.

Alarmed Securitybot.flavorText: THREAT LEVEL: 5! Which doesn't actually sound that bad to be honest.

Aldor Attendant.flavorText: Will check to make sure you have a valid libramary card.

Aldor Peacekeeper.flavorText: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.

Aldrachi Warblades.flavorText: The ancient Aldrachi were the greatest warriors in the universe. Imagine their power if they'd put the handle at the END of the blade.

Alexstrasza.flavorText: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone. Except Deathwing. And Malygos. And Nekros.

Alexstrasza's Champion.flavorText: "Put more spikes on her. No, more spikes. What part of 'more spikes' do you not understand? MORE SPIKES!" - Alexstrasza

Algalon the Observer.flavorText: That's so Algalon, it’s the future he can see.

Alien Encounters.flavorText: Close encounters of the cuddly kind.

All Fel Breaks Loose.flavorText: Maybe we should have made the bars closer together…

All Terrain Voidhound.flavorText: 4 claw drive, independent joint suspension AND a 7 mana warranty? Where do I sign?

All You Can Eat.flavorText: Never design cards when you're hungry.

Alley Armorsmith.flavorText: The rent is cheap and she passes the savings onto YOU!

Alleycat.flavorText: To be a cool cat in Gadgetzan, you gotta have bling.

Alliance Bannerman.flavorText: Back in my day, we had to carry our inspiration uphill both ways to war.

Alloy Advisor.flavorText: Numbers may betray you, but steel... steel you can trust.

Altar of Fire.flavorText: "I now pronounce you, Crispy and Fried."

Altered Chord.flavorText: I'll never understand how bands and orchestras allow musicians that just…. play... off-key. Would love opinions on this.

Altruis the Outcast.flavorText: Altruis betrayed Illidan to forge his own way in Outland. With Blackjack. And Netherdrakes.

Aluneth.flavorText: PHENOMENAL ARCANE POWER…itty bitty living space.

Always a Bigger Jormungar.flavorText: I saw it! It's big, scary, and blue!

Amalgam of the Deep.flavorText: Most explorers call it a success to find just one new species. Imagine Finley's excitement when he identified ten at once!

Aman'Thul.flavorText: The leader of the titans was the first to awaken. In his loneliness, he sought out other titans across many different worlds, and together, they formed the Pantheon.

Amani Berserker.flavorText: If an Amani berserker asks "Joo lookin' at me?!", the correct response is "Nah, mon".

Amani War Bear.flavorText: "I used to farm for hours! Now they just come in packs?"

Ambassador Faelin.flavorText: For thousands of years, Faelin has longed to return to his homeland. Will Zin-Azshari be as he hopes, or are the secrets of the deep better left forgotten?

Amber Whelp.flavorText: What is a Bronze Whelp's favorite garnish? A little thyme!

Ambient Lightspawn.flavorText: Make sure it's smaller than your other lightspawns for the best fill lighting.

Amitus, the Peacekeeper.flavorText: As a champion of harmony, Amitus abstained from the Pantheon's many conflicts until one day, shortly after the corruption of Sargeras, she vanished altogether.

Amorphous Slime.flavorText: A crucial component of the Lordaeroneon Choice Awards.

Amphibious Elixir.flavorText: Made by frogs, for frogs, from frogs.

Amplified Elekk.flavorText: Before this show can continue, we have to bass-boost the elephant in the room.

Amulet of Undying.flavorText: Didn't seem to work out too well for this guy.

Anachronos.flavorText: "That's it, you're all in time out!"

Ancestral Guardian.flavorText: No one knows whose ancestor he is, but he's still upset that you never call.

Ancestral Healing.flavorText: I personally prefer some non-ancestral right-the-heck-now healing, but maybe that is just me.

Ancestral Spirit.flavorText: It was just a flesh wound.

Ancharrr.flavorText: The problem with anchors is they often end up sinking to the bottom of your deck.

Anchored Totem.flavorText: The Naga devised the perfect retaliation to any pirates dropping anchor in their domain: vandalism.

Anchorite.flavorText: A Priest is nothing without their anchor. Wait, what?

Ancient Brewmaster.flavorText: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak. But apparently that's a compliment.

Ancient Harbinger.flavorText: "honey, can u run down to the store and pick up some 10 cost minions? thx"

Ancient Mage.flavorText: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.

Ancient Mysteries.flavorText: I'm not saying it was aliens, but it was TOTALLY aliens!

Ancient Shade.flavorText: Warning: Do not expose to direct sunlight.

Ancient Shieldbearer.flavorText: Back in her day, each shield weighed two tons and she had to carry four of them on each arm!

Ancient Totem.flavorText: This is SO much cuter than Tinyfin.

Ancient Void Hound.flavorText: What happened to my 1/1 Void Pup? And the glee club?!

Ancient Watcher.flavorText: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?

Ancient of Blossoms.flavorText: His new shampoo is really working!

Ancient of Lore.flavorText: Go ahead, carve your initials in him.

Ancient of War.flavorText: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?" You lose if you get crushed to death.

Anduin's Gift.flavorText: "My council assures me this is the perfect gift! Not that they needed to tell me. I know what's in there." -Anduin

Anetheron.flavorText: Leads every demonic invasion. Hopefully this one turns out better than the World Tree.

Angry Chicken.flavorText: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.

Angry Helhound.flavorText: When you wake up on the all 3 wrong sides of the bed.

Anima Extractor.flavorText: After we are done you're welcome to help yourself to cookies and apple juice. Thank you for your donation!

Anima Golem.flavorText: The Dark Animus is evil and mysterious and huge and unable to write sentences that utilize proper grammar.

Animal Companion.flavorText: You could summon Misha, Leokk, or Huffer! Huffer is more trouble than he's worth.

Animate Dead.flavorText: In the old days they used to animate the dead one bone at a time... it's all done by computer now.

Animated Armor.flavorText: Try putting it on. Wait, let me get my camera.

Animated Avalanche.flavorText: Always sliding down mountains because it can't stop talking with its hands.

Animated Berserker.flavorText: He'd be a lot easier to animate if he would just stand still.

Anka, the Buried.flavorText: "You look familiar. Were you at my first funeral?"

Annoy-o-Module.flavorText: Every ten seconds it asks if you want to update.

Annoy-o-Tron.flavorText: The inventor of the Annoy-o-Tron was immediately expelled from Tinkerschool, Tinkertown, and was eventually exiled from the Eastern Kingdoms altogether.

Annoy-o-Troupe.flavorText: Some classes get Void Lords, other classes get Annoyed Lords.

Annoying Fan.flavorText: No, Annoy-o-Tron, an air horn is not an instrument.

Anodized Robo Cub.flavorText: It's adorable! AND OH MY GOODNESS WHY IS IT EATING MY FACE

Anonymous Informant.flavorText: It turns out she wasn't so great at keeping secrets after all.

Anti-Magic Shell.flavorText: Using a spell to counter magic - a bit hypocritical don't you think?

Antique Flinger.flavorText: One man's treasure is another man's statue to the face.

Antique Healbot.flavorText: They don't make 'em like they used to! (Because of explosions, mostly.)

Anub'ar Ambusher.flavorText: Originally he was called "Anub'ar Guy who bounces a guy back to your hand", but it lacked a certain zing.

Anub'arak.flavorText: Was actually a pretty nice guy before, you know, the whole Lich King thing.

Anubisath Defender.flavorText: Also comes running when he hears a can opener.

Anubisath Sentinel.flavorText: He's actually a 1/1 who picked up the hammer from the last guy.

Anubisath Warbringer.flavorText: Some dogs will bring you a bone or a squeaky toy. This one brings war!

Anyfin Can Happen.flavorText: Theme song by Ellie Goldfin and Blagghghlrlrl Harris.

Apexis Blast.flavorText: Lonely mages can still have a blast!

Apexis Smuggler.flavorText: "S-secrets? I don't have any! Whoa, look, a spell!"

Apothecary Helbrim.flavorText: The best way to maintain your health is to poison everyone else.

Apothecary's Caravan.flavorText: If you won't bring out your dead, we'll bring the dead to you.

Apotheosis.flavorText: Defined as the absolute pinnacle of existence. Plus Lifesteal.

Aqua Archivist.flavorText: Do not summon! I JUST had to put all my scrolls in rice.

Aquatic Form.flavorText: How long can YOU hold your breath underwater?

Ara'lon.flavorText: If I had a nickel for every time a Hunter Legendary minion in Castle Nathria summoned three different companions, I'd have two nickels - which isn't a lot, but it's weird that it happened twice.

Aranasi Broodmother.flavorText: She's got a big brood and a big mood.

Aranna, Thrill Seeker.flavorText: "Aranna, I feel like you only came to this island so you could use the zipline."

Arathi Weaponsmith.flavorText: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

Arbor Up.flavorText: If you can’t outrun a tree, you really shouldn’t be here anyway.

Arcane Amplifier.flavorText: Not on good terms with warlocks.

Arcane Anomaly.flavorText: He used to get work as a Spatial Anomaly, but he got tired of having his polarity reversed.

Arcane Artificer.flavorText: Ethereal armor dissipates in 6 hours which can cause extreme awkwardness for first time buyers.

Arcane Bolt.flavorText: Just you wait until I have 8 mana!

Arcane Breath.flavorText: One of many side effects from eating mana cookies.

Arcane Brilliance.flavorText: They could probably do with a dash of Arcane Humility.

Arcane Devourer.flavorText: Likes her magic with a pinch of salt.

Arcane Dynamo.flavorText: We ran out of jars, so we started putting brains in other stuff.

Arcane Explosion.flavorText: This spell is much better than Arcane Implosion.

Arcane Flakmage.flavorText: Ancient pandaren proverb: He who is without secrets lacks flak.

Arcane Fletcher.flavorText: Stop trying to make fletch happen. It's not going to happen.

Arcane Giant.flavorText: Claims to be drawn to Karazhan because of the ley lines. Actually, just loves Moroes’ cooking.

Arcane Golem.flavorText: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.

Arcane Intellect.flavorText: Playing this card makes you SMARTER. And let's face it: we could all stand to be a little smarter.

Arcane Keysmith.flavorText: She sells all manner of keys: from A flat to G sharp.

Arcane Luminary.flavorText: They say true value is the cards you find along the way.

Arcane Missiles.flavorText: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.

Arcane Nullifier X-21.flavorText: There was some hard talk between gnome magi and engineers about inventing this mech.

Arcane Overflow.flavorText: On this ship, when you can’t use an int, learn how to float.

Arcane Quiver.flavorText: "Quiver in fear!" - The Lich King "Ok." - Me

Arcane Servant.flavorText: "Would sir like me to punch something?"

Arcane Shot.flavorText: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves. The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.

Arcane Tyrant.flavorText: Tyrant is such a strong word.

Arcane Watcher.flavorText: Now his watch has ended… until you have Spell Damage.

Arcane Wyrm.flavorText: Arcane Bolt on you, Arcane Bolt on your cow, Arcane Bolt on your whole family!

Arcanite Reaper.flavorText: No… actually you should fear the Reaper.

Arcanite Ripper.flavorText: A guitar with a skull - perfect for headbanging.

Arcanologist.flavorText: What did you draw? Shhhh… it’s a secret.

Arcanosmith.flavorText: He’s really just a Blacksmith, but he thought the fancy title would bring in more business.

Arch-Thief Rafaam.flavorText: He's very good at retrieving artifacts. From other people's museums.

Arch-Villain Rafaam.flavorText: Minions must wash hands before being LIQUIDATED AND REPLACED BY SOMEONE BETTER.

Archimonde.flavorText: Archimonde joined Sargeras in search of power, and in doing so became one of the strongest forces within the Burning Legion who laid waste to countless planets… but in the end he still lost to a wisp.

Archivist Elysiana.flavorText: Your deck is just another organizational challenge to her.

Archmage.flavorText: You earn the title of Archmage when you can destroy anyone who calls you on it.

Archmage Antonidas.flavorText: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor. This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.

Archmage Arugal.flavorText: His worgen children call him Archmage AROO-OO-OO-OO-gal.

Archmage Vargoth.flavorText: He's an archmage, but he might want to brush up on the basics... like aiming.

Archspore Msshi'fn.flavorText: Brave leader of the Sporeggar. Guided by the philosophy that one should not mssh with matters that are not one's msshiness.

Archwitch Willow.flavorText: One of the demons will do all the work while the other gets the same grade.

Arena Fanatic.flavorText: Her fantasy Rumble league gives double points for dismemberment.

Arena Patron.flavorText: Everybody with a ticket get in here!

Arena Treasure Chest.flavorText: Yeah it's great, but did you see the Arena Treasure Arms?!

Arfus.flavorText: There must always be a Lick King.

Argent Braggart.flavorText: Not sure why he's bragging, he's got the same stats as the next guy.

Argent Commander.flavorText: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.

Argent Lance.flavorText: The stripes make it look like a candy cane, but we recommend against licking it.

Argent Protector.flavorText: "I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs. I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to."

Argent Squire.flavorText: "I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos." - The Argent Dawn Oath

Argent Watchman.flavorText: Who argent watches the Argent Watchman?

Argunite Golem.flavorText: Golem Bling never really caught on - the fad crumbled after the Cataclysm.

Argus, the Emerald Star.flavorText: Once a proud titan, Argus was fated to meet a darker end. Sargeras and his demons would later corrupt and shatter Argus to use his power for themselves.

Arid Stormer.flavorText: Some people chase storms, some storms chase elementals.

Arkonite Defense Crystal.flavorText: I was just asking if that's what you wanted your Starship to look like, there's no need to get defensive.

Arkwing Pilot.flavorText: Delivered in under 30 minutes, or your Arkwings are free!

Armagedillo.flavorText: We may never know what provoked it, but we will never forget the consequences.

Armor Vendor.flavorText: "You look like the kind of person that would buy three sets of armor. One to wear, a spare, and a spare for the spare."

Armored Goon.flavorText: Armored except for non-critical areas, such as the head, torso, fists and thighs.

Armored Warhorse.flavorText: Yep. It's a horse... wearing armor... going to war.

Armorsmith.flavorText: She accepts guild funds for repairs!

Arrogant Crusader.flavorText: To be honest, he was kind of a jerk even BEFORE he was bitten by that ghoul.

Arrow Smith.flavorText: "What do you mean it's a violin bow!?!"

Artificer Xy'mox.flavorText: "The anticipation to use this relic is killing me! Though, it will more likely kill you."

Ashen Elemental.flavorText: "The castle was nice but the fireplaces were too small - 2/5 stars"

Ashtongue Battlelord.flavorText: Demons have destroyed the lives of the Ashtongue draenei. Now he’s got a shoulder-axe to grind.

Ashtongue Slayer.flavorText: Her other hand attachments include a corkscrew and a bottle opener.

Asphyxiate.flavorText: I find your abundance of Attack disturbing.

Assassin's Blade.flavorText: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin. Certificate of authenticity included.

Assassinate.flavorText: If you don't want to be assassinated, move to the Barrens and change your name. Good luck!

Astalor Bloodsworn.flavorText: I hear his third phase is even more intense.

Astral Automaton.flavorText: You'll want to summon an automaTON of these.

Astral Communion.flavorText: Hey! Moon! Can I have some mana crystals?

Astral Rift.flavorText: Let's see what's behind rift number one!

Astral Serpent.flavorText: Call it lazy all you want, but it does have two more cards than you.

Astral Tiger.flavorText: Astral kitty litter is surprisingly hard to find.

Astral Vigilant.flavorText: Draenei are so dedicated that they remain vigilant even in death.

Astrobiologist.flavorText: Biologists spend a semester abroad. Astrobiologists spend a semester aboard.

Astromancer Solarian.flavorText: Loyal to Kael'thas Sunstrider, this blood elf mage sought arcane power in the Void. Did she find it... or did IT find her?

Asvedon, the Grandshield.flavorText: If you think that's strong, you should see his Great Great Grandshield.

Attorney-at-Maw.flavorText: When the going gets tough, you don't want a criminal lawyer... you want a criminal lawyer...

Auchenai Death-Speaker.flavorText: He sees no evil. He hears no evil. Eh, he speaks a little evil.

Auchenai Phantasm.flavorText: “Okay kids did everyone remember to heal before we left?”

Auchenai Soulpriest.flavorText: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.

Auctioneer Jaxon.flavorText: "Who's up for a brand-new wisp? This thing's in perfect condition, folks! Never been played..."

Auctionhouse Gavel.flavorText: "I want to be a judge! Or an auctioneer! Look, all I want is one of those sweet, tiny hammers."

Auctionmaster Beardo.flavorText: Gadgetzan has always run an under-the-table auction house, and business has been PRETTY good for Beardo since the population explosion. And since the explosion that destroyed the competing auction houses in the city.

Audio Amplifier.flavorText: And you thought we were putting Wildheart Guff in Core. We'd never do that! WINK WINK.

Audio Splitter.flavorText: "I tried to give him some constructive criticism but gosh, he really hates feedback!"

Auspicious Spirits.flavorText: "I'm not AWE-spicious, but I am a little spicious."

Autodefense Matrix.flavorText: We call it the bubble machine.

Avalanche.flavorText: One of our more snowbally cards.

Avenge.flavorText: Several paladins have joined together to deliver justice under the name "Justice Force". Their lawyer talked them out of calling themselves the Justice League.

Avenging Wrath.flavorText: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!

Avian Watcher.flavorText: He mostly watches light romantic comedies.

Aviana.flavorText: Call her "Tweety". She'll find it real funny. I PROMISE.

Awaken the Makers.flavorText: They keep hitting the Snooze button.

Awaken!.flavorText: This is an alarm clock you can't ignore.

Awakening Tremors.flavorText: A rude followup to the Sleepy Tremors.

Axe Berserker.flavorText: All the body spray went to her head.

Axe Flinger.flavorText: Once a lowly "Stick Flinger", he's been relentless on the path to his ultimate dream: "Tauren Flinger".

Aya Blackpaw.flavorText: Though young, Aya took over as the leader of Jade Lotus through her charisma and strategic acumen when her predecessor was accidentally crushed by a jade golem.

Azalina Soulthief.flavorText: The cards are always golden on the other side.

Azerite Chain Gang.flavorText: How long can this go on? For 6 years at least!

Azerite Giant.flavorText: Either that giant isn't really giant, or that doorway is HUGE!

Azerite Vein.flavorText: When the ground trembles near it, are those earthquakes or heartbeats?

Azsharan Defector.flavorText: "I've got a sinking feeling about this evil Queen."

Azsharan Gardens.flavorText: That's not what I meant when I asked you to water the garden.

Azsharan Mooncatcher.flavorText: The light of Elune faded from the ruins of Zin-Azshari, but not its treasures.

Azsharan Ritual.flavorText: The harmonious silence surrounding the ritual was unceremoniously BROKEN when HAROLD began eating stale potato chips.

Azsharan Saber.flavorText: Even in ancient times, the Night Elves were committed cat people.

Azsharan Scavenger.flavorText: Some local Murloc populations have adapted to survive in the harsh conditions of the ruins, much to the fascination of Sir Finley.

Azsharan Scroll.flavorText: Kids these days are always scrolling on their tomes.

Azsharan Sentinel.flavorText: For some, the Sundering was the collapse of civilization. For others, it was a great core workout.

Azsharan Sweeper.flavorText: The enchanted objects of Zin-Azshari have extremely long warranties.

Azsharan Trident.flavorText: Nevermind the barnacles! A well-crafted weapon is eternally useful.

Azsharan Vessel.flavorText: Not even the sturdiest Highborne ship could survive the churning waters of the Sundering.

Azure Drake.flavorText: They initially planned to be the Beryl or Cerulean drakes, but those felt a tad too pretentious.

Baba Naga.flavorText: A folktale told to Naga children to scare them from swimming too close to the surface.

Babbling Book.flavorText: His idol is the Green Hills of Stranglethorn, and he won't shut up about it.

Backfire.flavorText: "That's the last time I let an imp spit gasoline into my car."

Backroom Bouncer.flavorText: "WHY ARE YOU IN THE BACK ROOM? WHO IS WATCHING THE FRONT?!"

Backstab.flavorText: It's funny how often yelling "Look over there!" gets your opponent to turn around.

Backstage Bouncer.flavorText: Doesn't see your name on the list. Also doesn't know how to read the names on the list.

Backstreet Leper.flavorText: Quit playing games with his heart. And his fingers. And foot. It's rude.

Bad Luck Albatross.flavorText: Legend holds that it's bad luck to harm it. So maybe just pat it on the head, okay?

Bad Omen.flavorText: What good is a sign from alien life if I CAN'T EVEN READ IT?!

Badlands Brawler.flavorText: Watch out watch out watch out - R.K.O. outta nowhere!

Bait and Switch.flavorText: Oh my god, the bait and switch works every time!

Baited Arrow.flavorText: The card is common, but the steak is rare.

Baku the Mooneater.flavorText: In her defense, it did look like a cookie.

Balinda Stonehearth.flavorText: Imagine her surprise, ending up in a game called Hearthstone.

Ball Hog.flavorText: "There's no hog in team... ANYMORE! I QUIT!"

Balloon Merchant.flavorText: It's a shiny yellow balloon! But it can be popped with a single point of damage.

Banana Buffoon.flavorText: You could say he has a certain appeal.

Banana Vendor.flavorText: There's always money in the banana stand.

Bandersmosh.flavorText: The Shudderwock finds him particularly frumious.

Bane of Doom.flavorText: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.

Banjosaur.flavorText: You'll all be singing along once he gets to the tyranno-chorus.

Barak Kodobane.flavorText: They say he's a pro at horseback archery.

Barbaric Sorceress.flavorText: Her four arms are for casting, and her forearms are for crushing.

Bargain Bin.flavorText: Used to contain Worgen Greaser until SOMEONE started buffing it.

Bargain Bin Buccaneer.flavorText: Thrift stores have the best buccaneers.

Baritone Imp.flavorText: He used to be an epic sax guy, but now he's just a common.

Barkskin.flavorText: Make like a tree… and gain armor.

Barnes.flavorText: He used to play every part, until Moroes confiscated his Orb of Deception.

Baron Geddon.flavorText: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.

Baron Rivendare.flavorText: There used to be five Horsemen but one of them left because a job opened up in the deadmines and the benefits were better.

Baroness Vashj.flavorText: Vashj was supposed to make an appearance in "The Sunken City," but after a freak accident in "Ashes of Outland," she ended up here.

Barrel of Monkeys.flavorText: There used to be four monkeys, but then one fell off and bumped his head.

Barrens Blacksmith.flavorText: "Maybe someday you’ll make it to Gadgetzan, kid."

Barrens Scavenger.flavorText: When the hundredth centaur dropped, so did her bracers.

Barrens Trapper.flavorText: Just add a bit of murloc meat for bait. Beasts can’t resist that special seasoning…

Barricade.flavorText: The Alliance and Horde join forces to enforce the fire safety capacity.

Bartend-O-Bot.flavorText: Bartend-O-Bot! Make my Outcast card DO SOMETHING!

Bash.flavorText: You might think bashing doesn't take a lot of practice. It doesn't.

Batterhead.flavorText: When it comes to problem-solving, he always uses his head.

Battle Rage.flavorText: "You won't like me when I'm angry."

Battle Vicar.flavorText: She's the most down-to-earth paladin you'll ever meet... until she stands up.

Battlefield Necromancer.flavorText: Coming soon: the Hand Necromancer and the Deck Necromancer.

Battlefiend.flavorText: Say what you like about my hatchet-headed hooligan, he’s my battle-friend.

Battleground Battlemaster.flavorText: Farm! No wait… Mine! No wait… 3 to Smith—they're taking Farm. Get there now!

Battlepickaxe.flavorText: You can pick your battles, and you can pick your axes, but you can't uh… pick your friends' battlepickaxes?

Battleworn Faceless.flavorText: "I shall hug him and squeeze him and call him Earthen George."

Battleworn Vanguard.flavorText: "Welcome to Dun Baldar Felwings! Do you want 'em mild, spicy, or BURNING Legion?"

Batty Guest.flavorText: His favorite food is chocolate cereal.

Bayfin Bodybuilder.flavorText: Loves to run in flow motion.

Bazaar Burglary.flavorText: Just when you set up your "All-Natural Scented Candles" at the farmer's market and then some STUPID KOBOLD COMES AND TAKES THEM ALL!

Bazaar Mugger.flavorText: Premium muggings at a discount price.

Beached Whale.flavorText: Call me Illidan. Some years ago — never mind how long precisely — having little or no gold in my purse, and nothing particular to interest me on Azeroth, I thought I would fly about a little and see the demony part of the world…

Beakered Lightning.flavorText: Working in a shaman's lab, it's important to be well-grounded.

Beaming Sidekick.flavorText: Sure, I'll carry the water! And the food! And the tents! And the cursed monkey paw!

Bear Trap.flavorText: You'll never guess what's in that conveniently bear-sized, bear-smelling box.

Bearon Gla'shear.flavorText: When you get hit by a royally bad pun, you just have to grin and bear it.

Beastmaster Leoroxx.flavorText: Father of Rexxar, Champion of the Horde, and Flexxar, Champion of the Gym.

Beaststalker Tavish.flavorText: Tavish left home to forge his own path. But it still led him back to Alterac to kick some Frostwolf butt.

Beatboxer.flavorText: "ERROR. CANNOT COMPUTE 'NO PUNCHING ALLOWED DURING MUSICAL PERFORMANCE'."

Belligerent Gnome.flavorText: Maybe don't put this one in your garden.

Bellowing Flames.flavorText: Too much bellowing. Not enough flames.

Bellringer Sentry.flavorText: "Who are you? Eh, none of my business."

Beneath the Grounds.flavorText: Can you hold these eggs for just a second? I promise they're not full of giant enraged undead spider things.

Benevolent Banker.flavorText: "Oh no, you've got me confused. I'm Ben, the evil ent banker. I only work with evil trees!"

Benevolent Djinn.flavorText: Wish 1: funnel cakes. Wish 2: funnel cakes. Wish 3: FUNNEL CAKES.

Beryllium Nullifier.flavorText: Why Beryllium? Because it's hard to spell.

Best in Shell.flavorText: The agility course takes a while.

Bestial Madness.flavorText: "Hey this isn't what we were trying to excavate!"

Bestial Wrath.flavorText: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface. Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.

Betrayal.flavorText: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.

Bibliomite.flavorText: He did NOT want to cast a spell.

Big Bad Archmage.flavorText: "My, my, what big minions I have!"

Big Dreams.flavorText: Just a small town Taunka Livin' in a lonely... waunka

Big Game Hunter.flavorText: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him. Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.

Big Ol' Whelp.flavorText: A chonker, a real absolute unit.

Big-Time Racketeer.flavorText: "It'd be a shame if someone disenchanted those Legendaries."

Bilefin Tidehunter.flavorText: Bile actually makes for surprisingly sturdy fins.

Binding Heal.flavorText: By accepting this healing, you agree to the following terms…

Biology Project.flavorText: Step 1: Grow giant evil strawberry. Step 2: ???? Step 3: Rule Azeroth!

Bioluminescence.flavorText: The perfect card for Spell Damage Shaman and Spelling Bee Shaman.

Birdwatching.flavorText: A bird in the hand is worth two in the deck.

Bittertide Hydra.flavorText: It's actually only the middle head that's bitter. The others are sweet and spicy.

Black Cat.flavorText: She's so odd, you can't even.

Black Hole.flavorText: That's right! The square goes in the black hole.

Black Morass Imposter.flavorText: Does something seem off about Medivh's apprentice to you?

Blackguard.flavorText: "Did I ever tell you the story of when I single-handedly took down a 29/29 C'thun?" - Reno Jackson

Blackhowl Gunspire.flavorText: The upper windows used to be for aiming. Then we thought: "Hey! MORE cannons!"

Blackjack Stunner.flavorText: "I'm about to ruin this 10-cost minion's whole career."

Blackrock 'n' Roll.flavorText: Thank goodness it's not called Black-ska Mountain.

Blackscale Brute.flavorText: Black, the scales of angry Naga! Red, the flames of Azshari's past!

Blacksmithing Hammer.flavorText: Passed through the hands of countless smiths, and eventually the skulls of their enemies.

Blackwater Behemoth.flavorText: What's a Blackwater Behemoth's favorite meal? Fish n' Ships.

Blackwater Cutlass.flavorText: Popular around Stormwind for slashing prices.

Blackwater Pirate.flavorText: "Look, they fell off the back of a ship, do you want them or not? I have a meeting with Y'Shaarj in like ten minutes."

Blackwing Corruptor.flavorText: He got his name when he gave Blackwing some comic books and rock & roll records.

Blackwing Technician.flavorText: This is who you go to when your Blackwing needs a tune up. Don't go to a cut rate Blackwing tune up shop!

Blade Dance.flavorText: The surest way to clear the dance floor.

Blade Flurry.flavorText: "Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast. It's a lot more complicated than that." - Shan, Rogue Trainer

Blade of C'Thun.flavorText: C'Thun demands a sacrifice! Preferably a Deathwing.

Bladed Cultist.flavorText: He has a poor understanding of the law of diminishing returns.

Bladed Lady.flavorText: While you were busy learning magic, she studied the blade.

Blademaster Okani.flavorText: Yet ANOTHER sword fighter that spams counters.

Blademaster Samuro.flavorText: Artists paint their visions meticulously on canvas. Blademasters paint with, uh, broader strokes.

Bladestorm.flavorText: Dear minions: Woosh, woosh, woosh, woosh, woosh. Best regards, Bladestorm

Blast Tortoise.flavorText: Who's that minion? ... Iiiiit's Blast Tortoise! "Blast tortoise."

Blast Wave.flavorText: If you’re burning and you know it, wave your hands!

Blastcrystal Potion.flavorText: There's a fine line between "potion" and "grenade". Wait. Actually, there's not.

Blastmaster Boom.flavorText: He's gonna fly through the air with the greatest of grease.

Blatant Decoy.flavorText: "Hah! You is being tricked by ME! Togwaggle!"

Blazecaller.flavorText: For when a flamecaller just won't do.

Blazing Accretion.flavorText: Much like the Draenei, this Elemental just wants a place to call home. Unlike the Draenei, it incinerates everything it touches.

Blazing Battlemage.flavorText: Weaponized an ancient technique once used to slice cold butter.

Blazing Invocation.flavorText: A lot of shaman have started vaping their invocations.

Blazing Power.flavorText: Apply heat directly to the damaged area.

Blazing Transmutation.flavorText: Congratulations! Your minion evolved into a Fire type!

Blessed Champion.flavorText: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

Blessed Goods.flavorText: Guaranteed to contain no haunted dolls, cursed rings, or corrupted runeblades, or your money back.

Blessing of Authority.flavorText: A paladin fights with honor! We don't go face... until next turn!

Blessing of Kings.flavorText: Given the number of kings who have been assassinated, are you sure you want their blessing?

Blessing of Might.flavorText: "As in, you MIGHT want to get out of my way." - Toad Mackle, recently buffed.

Blessing of Wisdom.flavorText: Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.

Blightblood Berserker.flavorText: He should really go see a dentist about that tusk. And a dermatologist. And a therapist.

Blightnozzle Crawler.flavorText: "Well we HAD it contained. Then you went and gave it legs!"

Blind Box.flavorText: THREE Flame Imps?? C'mon, where's my pity timer?!

Blingtron 3000.flavorText: PREPARE PARTY SERVOS FOR IMMEDIATE DEPLOYMENT.

Blink Fox.flavorText: It's like, SUPER bad at staring contests.

Blistering Rot.flavorText: Known as 'Fel Gel' to the Illidari, it's excellent protection against harsh Draenic sunshine.

Blizzard.flavorText: This spell can be very Entertaining.

Bloated Python.flavorText: This is why Scholomance engineering students prefer C++.

Blood Boil.flavorText: And once your blood is at a boil, throw in the plaguetti.

Blood Crusader.flavorText: Defending Silvermoon takes a lot of blood, sweat, tears, and blood.

Blood Guard.flavorText: Has never donated blood and doesn’t plan on ever doing so.

Blood Imp.flavorText: Imps are content to hide and viciously taunt everyone nearby.

Blood Knight.flavorText: The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.

Blood Matriarch Liadrin.flavorText: All's fair in blood and war.

Blood Razor.flavorText: For the close shave that you've always wanted. Caution: Very sharp.

Blood Shard Bristleback.flavorText: I'm bringin' bristle back (Yeah) Those other minions don't know how to act (Yeah) I think it's special how these crystals crack (Yeah) So turn around and I'll give you a smack (Yeah) (Take 'em to the Barrens)

Blood Tap.flavorText: Come join us in the tavern! We have whatever you're drinking on tap. Yes, even that.

Blood To Ichor.flavorText: For his next trick, he turns the ichor back to blood and stuffs it back in you.

Blood Treant.flavorText: The blood of my enemies makes for some great fertilizer!

Blood Troll Sapper.flavorText: Main supplier of Blood Troll Syrup to the Intercontinental Hut of Funnel Cakes.

Blood Warriors.flavorText: They have an uneasy rivalry with the Blood Paladins.

Blood Witch.flavorText: Like a sloppy joe for vampires.

Blood in the Water.flavorText: Fish are friends, not food! Gilgoblins on the other hand…

Blood of G'huun.flavorText: An attempted cure becomes disease, blooming and thriving as rot and decay.

Blood of The Ancient One.flavorText: Add two cups of Blood of the Ancient One to one cup of lemon juice. Add just a dash of sugar and stir. Delicious!

Blood-Queen Lana'thel.flavorText: As a young blood-princess she learned the proper way for a lady to curtsy, how to address fellow members of royalty, and how to bite them.

Bloodbloom.flavorText: Help save mana. Donate blood today!

Bloodboil Brute.flavorText: Call Gurtogg a brute if you like, but no one else cares about the wounded like he does.

Bloodbound Imp.flavorText: ALWAYS read the terms and conditions.

Bloodclaw.flavorText: This weapon – ow! Requires a little – OWW! Finesse.

Bloodfury Potion.flavorText: You know what really makes my blood boil? The skyrocketing price of Bloodfury potions!

Bloodhoof Brave.flavorText: He thought the set was called "Flippers of the Old Cods" and hungrily volunteered to be in it. He is definitely going to get his hearing checked.

Bloodied Knight.flavorText: Chillwind Yeti would NEVER betray you like this.

Bloodmage Thalnos.flavorText: He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!

Bloodreaver Gul'dan.flavorText: "Still you refuse to bend your knee? None can escape death, you old fool. And in death… all will serve me…"

Bloodsail Corsair.flavorText: Every pirate uses the same four digits to access Automated Gold Dispensers. It's called the "Pirate's Code".

Bloodsail Cultist.flavorText: They're really just in it for the Blood Parrot.

Bloodsail Flybooter.flavorText: They’re pretty fly for some pirate guys.

Bloodsail Howler.flavorText: They saw their fate a closin' Aboard a pirate ship On deck: The Howlin' Hozen About to let one rip.

Bloodsail Raider.flavorText: "I only plunder on days that end in 'y'."

Bloodsail Recruiter.flavorText: I want YOU! To plunder from the innocent!

Bloodscalp Strategist.flavorText: “Shoot them in the face” is more of a tactic than a strategy.

Bloodscent Vilefin.flavorText: Tired of eating Jellyfish and Peanut Butter fish, it’s moved on to more gruesome meals.

Bloodseeker.flavorText: What do you mean shooting them in the back isn’t honorable?!

Bloodsworn Mercenary.flavorText: You look really hurt. You could use a friend!

Bloodworm.flavorText: Queen Lana'thel insists on one of these, fried, every morning for breakfast.

Blowgill Sniper.flavorText: Imagine how much further his darts would go if he had lungs instead of gills!

Blowtorch Saboteur.flavorText: Before he came along, we went through a lot of duct tape.

Blubber Baron.flavorText: When oil, railroad, steel, robber, and red are all already taken, your options are limited.

Bluegill Warrior.flavorText: He just wants a hug. A sloppy... slimy... hug.

Blur.flavorText: "What are you trying to tell me? That I can dodge axes?" "I’m trying to tell you that when you’re a Demon Hunter, you won’t have to."

Body Wrapper.flavorText: She uses pickle slices for the eyes. Keeps them well-preserved.

Bog Beast.flavorText: I'm sure at least one of those bones is from an actual beast.

Bog Creeper.flavorText: He's tried other things, but bog sidling, bog ambling, and bog trundling just aren't as effective as bog creeping.

Bog Slosher.flavorText: It's the bane of freshly mopped floors everywhere.

Bogbeam.flavorText: Some think the mysterious bright lights in the bog are alien invaders, others think they're just swamp gas. Turns out, it's just druids.

Boggspine Knuckles.flavorText: I would NOT want to put my hand in there. It's... SQUISHY.

Bogshaper.flavorText: The tricky part is getting them to HOLD their shape.

Bogstrok Clacker.flavorText: This clacker's crackers for hacking slackers into whack attackers.

Boisterous Bard.flavorText: As a kid, she fought with rocks. Now she fights with ROCK!

Bola Shot.flavorText: On second thought, bolas aren't very good against flying worms.

Bolf Ramshield.flavorText: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament. It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.

Bolner Hammerbeak.flavorText: Show him how to do something once, and he can do it a thousand times. This turn.

Bolster.flavorText: The best offense is a good defense.

Bolvar Fordragon.flavorText: Spoiler alert: Bolvar gets melted and then sits on an ice throne and everyone forgets about him.

Bomb Lobber.flavorText: He lobbies Orgrimmar daily on behalf of bombs.

Bomb Squad.flavorText: Please don't explode! Please don't explode! Please don't explode!

Bomb Wrangler.flavorText: Bomb Wranglers tend to have short fuses and even shorter lifespans.

Bone Breaker.flavorText: Many weapons are bone breakers if you swing hard enough.

Bone Drake.flavorText: The bone drake brings all the dragons to the yard. He would teach you, but you have no cards.

Bone Flinger.flavorText: It’s the scourge bringing, plague slinging, bone flinging basher!

Bone Glaive.flavorText: Resourceful Demon Hunters find a use for every part of the Demon.

Bone Wraith.flavorText: It uses only the eco-friendly bones from free-range humanoids.

Bonecaller.flavorText: Hello, am I speaking to the undead of the household? We have been trying to reach you about your skeleton's extended warranty.

Bonechewer Brawler.flavorText: When you get this swole, arrows are basically free acupuncture.

Bonechewer Raider.flavorText: And if that minion has a frisbee, LOOK OUT!

Bonechewer Vanguard.flavorText: She came here to taunt you and chew on bones, and she's all outta bones.

Bonedigger Geist.flavorText: He's a grave-half-full kind of geist.

Boneguard Lieutenant.flavorText: Underneath all that impressive armor, he's just skin and bones. Okay, maybe just bones.

Bonelord Frostwhisper.flavorText: Downside? Not if you want to be a Death Knight!

Bonemare.flavorText: Attacks her job with unbridled enthusiasm.

Boneshredder.flavorText: Is that his makeup or just his natural fur pattern?

Boneweb Egg.flavorText: Noblegarden is going to be really exciting this year!

Boogie Down.flavorText: Whatever you do, do NOT sashay to the right.

Book Wyrm.flavorText: His favorites are classic tragedies like "The Hobbit" and "Grendel".

Book of Specters.flavorText: Known throughout the land as the Spooky-nomicon.

Boom Squad.flavorText: Discover the meaning of squad goals.

Boom Wrench.flavorText: Boom, the Inventor; Can he fix it? Boom, the Inventor; No he can't!

Boomboss Tho'grun.flavorText: Ever since the Bloodrock Company hired this guy, business has been booming!

Boomkin.flavorText: Some Druids consider balance to be a state of harmony between the Natural and the Arcane. Others are more focused on the balance of the opponent’s life total versus their own.

Boommaster Flark.flavorText: Every good plan requires a bit of patience. And a lot of explosives.

Boon of the Ascended.flavorText: Ascension is not some external power granted to you, it is the power you find within yourself.

Bootstrap Sunkeneer.flavorText: Part of the deck, part of the crew.

Booty Bay Bodyguard.flavorText: You can hire him... until someone offers him enough gold to turn on you.

Booty Bay Bookie.flavorText: Also makes a great librarian. She's really good at fixing books!

Bottomfeeder.flavorText: Someone keeps adding fish to my deck, and I'm going to get to the bottom of it.

Bottomless Toy Chest.flavorText: That's right, it goes in the toy chest.

Boulderfist Ogre.flavorText: "ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST"

Bouldering Buddy.flavorText: Why would you buy a walking stick when the forest is full of them!?

Bouncing Blade.flavorText: Only goblins would think this was a good idea. Even they are starting to have their doubts.

Bounty Board.flavorText: Reno's desire to be a face known around the Badlands might have backfired a little bit.

Bounty Wrangler.flavorText: With a smile like that and Coins in her hands, she's one greedy grinner.

Bovine Skeleton.flavorText: The secret cow level has been unearthed.

Brain Freeze.flavorText: "The professor called on me, and I totally froze!"

Brainstormer.flavorText: Her hair was always like that.

Branching Paths.flavorText: Three paths diverged in a darkened hall, and I – I took the one less traveled by, And got eaten by a slime.

Brann Bronzebeard.flavorText: Contains 75% more fiber than his brother Magni!

Brass Elemental.flavorText: You handle the water spells. It's got the earth, wind, and fire covered.

Brass Knuckles.flavorText: For the goon that wants to make a fashion statement.

Brasswing.flavorText: I’ve seen this before. You just have to time it right to avoid the dragon.

Brawl.flavorText: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?

Brazen Zealot.flavorText: Some paladins really Light it up.

Breakdance.flavorText: "Commander! Uhh... I'm... Pretty sure we just got served? I'm not really trained for this."

Breath of Dreams.flavorText: Ysera has the worst morning breath.

Breath of Sindragosa.flavorText: Is it cold in here or is it just Sindragosa?

Bridge Riff.flavorText: Can be played in other places too.

Brightwing.flavorText: Little faerie dragons are made of sugar and spice and maniacal vice.

Brilliant Macaw.flavorText: He's been repeating the same shanty for a month. Four pirates walked the plank last week. Middle of the ocean, just walked right off.

Bring It On!.flavorText: Brrr, it's cold in here. Let's hope she doesn't have an Auctioneer!

Brittlebone Buccaneer.flavorText: How much does a pirate pay for corn? A buck an ear arr arr arrr arrr!

Brittlebone Destroyer.flavorText: Broke many a leg in drama class.

Brittleskin Zombie.flavorText: I was born with glass bones and paper skin.

Bronze Dragonknight.flavorText: He had been here before, and in some ways, he would always be fighting in Silithus.

Bronze Explorer.flavorText: Always ready to explore new friendships! Except with Deathwing.

Bronze Gatekeeper.flavorText: "You have my shield! And the rest of me too."

Bronze Herald.flavorText: This is why you shouldn’t shoot the messenger.

Brrrloc.flavorText: He may be frozen fish, but he fights fresh!

Bru'kan.flavorText: Bru'kan, his body weathered and weary, felt his time nearing its end. Teaching brave champions like Rokara gives him hope for a greater future.

Bru'kan of the Elements.flavorText: The elements crackled through Bru'kan's veins and his life flashed before his eyes. He knew this moment would come, but he wondered, had he given them enough?

Brutal Annihilan.flavorText: Sometimes, problems can be solved by throwing everything you've got at it. This is not one of those times.

Buccaneer.flavorText: The best part of buccaneering is the pants.

Bucket of Soldiers.flavorText: Life is like a bucket of soldiers. You never know what bonus effects you're gonna get.

Buffet Biggun.flavorText: "Look, I just want to know what kind of monster put raisins in this."

Bug Collector.flavorText: The only one who likes BEEEES!!!

Build a Snowman.flavorText: This is the coolest spell once you get it rolling.

Building-Block Golem.flavorText: I HOPE YOU STEP ON A 1-COST MINION!

Bulk Up.flavorText: "For breakfast I usually go for a couple of kodo steaks, 5 Plainstrider eggs and an ice-cold milk to wash it down… all raw."

Bull Dozer.flavorText: Leave them alone for two minutes and they go right into sleep mode.

Bulwark of Azzinoth.flavorText: This plate turned shield you shall wield, praying its powers fel will serve you well.

Bumbling Bellhop.flavorText: Put some respect on his name: Estebone Soulio Screamcardo Groantoya De la Grossa Ramirooze.

Bunny Stomper.flavorText: Has a PhD in stomputational chemistry.

Burden of Pride.flavorText: A group of burdens is called a pride.

Burgly Bully.flavorText: He only burgles to pay the bills. He is really just a bully at heart.

Burly Rockjaw Trogg.flavorText: He's burly because he does CrossFit.

Burndown.flavorText: Trust me, the next 3 cards in my deck are FIRE.

Burning Blade Acolyte.flavorText: Wields a disappointingly normal looking blade.

Burning Heart.flavorText: A 100% ethically sourced fire elemental heart is very hard to come by. This one definitely wasn't.

Burrow Buster.flavorText: We almost went with the name "Giant Drill", but then it would've HAD to be an 8/8.

Burrowing Scorpid.flavorText: It's a game of hide and go sting.

Busy Peon.flavorText: Chopping wood, mining gold and repairing buildings? None of these pursuits called to Grob...pencil doodling on wood was his true labor of love.

Buttons.flavorText: "I'll give you an arm and a leg for your Flametongue Pin."

C'Thun.flavorText: C'Thun's least favorite Hearthstone card: Eye for an Eye.

C'Thun's Chosen.flavorText: He gave her a promise ring and everything.

C'Thun, the Shattered.flavorText: My grandfather's deck has no useless cards!

Cabal Acolyte.flavorText: How did he get to the top of his class? He pulled a few strings!

Cabal Shadow Priest.flavorText: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....

Cabalist's Tome.flavorText: What's in there? I bet it's cookie recipes!

Cactus Construct.flavorText: "I am not Malfurion! I am CACTUS LORD!"

Cactus Rager.flavorText: What doesn't kill ya makes you deader.

Cage Head.flavorText: You get your head stuck in a cage ONCE, and all of a sudden you've got a new nickname.

Cagematch Custodian.flavorText: Cleans up after a dust up.

Cairne Bloodhoof.flavorText: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck. It's pretty insensitive.

Call in the Finishers.flavorText: When you really need a job done… but you don't really care if it gets done right.

Call of the Grave.flavorText: Necromancy is motivational speaking for the dead.

Call of the Wild.flavorText: "Hello. Misha, Leokk and Huffer aren't here right now, but if you leave a message we'll get back to you right away." BEEP.

Call to Adventure.flavorText: Even the smallest minion can change the outcome of the game.

Call to Arms.flavorText: More personal than a text to arms.

Call to the Stand.flavorText: Don't worry, there is a chair for you to sit in. It's very misleading.

Camouflage Mount.flavorText: What mount? I don't see anything…

Camouflaged Dirigible.flavorText: "What does that cloud look like to you?" "Trouble."

Canal Slogger.flavorText: "Another Monday in the canals huh? What a slog."

Candle Breath.flavorText: "And Waxadred shall light their fires, with roaring breath hotter than pyres! Come before him, scamp and vandal, pledge your faith and lift your candle!"

Candleraiser.flavorText: You would not believe your eyes If ten million kobold guys Lit up the world to this ogre beat

Candleshot.flavorText: Once called Cahn’delar, Shortbow of the Ancient Whisker.

Cannibalize.flavorText: The Silvermoon health inspector has some choice words for the Lich King.

Cannon Barrage.flavorText: Why fire your cannons strategically when you can fire them all at once?

Cannonmaster Smythe.flavorText: "Smythe, it's been a real blast serving the Alliance with you."

Captain Galvangar.flavorText: It wasn't the ravages of war that took Galvangar, it was hypothermia.

Captain Greenskin.flavorText: He was this close to piloting a massive juggernaut into Stormwind Harbor. If it weren't for those pesky kids!

Captain's Log.flavorText: Akama loves a nice comfy log to captain on.

Captain's Parrot.flavorText: Pirates and Parrots go together like Virmen and Carrots.

Capture Coldtooth Mine.flavorText: We hit a huge haul! Or wait… no, it's just a coin.

Captured Jormungar.flavorText: You can keep him, but you have to promise to feed him and clean out his tank every day!

Carefree Cookie.flavorText: Moisturized, unbothered, and in his cauldron.

Careless Crafter.flavorText: How about YOU try folding paper with only three fingers!?

Caria Felsoul.flavorText: This is what happens when you keep taking the advice of the little demon on your shoulder.

Caricature Artist.flavorText: "Pfffft…. You look RIDICULOUS! And I haven't even drawn the mustache yet!"

Cariel Roame.flavorText: Cariel had pledged her honor to the Alliance, but when someone matching her long-lost sister's description was sighted at the Crossroads, Cariel did the unthinkable: she abandoned her post and set out across the Barrens.

Carnival Barker.flavorText: The barking initially confused faire-goers, so he switched to words.

Carnivorous Cube.flavorText: He's always grumpy until he's eaten his first barista of the morning.

Carnivorous Cubicle.flavorText: Hey, no eating at your desk!

Carousel Gryphon.flavorText: "When does this bird land in Stormwind? I've been flying for hours!"

Carress, Cabaret Star.flavorText: Some Naga use their mastery over the elements to go on villainous conquests. Others put on a show!

Carrion Drake.flavorText: Fits easily into overhead luggage bins.

Carrion Studies.flavorText: A good read but a little too much fluff.

Carving Chisel.flavorText: Look at your stone. Visualize the totem within. Then gently...

Cascading Disaster.flavorText: Please keep all hands, arms, feet and legs inside the ride until the monster comes to a complete stop.

Cat Trick.flavorText: "I know some new tricks, a lot of good tricks. I will show them to you. Medivh will not mind at all if I do."

Cataclysm.flavorText: RUN FROM SKY CANDLES! THEY BURN! RUN!

Catacomb Guard.flavorText: A little dark down here. So much for "serving the Light."

Catch of the Day.flavorText: Only its fish mother thinks it's a catch.

Cathedral Gargoyle.flavorText: Fly like an eagle, drop like a rock.

Cathedral of Atonement.flavorText: You'll actually find more than one tonement here.

Catrina Muerte.flavorText: She always manages to lift your spirits.

Cattle Rustler.flavorText: What once started as a small-time cat burglary gig has turned into a life of cattle rustling. What a shame.

Cauldron Elemental.flavorText: Decorating tip: Unused cauldrons can make a lovely elemental display.

Cavalry Horn.flavorText: The clarion call of the Alliance skipping every objective and going straight to Drek’Thar.

Cave Hydra.flavorText: Can be upgraded into a Cave Lurker.

Cavern Shinyfinder.flavorText: They call her the candled vandal.

Celestial Alignment.flavorText: "Is my deck any good?" "I mean, if the stars align."

Celestial Dreamer.flavorText: If you think her job is easy, YOU try falling asleep on cue.

Celestial Ink Set.flavorText: "Dear Mother, I have a lot of spells and burst in my hand. You should maybe run more armor and healing next time. Cordially, Your child"

Celestial Projectionist.flavorText: What if we're not really here, y'know? What if we're all just, like, projections in the mind of some cosmic entity? How would we know?

Cenarion Hold.flavorText: After the War of the Shifting Sands, Cenarion Hold became a strategic outpost, awaiting the moment when the armies of C'Thun would rise once again.

Cenarion Ward.flavorText: Don't ask about his right hand. He's still growing into it.

Cenarius.flavorText: Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.

Cera'thine Fleetrunner.flavorText: World Record CTF Champion 16 years running.

Ceremonial Maul.flavorText: For the most discerning of hall monitors.

Chain Lightning (Rank 1).flavorText: Still better than receiving a chain letter.

Chained Guardian.flavorText: Eternally jealous of the Unchained Gladiator.

Chalk Artist.flavorText: Well it's either a dragon or a dinosaur - chalk it up to art style.

Chameleos.flavorText: He's everyone you want to be.

Champion of Storms.flavorText: Has some grievances it just can't wait to air out.

Chaos Creation.flavorText: So THIS is who's been Greening everything!

Chaos Gazer.flavorText: No matter the game rules, it's always playing Go Fish.

Chaos Nova.flavorText: Illin' Illidan laying down the damage, flinging out the chaos as far as he can manage.

Chaos Strike.flavorText: "What do we want?" "CHAOS!" "When do we want it?" "WHEN LEAST EXPECTED!"

Chaotic Consumption.flavorText: You're not you when you're hungry.

Chaotic Tendril.flavorText: "So are you good, evil, or neutral?" "Just chaotic."

Char.flavorText: There's just no point trying to add flavor to this now.

Charge.flavorText: "Guys! Guys! Slow down!" - some kind of non-warrior minion

Charged Call.flavorText: You have a collect call from "AL'AKIR, LORD OF AIR AND THE FOUR WINDS." Do you accept these charges?

Charged Devilsaur.flavorText: What happens when a dinosaur mixes soda and pop rocks.

Charged Hammer.flavorText: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.

Chatty Bartender.flavorText: "So a Venthyr, an Old God, and a Tauren walk into a bar…"

Chatty Macaw.flavorText: Stop repeating yourself! Stop repeating yourself!

Cheaty Anklebiter.flavorText: Famed hunter of the deadly Achilliosaur.

Cheaty Snobold.flavorText: This one will knock you out cold.

Cheesemonger.flavorText: Secretly, the Big Cheese of SI:7.

Chef Nomi.flavorText: His cooking is always very well done.

Chemical Spill.flavorText: I said spill the TEA, not the acid!

Chenvaala.flavorText: Like the Dragon Soul. If dragons had souls of ice.

Chief Inspector.flavorText: Empty your pockets, I know you’ve got a Wandering Monster in there!

Chill Vibes.flavorText: "You're listening to 47.7 Shaman FM radio. It's time to kick back, relax, and take in the music."

Chill-o-matic.flavorText: After a number of island vacations, he thought the Storm Peaks would be a nice change of pace.

Chillblade Champion.flavorText: It slices, it dices, it vaporizes! The Chillblade will make a Champion out of even the lowliest gnome.

Chillfallen Baron.flavorText: He hates when people call 60 degree weather cold.

Chillin' Vol'jin.flavorText: After one visit to the cryopractor, YOU TOO can be chillin' like a Vol'jin!

Chillmaw.flavorText: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!

Chillwind Yeti.flavorText: He always dreamed of coming down from the mountains and opening a noodle shop, but he never got the nerve.

Chittering Tunneler.flavorText: Ear to the ground, he carefully interpreted the chittering noises: “You wanna cast a spell? I wanna cast a spell!”

Cho'gall.flavorText: Even after all this time, Gul'dan still makes Cho'gall go get donuts and coffee.

Cho'gall, Twilight Chieftain.flavorText: He's got it all, the gumption, gall, and Cho.

Chopshop Copter.flavorText: Invention is the mother of entropy.

Chorus Riff.flavorText: What do you mean, what do you mean, I SAY WHAT DO YOU MEEEEEAN, mean, mean, meaaaaaaan this chorus is repetitive?

Chromaggus.flavorText: Left head and right head can never agree about what to eat for dinner, so they always end up just eating ramen again.

Chromatic Egg.flavorText: Nefarian was known for creating two things: horrible monsters and excellent breakfasts.

Chromie, Timehopper.flavorText: "Noz, you're telling me you built a time machine...out of a Hearthstone card?"

Chronobreaker.flavorText: If he asks to borrow your watch, just say no.

Chum Bucket.flavorText: Time to go in for the krill.

Ci'Cigi.flavorText: She once bought a 1of1 Golden Skull of Gul'dan written entirely in Thalassian for 2,000,000 Gold.

Cinderstorm.flavorText: Forecast: "Cloudy with a chance of fireballs."

Circus Amalgam.flavorText: Who needs a petting zoo when you have all the creatures right here?!

Circus Medic.flavorText: Just be careful not to mix this with any creepy eyeballs, tentacles, or dark whispers, and you'll be fine in the morning.

City Architect.flavorText: "Oh, wait, I had this turned the wrong way. This was supposed to be a tower."

City Tax.flavorText: "Look pal, I don't care what kind of legion you saved the world from, pay up or else."

Clash of the Colossals.flavorText: Don’t let this distract you from the fact that in 1998, Ozumat threw Neptulon off Shell in a Cell, and plummeted 16 fathoms through an announcer’s table.

Class Action Lawyer.flavorText: "Have you or a loved one ever been injured in a Consecration?"

Claw.flavorText: The claw decides who will stay and who will go.

Clawfury Adept.flavorText: The Inept Clawfury is a danger only to themselves.

Clay Matriarch.flavorText: I hope you didn't need all that purple clay.

Clean the Scene.flavorText: Not even the holy Light can get anima out of white silk.

Clear Conscience.flavorText: Do you swear to give the buff, the whole buff, and nothing but the buff, so help you Kyrestia?

Clear the Way.flavorText: The terrifying part is the gryphons' squeaky voices afterward.

Clearance Promoter.flavorText: "Sorry, we just sold our last Worgen Greaser figure."

Cleave.flavorText: Hey you two…could you stand next to each other for a second…

Cleric of An'she.flavorText: When it's her turn to cook, she'll always go for a Light sear.

Cleric of Scales.flavorText: If she can't find a spell, it's a clerical error.

Cliff Dive.flavorText: "Is it safe?" "Sure, we have plenty of replacement pirates."

Climactic Necrotic Explosion.flavorText: The less legible the band's logo, the more hardcore it is.

Climbing Hook.flavorText: "It LOOKS like a grappling hook but it's actually a climbing hook. It's a really important distinction you just wouldn't get it."

Cloak of Shadows.flavorText: Only worthy emperors can see the cloak.

Cloaked Huntress.flavorText: She's practically GIVING your secrets away!

Cloakscale Chemist.flavorText: Her suit was fitted using a scale model.

Clockwork Automaton.flavorText: Most mechs are pretty chill, but this one is all wound up.

Clockwork Giant.flavorText: He and Mountain Giant don't get along.

Clockwork Gnome.flavorText: Clockwork gnomes are always asking what time it is.

Clockwork Knight.flavorText: It takes a lot to wind him up.

Cloning Device.flavorText: Zerek got sick of fighting over the remote.

Cloud Prince.flavorText: "In West Cloudidelphia, born and raised; flinging lightning for the rest of my days."

Clownfish.flavorText: His jokes are hilarious if you know Nerglish.

Clumsy Steward.flavorText: "Aww, bummer! I spilled coffee all over your cards! Dang it! What a shame!"

Clutchmother Zavas.flavorText: A bit of a snob: still refuses to drive anything with automatic transmission.

Cobalt Guardian.flavorText: Guardians used to be built out of Adamantium, but production got moved to Gadgetzan and Cobalt was cheap.

Cobalt Scalebane.flavorText: You get a sword! And you get a sword! Everybody gets a sword!

Cobalt Spellkin.flavorText: Spews more spells than a sleep-talking wizard.

Cobra Shot.flavorText: "Cobra Shot" hurts way, way, way more than "Cobra Cuddle."

Coconut Cannoneer.flavorText: You think these just fell out of a coconut tree?

Coerce.flavorText: "Give me your lunch money, or the sandwich gets it!"

Coghammer.flavorText: So you ripped this out of a machine, carved some runes on it, stuck it on a handle, and now it's a weapon of great divine power? Seems legit.

Cogmaster.flavorText: After a while, you don't see the cogs and sprockets. All you see is a robot, a spider tank, a deathray...

Cogmaster's Wrench.flavorText: For tightening cogs and smashin' troggs!

Coilfang Constrictor.flavorText: How do you know when someone has a crush on you? They take your breath away.

Coilfang Warlord.flavorText: Prepare for the staunch conch launch!

Coilskar Commander.flavorText: Then thou shalt count to three, no more, no less. Three shall be the number thou shalt count, and the number of the counting shall be three. Four shalt thou not count, neither count thou two, excepting that thou then proceed to three. Five is right out.

Colaque.flavorText: Ten thousand years ago, the city of Zin-Azshari fell to the bottom of the sea... and partially onto Colaque's shell.

Cold Blood.flavorText: "I'm cold blooded, check it and see!"

Cold Case.flavorText: And that's why you keep your skeletons in your closet instead of your freezer.

Cold Feet.flavorText: Looks like some of the dancers still need to warm up.

Cold Storage.flavorText: Sapphiron's favorite treat always was popsicles.

Coldarra Drake.flavorText: The Grand Tournament has a "No dragons allowed" policy, but it's rarely enforced.

Coldlight Oracle.flavorText: They can see the future. In that future both players draw more cards. Spoooky.

Coldlight Seer.flavorText: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths. So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.

Coldtooth Yeti.flavorText: Its arrival heralds the Brain Freeze Yeti.

Colifero the Artist.flavorText: You are what you paint! And Colifero is paint.

Coliseum Manager.flavorText: Meets monthly with the gladiators to discuss career goals.

Colossus of the Moon.flavorText: Strike him down, and you'll face the Colossus of the New Moon.

Combustion.flavorText: Sally is friends with three Silverhand Recruits conveniently standing in a line. After casting this spell, how many friends does she have left? (Show your work.)

Command the Elements.flavorText: What, you expected a shaman to have trouble with a place called STORMWIND?

Command the Illidari.flavorText: Give me an R! Give me a U! Give me an S! Give me an H! You two, you’re exclamation points!

Commander Rhyssa.flavorText: Two people can keep a secret as long as neither of them are Commander Rhyssa.

Commander Sivara.flavorText: With six legs, gills, and an impressive array of magic, Sivara is an all-terrain-spellcaster.

Commander Ulthok.flavorText: He likes to spend his free time in his garden, growing Bloodradish, Bloodcabbage, and his favorite, Bloodbloom.

Commanding Shout.flavorText: "Shout! Shout! Let it all out!" - Advice to warriors-in-training

Commencement.flavorText: "Remember, graduates—you carry a heavy weight on your shoulders now."

Competitive Spirit.flavorText: Competition can be an inspiration to improve oneself. Or kill all the competitors.

Composting.flavorText: The Treants really give their bodies to the cause.

Conceal.flavorText: Rogues conceal everything but their emotions. You can't get 'em to shut up about feelings.

Concert Promo-Drake.flavorText: There's a reason why it's promoting the festival instead of playing in it - it's a rhyme-lost protodrake.

Concierge.flavorText: So THAT'S who's making all those keys for my Arena runs.

Concoctor.flavorText: "A dash of death, with a pinch of death, and a sprinkle of… death!"

Condemn (Rank 1).flavorText: "I wished you no harm, but for your cruelty, by the light, I condemn you all!" Xyrella shouted, unaware that irony was not her strong suit.

Conditioning (Rank 1).flavorText: Now drop and give me 5 Mana.

Conductivity.flavorText: That faceless sure didn't put up a lot of (length/cross-sectional area).

Cone of Cold.flavorText: Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.

Confection Cyclone.flavorText: "Oh, I thought it was a desert elemental?"

Confessor Paletress.flavorText: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears. Most common fear: Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.

Conjure Mana Biscuit.flavorText: So THIS is why she was AFK.

Conjurer's Calling.flavorText: If only you’d let it go to voicemail…

Conqueror's Banner.flavorText: Olgra, I love your new tapestry! Where did you get it?

Consecration.flavorText: Consecrated ground glows with Holy energy. But it smells a little, too.

Conservator Nymph.flavorText: Whatever you do, don't water your Treants after midnight!

Construct Quarter.flavorText: It's not alive! IT'S NOT ALIIIIIVE!!!

Consume Magic.flavorText: Please be mindful when consuming raw or undercooked magic.

Contaminated Lasher.flavorText: He corrupts me, he corrupts me not.

Conviction (Rank 1).flavorText: It was the strength of Cariel's faith that emboldened the defenders of Northwatch that day. Although the strength of her giant hammer didn’t exactly hurt either.

Convincing Disguise.flavorText: Okay gang, let's see who's really under the mask… *gasp* Old Man Bru'kan!?

Convincing Infiltrator.flavorText: It’s always nice to steal a familiar face.

Convoke the Spirits.flavorText: The spirits prefer to convoke when there's some hot gossip to discuss.

Cookie the Cook.flavorText: Unsurprisingly, "Seafood Surprise" was no one's favorite dish.

Cool Ghoul.flavorText: He has disco fever! :D Because of the disco plague. :(

Coordinated Strike.flavorText: Undisputed champions of "Dancing with the Satyrs."

Coppertail Imposter.flavorText: It was fitting in fine until it gathered nuts and bolts.

Coppertail Snoop.flavorText: Scavenges both nuts and bolts for the winter.

Copycat.flavorText: Whatever you do, DON’T let two of them meet.

Coral Keeper.flavorText: This here is Carl. They're in charge of these elementals. Not all of them get along, so sometimes Carl corrals the quarreling coral.

Core Hound.flavorText: You don’t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.

Core Rager.flavorText: It takes a special kind of hunter to venture deep into a firey lava pit and convince a monster who lives there to come home and be a cuddly housepet.

Cornelius Roame.flavorText: Raised two perfectly normal daughters. Then one died and brought doom to Stormwind.

Cornered Sentry.flavorText: The Draenei are seriously considering cancelling "Bring Your Murderous Pet to Work Day."

Coroner.flavorText: It was at this moment the Coroner decided to become a farmer instead.

Corporal.flavorText: When he’s sitting in the graveyard ready to rez, he’s incorporal.

Corpse Explosion.flavorText: What? It's not like they were using them anymore.

Corpse Farm.flavorText: It ain't much, but it's dishonest work.

Corpse Raiser.flavorText: He was just minding his business, farming corpses, when you meddling adventurers came along.

Corpse Widow.flavorText: Her marriage survived death, but it decayed pretty quickly after that.

Corpsetaker.flavorText: Her extensive collection of corpses includes one of nearly every type. She'd love for you to join it.

Corpsicle.flavorText: Comes in three tasty flavors: Gross, Disgusting, and Chocolate!

Corridor Creeper.flavorText: It likes the smell of dead things, which is curious, as it has no visible nose.

Corridor Sleeper.flavorText: In the workshop, I go deeper. In the mulligan, I'm a keeper. This time, I'm even cheaper. You guessed it right, I'm Corridor Sleeper.

Corrosive Breath.flavorText: It's a breath of fresh terror!

Corrosive Sludge.flavorText: The result of centuries of terrible sanitation.

Corrupt the Waters.flavorText: This is why Hagatha is banned from public pools.

Corrupted Ashbringer.flavorText: Put your faith in the blight!

Corrupted Healbot.flavorText: Not so much "corrupted" as "has terrible aim".

Corrupted Seer.flavorText: For seers, it's very handy to have your crystal ball hanging right in front of your face.

Corrupting Mist.flavorText: The most terrifying of Un’goro magics is both silent… AND deadly.

Corruption.flavorText: It starts with stealing a pen from work, and before you know it, BOOOM! Corrupted!

Corsair Cache.flavorText: Where's a corsair's favorite place to hide treasure? Under their deck!

Cosmic Anomaly.flavorText: INGREDIENTS: STAR-STUFF, BLUE 1, NATURAL AND ARTIFICIAL FLAVORS.

Cosmic Keyboard.flavorText: Mine is signed by Algalon himself.

Cosplay Contestant.flavorText: She's the winner of the Valeera Cosplay Contest! Second place was Valeera.

Costumed Entertainer.flavorText: Just remember not to talk. It breaks character.

Costumed Singer.flavorText: Who knows which forgotten, washed-up, former C-list celebrity might be in there!

Counterfeit Blade.flavorText: Don't worry, the blade retracts into the handle!

Counterfeit Coin.flavorText: There is something funny about this coin… can't quite put my finger on it…

Counterspell.flavorText: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't? The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.

Countess Ashmore.flavorText: "1 minion… ah, ah, ah! 2 minions… ah, ah, ah! 3 minions… ah, ah, ah!"

Cover Artist.flavorText: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on our fear of you realizing we copied this flavor text.

Cowardly Grunt.flavorText: Cowardice is the wisest part of valor.

Cowbell Soloist.flavorText: Hot take: We need LESS cowbell. Much, much less.

Crabatoa.flavorText: This giant crab loves to sink entire naval fleets, but it'll settle for a single dinghy in a pinch.

Crabrider.flavorText: "Now I'm falling asleep and she's calling a crab…"

Crackling Razormaw.flavorText: Wasn't clever enough to go AROUND the electric fence.

Cram Session.flavorText: The font of the arcane gives nearly limitless access to power and energy! But it can't keep you awake, for that we still use coffee.

Crane Game.flavorText: This claw machine is RIGGED! I keep getting demons that bite me!

Crazed Alchemist.flavorText: "You'll love my new recipe!" he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.

Crazed Chemist.flavorText: You don't have to be crazy to work here, but it helps.

Crazed Conductor.flavorText: "The Twisting Nether is singing to me… WHAT IS THAT MELODY!?"

Crazed Worshipper.flavorText: Every month they share a pancake breakfast with the Perfectly Rational Worshippers.

Creation Protocol.flavorText: If you want the destruction protocol, just go in reverse.

Creepy Painting.flavorText: I do not like this painting, Harth. Its smug aura mocks me.

Crescendo.flavorText: The more you flail your arms, the better the orchestra plays! Yup, that's definitely how it works.

Criminal Lineup.flavorText: Number 1, could you please sing the opening to "I Want It That Way"?

Crimson Commander.flavorText: "Wait… why do I have a Deathrattle?"

Crimson Hothead.flavorText: Has a real passion for spelling.

Crimson Sigil Runner.flavorText: He's not the fastest of the bunch, but he'll take a stab at it anyway.

Crooked Cook.flavorText: There are many things not called poison which can kill a man. But in this case, it is poison.

Crop Rotation.flavorText: "Dave, you're never gunna believe this! The plants ARE the zombies!"

Crossroads Gossiper.flavorText: Not afraid to spill the tea.

Crossroads Watch Post.flavorText: All of Barrens Chat is recorded and kept on thousands of scrolls stored beneath this tower.

Crow's Nest Lookout.flavorText: The extra eyes means he sees extra good.

Crowd Roaster.flavorText: Every major show has an opening act to warm up the crowd.

Crowd Surfer.flavorText: I'm pretty sure it's the band that's supposed to be crowd surfing, but you do you little dude.

Crud Caretaker.flavorText: All it takes is a little love and a LOT of junk!

Cruel Dinomancer.flavorText: As that old saying goes: "you don't get into dinomancing to make friends."

Cruel Taskmaster.flavorText: "I'm going to need you to come in on Sunday." - Cruel Taskmaster

Cruise Captain Lora.flavorText: To your left is our award winning spa area! And to the right, THE PRISON OF YOGG-SARON!

Crush.flavorText: Using this card on your enemies is one of the best things in life, according to some barbarians.

Crushing Hand.flavorText: Shamans always have the firmest handshakes.

Cryomancer.flavorText: She loves Frozen. I mean who doesn't?

Cryopractor.flavorText: It's really hard to book an appointment, she always gives her clients the cold shoulder.

Cryopreservation.flavorText: Remember to take the elementals out of the freezer before Mom gets home!

Cryostasis.flavorText: We'll thaw you out when we find a cure!

Crypt Keeper.flavorText: How many crypts could a Crypt Keeper keep if a Crypt Keeper could keep crypts?

Crystal Broker.flavorText: Broke: Crystals Woke: Blueberry Fruit Gummies

Crystal Cluster.flavorText: And if you can't fit any of the Elementals… do better.

Crystal Lion.flavorText: Standard issue recruit gear: 1 silver sword, 1 Lordaeron insignia, 2 bags of crystal kibble.

Crystal Merchant.flavorText: I won't ask about your mana curve if you don't ask where I got these.

Crystal Power.flavorText: Often used as healing crystals, but also good for throwing at people.

Crystal Stag.flavorText: Arrives alone, but usually leaves with a friend just like him.

Crystal Welder.flavorText: For all you weld-heads out there, this flavor text is a deep cut.

Crystalline Greatmace.flavorText: The only difference between a mace and a greatmace is... PRESENTATION!

Crystalline Oracle.flavorText: Being made of light has its disadvantages, but at least it's always looking on the bright side.

Crystallizer.flavorText: This elf's winning the arms race.

Crystalsmith Kangor.flavorText: He wants to tank, but Boom always makes him play support.

Crystalsong Portal.flavorText: Experience the draw of the wild!

Crystalweaver.flavorText: The trick is soaking the crystals in warm milk to soften them up.

Crystology.flavorText: "The Light is neither a particle nor a wave. It's more of a juice, really."

Cult Master.flavorText: She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.

Cult Neophyte.flavorText: Make a new recruit's deficiencies your efficiencies.
