Cult Sorcerer.flavorText: No matter how many times we tell her not to, she keeps feeding C'Thun scraps under the table.

Cultivation.flavorText: Calling this an 8 mana card is missing the forest for the trees.

Curio Collector.flavorText: Experts worry that curios are a gateway to face-collecting.

Curious Glimmerroot.flavorText: George promised to be good. But it's easy for little Glimmerroots to forget.

Curse of Agony.flavorText: Now, fools, you shall all understand my back pain!

Curse of Rafaam.flavorText: This is what happens when Rafaam stubs his toe unexpectedly.

Curse of Weakness.flavorText: Warlocks refer to this as a "balance change."

Cursed Blade.flavorText: The Curse is that you have to listen to "MMMBop" on repeat.

Cursed Campaign.flavorText: Their group has been trying to schedule the next session since Kobolds and Catacombs came out.

Cursed Castaway.flavorText: She was an ordinary castaway... until she found that cursed volleyball.

Cursed Disciple.flavorText: Politer than his brother, the cursing disciple, but far more evil.

Cursed Souvenir.flavorText: Most souvenirs are considered tacky and soulless. This one is certainly not one of those things!

Cursed Vagrant.flavorText: Little did he know… it was really the talbuk leg that was cursed.

Customs Enforcer.flavorText: Anything to declare? "yes... CHAMPION! Azeroth cries out..."

Cutlass Courier.flavorText: It may be a cutlass, but you can cut lads with it too.

Cutpurse.flavorText: He has a giant collection of purses now. One for every outfit!

Cutthroat Buccaneer.flavorText: In life he worked as a sword swallower.

Cutting Class.flavorText: When you actually are the sharpest tool in the shed.

Cycle of Hatred.flavorText: If you run 2 of these, would that make it the bi-cycle of hatred?

Cyclopian Crusher.flavorText: Really puts the rusher in crusher. Uses its one eye to C.

Cyclopian Horror.flavorText: What are the qualifications for being a 'Horror?' Just how horrible do you have to be?

DJ Manastorm.flavorText: Do not sleep on his Tinker Town deep house set - absolutely legendary.

DOOM!.flavorText: We ran out of space for "DOOOOOOOOOOOM!!!!!"

Da Undatakah.flavorText: First Deathrattle: Draw a card. Second: Draw 2 cards. Third: Throw Mon'kind off a steel cage and plummet sixteen feet through an announcer’s table.

Dalaran Aspirant.flavorText: Is he aspiring or inspiring? Make up your mind!

Dalaran Mage.flavorText: You don't see a lot of Dalaran warriors.

Damaged Stegotron.flavorText: Sadly the warranty does not cover fireballs or acts of Boom.

Dance Floor.flavorText: I don't think Rush would ever be here.

Dancing Cobra.flavorText: Snakes are just tentacles with fangs.

Dancing Swords.flavorText: They like to dance to reggae.

Dang-Blasted Elemental.flavorText: We were told that "Dag-Nabbin' Dang-Blastin' Rootin'-Tootin' High-Falutin' Elemental" was too long.

Dangerous Cliffside.flavorText: It's not as dangerous as it looks… IT'S EVEN MORE DANGEROUS!

Dar'Khan Drathir.flavorText: You're telling me that you didn't suspect him of being evil, even though the first four letters of his name are D-A-R-K?

Daring Drake.flavorText: First of all, how dare you? Second of all, how dare you!

Daring Escape.flavorText: Impossible to cast without cackling evilly.

Daring Fire-Eater.flavorText: A few hours later he DESTROYED the arena bathrooms.

Daring Reporter.flavorText: She's working on a story! While skydiving!

Darius Crowley.flavorText: You either die a villain, or live long enough to see yourself become the hero.

Dark Alley Pact.flavorText: "With your help, I can finally install some proper lighting in this alley."

Dark Arakkoa.flavorText: There's a whole gradient of Arakkoa! This one is on the darker side.

Dark Bargain.flavorText: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.

Dark Conviction.flavorText: In his court, Uther is judge, jury, AND executioner…

Dark Cultist.flavorText: The Cult of the Damned has found it's best not to mention their name when recruiting new cultists.

Dark Inquisitor Xanesh.flavorText: Fear is the mind-killer, and also the name of my wurm.

Dark Iron Dwarf.flavorText: Guardians of Dark Iron Ore. Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.

Dark Iron Skulker.flavorText: He loves skulking. He skulks after hours just for the joy of it, but his friends are pretty worried he'll get burnt out.

Dark Pact.flavorText: "Don't worry about the fine print. Just sign here."

Dark Peddler.flavorText: I'm offering you a bargain here! This amazing vacuum cleaner for your soul!

Dark Pharaoh Tekahn.flavorText: He'll get that League of Explorers and their little murloc too!

Dark Possession.flavorText: Wanted on three counts of gnomish possession.

Dark Prophecy.flavorText: It's always a dark prophecy with Madame Lazul. Where's my happy, fluffy prophecy?!

Dark Skies.flavorText: "It's a drizzle of fire. A fine mist, really."

Dark Transformation.flavorText: The Northrend Arm Wrestling Championship just found its new champion.

Dark Wispers.flavorText: Don't worry; we fired the person who named this card.

Darkbishop Benedictus.flavorText: Dark Bishop takes Light Pawn, check.

Darkbomb.flavorText: If you're looking to make an "Emo" deck, this card is perfect!

Darkest Hour.flavorText: It's always darkest just before you find the light switch.

Darkfallen Shadow.flavorText: Manathirst AND Reborn?! Pick a side!

Darkglare.flavorText: He's got a dark glare, but he sees crystal clear!

Darkmire Moonkin.flavorText: Birds of a feather Moonfire together.

Darkmoon Dirigible.flavorText: "It's dirigible? I don’t even know what diriging is!"

Darkmoon Magician.flavorText: Darkmoon Magicians pull rabbits out of their hats, and wins out of their... hats.

Darkmoon Rabbit.flavorText: That's no ordinary rabbit! That's the most foul, cruel, and bad-tempered rodent you ever set eyes on!

Darkmoon Statue.flavorText: As far as workplace injuries go, Silas is protected by his statue of limitations.

Darkscale Healer.flavorText: Healing is just something she does in her free time. It's more of a hobby really.

Darkshire Alchemist.flavorText: The secret ingredient: liquified funnel cake.

Darkshire Librarian.flavorText: Do NOT be late with your overdue fines.

Darkspeaker.flavorText: People often think that Darkspeaker is the arch nemesis of Lightspeaker, but that title actually belongs to Heavyspeaker.

Darkspear Berserker.flavorText: "If I die, I'm taking my hero down with me."

Darkthorn Quilter.flavorText: Still mad about not being let into the spiders' sewing club.

Darnassus Aspirant.flavorText: She loves mana crystals, she hates mana crystals. So fickle!

Dart Throw.flavorText: Did you know: Hitting the same target twice is only for skilled players. This has been a 'Dart Fact'!

Dart Trap.flavorText: Five years of tap-dancing lessons are FINALLY going to pay off!

Day at the Faire.flavorText: Karl knew he would someday regret that turkey leg.

Dead Air.flavorText: We'll be right back after a word from our specters.

Dead Man's Hand.flavorText: I got two pair, Rags and Armorsmiths. What you got?

Deadline.flavorText: For all you procrastinators out there, don't worry. That's why we added Tradeable.

Deadly Fork.flavorText: For a proper setting, place the deadly fork after the salad fork, but before the dinner fork.

Deadly Poison.flavorText: Rogues guard the secrets to poison-making carefully, lest magi start incorporating poison into their spells. Poisonbolt? Rain of Poison? Poison Elemental? Nobody wants that.

Deadly Shot.flavorText: Our ballista operator is effective, but not picky.

Deadscale Knight.flavorText: His favorite spell is Chum Explosion.

Deafen.flavorText: Hey, Volsat, we can't hear you. You're on mute.

Death Beetle.flavorText: Well that'll be useless next expansion. WINK WINK.

Death Blossom Whomper.flavorText: We call her Audrey II. She was named after her mother.

Death Growl.flavorText: GRRRRR I'M SO ANGRY BECAUSE I'M DEAD!

Death Metal Knight.flavorText: He prefers listening to bands dead rather than live.

Death Revenant.flavorText: How's everyone doing? Hurt? Bleeding? Wounded? ... Excellent.

Death Roll.flavorText: There's a Crocolisk on my boot!

Death Speaker Blackthorn.flavorText: He can speak death but has a hard time reading it.

Death Strike.flavorText: A little embarrassing when used on large minions.

Death's Bite.flavorText: "Take a bite outta Death." - McScruff the Deathlord

Death's Head Cultist.flavorText: Nothing can stop death. Except a Taunt. With Healing.

Deathborne.flavorText: Kel'Thuzad thinks adding a silent 'e' at the end of words makes them sound cooler.

Deathbringer Saurfang.flavorText: "In hindsight, maybe I should have let the Alliance have all the fun back at the Wrathgate."

Deathchiller.flavorText: Man, death is like the most chill state... you've got nothing to do but relax.

Deathmatch Pavilion.flavorText: Worth it for the stuffed toy at the end.

Deathspeaker.flavorText: It helps to speak really, really loud.

Deathstalker Rexxar.flavorText: "You were too slow, old friend. The hunt began long ago. And now... it will never end."

Deathwarden.flavorText: Ride or die takes on a new meaning.

Deathweaver Aura.flavorText: Knitting is a harmless hobby. Weaving, though...

Deathweb Spider.flavorText: The itsy bitsy spiders climbed up the village wall. Then came the witch and the spiders ate them all.

Deathwing.flavorText: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated. Daddy issues?

Deathwing the Destroyer.flavorText: "He’s Deathwing? That one's Deathwing? You're Deathwing!? I'm DEATHWING! ARE THERE ANY OTHER DEATHWINGS I SHOULD KNOW ABOUT?"

Deathwing, Dragonlord.flavorText: To his credit, Deathwing really took to heart the feedback he was receiving that he needed to be "more of a team player".

Deathwing, Mad Aspect.flavorText: Bite that one, bite that other one, claw this one, swallow that one whole....

Deck of Chaos.flavorText: Yeah, it's chaos, but it's organized chaos.

Deck of Lunacy.flavorText: Voted "Most Lunacy" in Madness Monthly magazine.

Deck of Wonders.flavorText: "Pick a card, any card. Wait! No! Not that one!" - Last words of previous owner

Deep Space Curator.flavorText: *Gestures to empty room* "...and here is my curated collection of space."

Deepminer Brann.flavorText: This is a very on-brannd effect.

Deepwater Evoker.flavorText: "Cap'n! We've hit an iceberg! ...No, it’s not my fault!"

Defend the Dwarven District.flavorText: Don't shoot until you see the purples of their eyes.

Defender of Argus.flavorText: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending. But it does.

Defense Attorney Nathanos.flavorText: "Your Honor, my client was simply trying a new tree trimming technique!"

Defias Cleaner.flavorText: His house cleaning service is quite thorough. Not a spot to be found... or any of your stuff!

Defias Leper.flavorText: Do NOT eat Cookie’s Seafood Surprise.

Defias Ringleader.flavorText: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.

Defile.flavorText: This spell was originally designed to help warlocks clean up their hard drives.

Defrost.flavorText: Shouldn't this NOT be a Frost spell?

Dehydrate.flavorText: JUST A LITTLE FURTHER LITTLE GUY, YOU CAN MAKE IT!!!

Deliverance.flavorText: In 30 minutes or less, or else it’s free!

Demented Frostcaller.flavorText: He prefers that you refer to him by his nickname: 'Frostwaker.'

Demolisher.flavorText: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone. It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.

Demolition Renovator.flavorText: "Look, the Sire said he wanted something more open concept..."

Demon Companion.flavorText: Owning a pet can be real hell at times.

Demonbolt.flavorText: Or as it’s known in troll, “De bolt, mon.”

Demonfire.flavorText: Demonfire is like regular fire except for IT NEVER STOPS BURNING HELLLPPP

Demonfuse.flavorText: Very dangerous when attached to a demonbomb.

Demonheart.flavorText: Virtually every member of the pro demon lobby is a warlock. Weird.

Demonic Assault.flavorText: Right next to the demonic pepper.

Demonic Deal.flavorText: The Burning Legion upped their efforts to sell Argus Timeshares.

Demonic Dynamics.flavorText: The Blue Imp Group sure knows how to put on a show!

Demonic Project.flavorText: Another group project where Jaraxxus doesn't do any work.

Demonic Studies.flavorText: "Do you wanna summon a demon? I wanna summon a demon!"

Demonwrath.flavorText: Demons are not angry most of the time. You have to play this card in order to really bring it out of them.

Dendrologist.flavorText: He's teaching his little buddy to talk, but all it says is, "I am Gloop."

Deputization Aura.flavorText: You're my favorite deput- oh. You died… Ok just kidding, THAT guy is my favorite deputy.

Derailed Coaster.flavorText: So long as it doesn’t kill you, it's considered part of the ride "experience."

Deranged Doctor.flavorText: Unfortunately, his doctorate is in Murloc Literature.

Desecrated Graveyard.flavorText: People are dying to get in.

Desert Camel.flavorText: Dang. This card is sweet. Almost as sweet as Dessert Camel.

Desert Hare.flavorText: After they're caught, they’re dessert hares.

Desert Nestmatron.flavorText: Not as sweet as the Dessert Nestmatron, but still just as refreshing!

Desert Obelisk.flavorText: The Obelisk of the Stars can hide an entire land from prying eyes! Or zap a rando.

Desert Spear.flavorText: Goes on the right, next to the desert spoon.

Desperate Measures.flavorText: Desperate times call for disparate secrets.

Desperate Prayer.flavorText: Woah, we're halfway there, woah oh...

Desperate Stand.flavorText: They're grateful for the help, but most minions would prefer not dying in the first place.

Detailed Notes.flavorText: The Rangari Scouts pride themselves on their highly accurate notes.

Detonation Juggernaut.flavorText: Did you really need a whole giant mecha-suit just for one bundle of dynamite?

Deviate Dreadfang.flavorText: Even with wings, snakes STILL don't have legs.

Devilsaur Egg.flavorText: A key ingredient in all discerning Funnel Cake recipes.

Devolve.flavorText: Ragnaros looked down. He looked like some kind of War Golem. "WHAT HAVE YOU DONE TO ME," he yelled. But all that came out was a deep grinding sound. He began to cry.

Devolving Missiles.flavorText: Most intermural spell-dueling contests end with a field of wisps.

Devoted Maniac.flavorText: There are plenty of apathetic maniacs, but they couldn't be bothered.

Devour Mind.flavorText: A mind is a terrible thing to waste. Seconds, anyone?

Devourer of Souls.flavorText: Winner of the Scourge's annual funnel cake devouring contest 12 years running.

Devouring Ectoplasm.flavorText: When it's on keto, it only devours tauren.

Devouring Plague.flavorText: "How’d we miss this one in Uldum?" —Rafaam

Devout Dungeoneer.flavorText: "Please do smaller pulls, this is my first time healing."

Dew Process.flavorText: All part of dewing your dew diligence.

Dig for Treasure.flavorText: "Woohoo! I'm so glad I dug up a pirate!"

Digging Straight Down.flavorText: You only make this mistake once.

Diligent Notetaker.flavorText: You never know what cards are going to be on the test.

Dimensional Core.flavorText: At the core of every Starship is a Naaru giving its own energy as a power source. At the core of every Draenei is their unbridled faith in the Naaru.

Dimensional Ripper.flavorText: The first dimensional ripper had a point. The second fell flat. The THIRD one really started to take shape!

Dinomancy.flavorText: Anyone can dinomance. Just put your lips together and RAAWWWAARGGGH.

Dinosize.flavorText: Comes with fries and a drink.

Dinotamer Brann.flavorText: Brann's new dino-taming hobby is going well—his pet can already make him sit, stand, and roll over!

Dire Frenzy.flavorText: It's always Huffer. And Huffer. And Huffer. And Huffer.

Dire Frostwolf.flavorText: Tips to survive a frostwolf attack: -Stay calm -Lay down -Drizzle steak sauce over your body Brought to you by the Frostwolf Council for Alliance Safety.

Dire Mole.flavorText: You especially don't want to make a dire mountain out of a dire mole hill.

Dire Wolf Alpha.flavorText: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.

Direhorn Hatchling.flavorText: His mom could beat up your mom.

Direwolf Commander.flavorText: When you’re riding a wolf, it’s in charge and you're allowed to make suggestions.

Dirty Rat.flavorText: It's not his fault… Someone keeps stealing his soap!

Dirty Tricks.flavorText: "Ahh sand in my eyes! Also, I'm being stabbed."

Disarming Elemental.flavorText: "You can have these back when you learn to play nice."

Disciple of Amitus.flavorText: "Oh great Amitus, I took your style advice on the poncho, but pray tell - one or two golden gloves?"

Disciple of Argus.flavorText: "Aw nuts, I put both ends in the pencil sharpener."

Disciple of C'Thun.flavorText: C’Thun’s recruiting pitch involves cookies, which is why it’s the most popular Old God.

Disciple of Eonar.flavorText: If you do not receive his rose, you will have to pack your bags and leave Ulduar immediately.

Disciple of Galakrond.flavorText: Raising Galakrond will cause thurible, thurible damage.

Disciple of Golganneth.flavorText: Warning: If you are not made of rocks, do not stand in lightning water.

Disciplinarian Gandling.flavorText: "He doesn’t grade on a curve, but on a sharp spike instead."

Disco at the End of Time.flavorText: This is what you've been saving the last dance for.

Discovery of Magic.flavorText: It's in a book, just take a look!

Diseased Vulture.flavorText: He's off the twig! He's kicked the bucket! THIS IS AN EX-VULTURE!

Disguised K'thir.flavorText: That is not a very good disguise, dude.

Disguised Wanderer.flavorText: He wanders east... always into the east.

Dispatch Kodo.flavorText: "Crime reported at First Bank of Gadgetzan. Huge quantities of Jade being carried away by what looks like a bunch of Hozen. Kodo 77 can you make it over there now?"

Disposal Assistant.flavorText: A bright green liquid that people say is bad for you... That's either hazardous waste OR a new popular brand of soft drink.

Dispose of Evidence.flavorText: Just because you did it doesn't mean you have to be guilty.

Dispossessed Soul.flavorText: I'm afraid it came as a great shock to her when she died.

Disruptive Spellbreaker.flavorText: WHO IS THE BLOOD ELVES' DENTIST?

Distress Signal.flavorText: HELP! HEEELP! MY OPPONENT PLAYED CARDS!

Distressed Kvaldir.flavorText: Oh look at that, I have been impaled.

Divine Brew.flavorText: I'm on a cleanse, do you have any Light drinks?

Divine Favor.flavorText: This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!

Divine Hymn.flavorText: Taken up an octave, it's highly effective against stained glass golems.

Divine Rager.flavorText: For when you need to rage, rage against the dying of the Light.

Divine Spirit.flavorText: Double the trouble. Double the fun!

Divine Star.flavorText: I could really use a wish right now.

Divine Strength.flavorText: Every year a few paladins get disqualified from the Westfall weight lifting championship for using Divine Strength.

Divine Toll.flavorText: Never send to know for whom the bell tolls.

Djinni of Zephyrs.flavorText: If you want your wish granted, don't rub him the wrong way.

Doctor Holli'dae.flavorText: If anything can heal the Badlands, it is the power of frogs!

Doctor Krastinov.flavorText: He is not a medical doctor.

Dollmaster Dorian.flavorText: The children were puzzled by the scratches covering the insides of their toy-boxes.

Domino Effect.flavorText: WHY DO THEY NEVER RUN TO THE SIDE?????

Don Han'Cho.flavorText: The brilliant mastermind of the Grimy Goons, Han sometimes thinks about ditching the idiot Cho, but that would just tear him apart.

Don't Feed the Animals.flavorText: They're still cleaning up the mess from the last time someone fed the basilisk a deep fried candybar.

Don't Stand in the Fire!.flavorText: Apparently the “Caution: Hot Surface” sign had burned up.

Doomcaller.flavorText: "Hello, is Doom there? No? Can I leave a message?"

Doomed Apprentice.flavorText: Jaina was never good at keeping up apprentices.

Doomerang.flavorText: Guaranteed to return your weapon directly to your hand! (Wear gloves. Thick ones.)

Doomguard.flavorText: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.

Doomhammer.flavorText: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall. His name is a total coincidence.

Doommaiden.flavorText: You merely adopted the doom. I was maiden it.

Doomsayer.flavorText: He's almost been right so many times. He was sure it was coming during the Cataclysm.

Door of Shadows.flavorText: Upon arrival, please ring the doorbell of shadows, and wipe your shoes on the doormat of shadows before entering.

Double Agent.flavorText: And under the Alliance tabard? Another Horde tabard.

Double Cross.flavorText: Valeera revealed herself to be a double agent. At which point Maiev felt comfortable revealing that she also was a double agent. And then Scabbs announced to everybody that - get this - he was a double agent.

Double Jump.flavorText: The key to every speed run.

Doubling Imp.flavorText: What's worse than finding two imps in your lab? Only finding one of them.

Down with the Ship.flavorText: It has been a privilege playing with you tonight.

Dozing Dragon.flavorText: Emerald dreams can become emerald realities.

Dozing Kelpkeeper.flavorText: *Yaaaaawn* wake me up in another 5 Mana.

Dozing Marksman.flavorText: It's the sleeper of the set.

Dr. Boom's Scheme.flavorText: “We did it! We blew up the vault!” “You mean the vault door?” “Oh. The doooor…”

Dr. Boom, Mad Genius.flavorText: "Of course I've gone mad with power. Ever try going mad without it?"

Dr. Morrigan.flavorText: She will NOT STOP until she gets tenure.

Draconic Studies.flavorText: Our Draconic Studies program has a high rate of burnout.

Draenei Totemcarver.flavorText: It's nice to find a real craftsman in this day and age of mass-produced totems.

Dragged Below.flavorText: I know this is a frustrating situation you’re in, Captain, but there’s no need to curse.

Dragon Breeder.flavorText: Deathwing would have been more well-adjusted if he'd been raised by this guy.

Dragon Consort.flavorText: Everybody wants someone to snuggle with. Even giant armored scaly draconic beasts of destruction.

Dragon Egg.flavorText: Think of them as bullets for your dragon gun.

Dragon Golem.flavorText: I have a Dragon, I have a Golem. UH! Dragon Golem!

Dragon Roar.flavorText: Not to be confused with Dragon Yodel.

Dragon Soul.flavorText: Crafted by Deathwing's goblin horde, but the dragon added the rainbow sparkles himself.

Dragon Speaker.flavorText: All of his speeches really drag on.

Dragon Tales.flavorText: "Once upon a time, there was a maaaagical toy shop, filled with wonder and Dragons!"

Dragon's Breath.flavorText: Dragons breathe fire, sure, but did you know they can also breathe Cotton Candy? It's harder to give them a reason to do that, though.

Dragon's Fury.flavorText: “C’mon Hucklemuck. She’ll never notice if we take just one little coin.”

Dragon's Pack.flavorText: Each dragon's pack is guaranteed to have at least one rare.

Dragonbane.flavorText: *Thunk* "That wasn’t a dragon!" *Thunk* "THAT wasn’t a dragon!"

Dragonblight Cultist.flavorText: Galakrond would be extra mad if he was resurrected with gnaw marks on his bones.

Dragoncaller Alanna.flavorText: Her secret is using a gentle voice and carrying a baggie of hotdogs.

Dragoncaster.flavorText: It’s challenging to perform magic on dragonback. It’s so easy to drop the rabbit.

Dragonfire Potion.flavorText: No one was brave enough to fire the dragon in person… so they made the potion do it.

Dragonhatcher.flavorText: Which came first? The dragon or the dragonhatcher?

Dragonhawk Rider.flavorText: Check it out. You can do barrel rolls on this thing.

Dragonkin Sorcerer.flavorText: Dragonkin Sorcerers be all "I'm a wizard" and everyone else be all "daaaaang".

Dragonling Mechanic.flavorText: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.

Dragonmaw Overseer.flavorText: Ah, the Booterang... nothing cures peon laziness faster.

Dragonmaw Sentinel.flavorText: On the side, she's training for the annual Dragonmaw hammer throw tournament.

Dragonrider Talritha.flavorText: You can't just run away from your problems. Unless you have another dragon to jump to.

Dragonslayer.flavorText: A pair of stout dwarves nearly averted the Cataclysm.

Drain Life.flavorText: "I've just sucked one year of your life away."

Drain Soul.flavorText: Cleans even the toughest clogs with just a flick of the wrist!

Drakefire Amulet.flavorText: "...and I only had to climb up the mountains in Winterspring 50 times!"

Drakkari Defender.flavorText: Sometimes, the best defense is an offensive troll.

Drakkari Embalmer.flavorText: A troll in life, death, and online forums.

Drakkari Enchanter.flavorText: Drakkari sorceresses have the irritating habit of repeating themselves at the end of every sentence. Every sentence.

Drakonid Crusher.flavorText: Drakonids were created to have all the bad parts of a dragon in the form of a humanoid. But, like, why?

Drakonid Operative.flavorText: His job is to spy on the Goons and the Jade Lotus, but he's OBVIOUSLY a dragon so it's pretty hard work.

Dread Corsair.flavorText: "Yarrrr" is a pirate word that means "Greetings, milord."

Dread Deserter.flavorText: "I uh... need to go walk my uh… fish."

Dread Infernal.flavorText: "INFERNOOOOOOOOOO!" - Jaraxxus, Eredar Lord of the Burning Legion

Dread Raven.flavorText: Fun Fact: A group of three Dread Ravens is an unkindness. Four is lethal!

Dreaded Mount.flavorText: This is the summoning that never ends, and it goes on and on my friends...

Dreadhound Handler.flavorText: The handler being undead speaks to a spotty safety record.

Dreadlich Tamsin.flavorText: At a certain point, you stop mocking death and start becoming it.

Dreadlord's Bite.flavorText: When it gets too dull, it's more of a nibble.

Dreadprison Glaive.flavorText: Keep your allies close. Keep your evil demons in your weapon.

Dreadscale.flavorText: Let's be clear about this: ACIDMAW is the sidekick.

Dreadsteed.flavorText: Crescendo himself summoned this steed, riding it to victory in the Grand Tournament. Wherever he rides, an army of riders ride behind him, supporting the legendary champion.

Dreamboat.flavorText: As the only member that can sing underwater, Paz saved Poison Bloom's Zin-Azshari tour from failure.

Dreaming Drake.flavorText: Some dragons dream of conquering Azeroth, some just dream of being 5/6s.

Dreampetal Florist.flavorText: Unlike gnomes, dreampetals grow more than 3 feet tall.

Dreamway Guardians.flavorText: They're a nightmare to deal with.

Dredger Staff.flavorText: The dredger staff held the dredger knife and said, "Dredger bow before the Sire!"

Drek'Thar.flavorText: Inside your deck there are two wolves. One is a frostwolf. The other is a frostwolf. You are a Frostwolf.

Drilly the Kid.flavorText: "I HATE that nickname. Call me Drilliam!"

Drink Server.flavorText: Make sure to tip to help him with his fin-ances.

Drone Deconstructor.flavorText: You have to deconstruct to reconstruct.

Drown.flavorText: If you play it on a Naga, they drown in their sorrows instead.

Druid of the Claw.flavorText: Cat or Bear? Cat or Bear?! I just cannot CHOOSE!

Druid of the Fang.flavorText: The Druids of the Fang live in the Wailing Caverns. They wear cool snake shirts and tell snake jokes and say "bro" a lot.

Druid of the Flame.flavorText: Druids who fought too long in Northrend were easily seduced by Ragnaros; a mug of hot chocolate was generally all it took.

Druid of the Plains.flavorText: Not to be confused with the aeronautically advanced Druid of the Planes.

Druid of the Reef.flavorText: “Wow, there’s a whole sunken city down here!”

Druid of the Saber.flavorText: That's saberTEETH, not like curved pirate blades. That's a different kind of druid. Druid of the Curved Pirate Blades.

Druid of the Scythe.flavorText: She's a scythe for sore eyes.

Druid of the Swarm.flavorText: The druid awoke from troubling dreams to find herself transformed into a giant spider.

Drum Circle.flavorText: It's more of a drum pentagon, really.

Drum Soloist.flavorText: "Was I rushin' or was I dragon?"

Dryscale Deputy.flavorText: He's here to tip the scales in our favor… and moisturize them too.

Drywhisker Armorer.flavorText: Kobolds use anything for armor: Pots, pans, garbage cans… even other kobolds.

Dubious Purchase.flavorText: Beauty is in the eye of the scorpidholder.

Duel!.flavorText: If you don’t fight to the death, it’s Duel Yielding.

Dun Baldar Bridge.flavorText: At least there's no fall damage in Hearthstone.

Dune Sculptor.flavorText: Come for the magic show, stay for the sand castles.

Dunemaul Shaman.flavorText: He just closes his eyes and goes for it. Raarararrrarar!

Dunk Tank.flavorText: "When I said bring a tank to the dungeon, this is not what I had in mind!"

Duplicate.flavorText: The one time when duping cards won't get your account banned!

Durnholde Imposter.flavorText: Assassins of the Infinite Dragonflight waited for their moment to strike at Thrall before he ever became Warchief.

Duskbat.flavorText: Happily married with two kids. It was love at first bite.

Duskboar.flavorText: Often excluded from dinner parties. To be fair, he is very boaring.

Duskbreaker.flavorText: Waking up at the break of dusk is just not as impressive.

Duskfallen Aviana.flavorText: Someone called her "Tweety". She didn't take it well.

Duskhaven Hunter.flavorText: After a short paws, she's back to herself again.

Dust Devil.flavorText: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

Dwarf Planet.flavorText: Hey, who let Magni Bronzebeard, who we all know is famous for his Magni Touch, land on this planet!?

Dwarven Archaeologist.flavorText: She's making great progress on paying off that advanced degree.

Dwarven Sharpshooter.flavorText: Scissors, knives, needles, you name it! He'll shoot it.

Dyn-o-matic.flavorText: Star player on the inter-office Boomball team.

E.M.P. Operative.flavorText: "I said this looks like a job for me So everybody just follow me 'Cause we need a little E.M.P. 'Cause it feels so mechy without me…"

E.T.C., Band Manager.flavorText: "This next band features the one and only M.C. Tech on the drums, the fungal king of the keyboard Loatheb, and the showstopping vocal chops of Spellbreaker!"

E.T.C., God of Metal.flavorText: There are Old Gods and then there are Rock Gods.

EVIL Cable Rat.flavorText: Gradually driven to darkness by the promise of unobtainable cheese.

EVIL Conscripter.flavorText: Kobold! There’s a place you can handle I said kobold! When you’re short in the candle Cast a spell with the E! V! I! L!

EVIL Genius.flavorText: You do not want to be on the business end of this intellect!

EVIL Miscreant.flavorText: Because there are no G.O.O.D. Miscreants.

EVIL Quartermaster.flavorText: He trained for a whole year to become quarter-master. Three more, and he'll be a full-master.

EVIL Recruiter.flavorText: I'm starting to think the lackeys aren't evil, just taken advantage of.

EVIL Totem.flavorText: A lot of people blame the parents when a totem goes bad.

Eadric the Pure.flavorText: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.

Eager Underling.flavorText: Eager to please, even if it kills him.

Eaglehorn Bow.flavorText: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.

Earth Revenant.flavorText: Have you guys seen a pair of rock legs lying around anywhere?

Earth Shock.flavorText: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be "Azeroth Shock"?

Earthen Ring Farseer.flavorText: He can see really far, and he doesn't use a telescope like those filthy pirates.

Earthen Scales.flavorText: You can make your own Earthen Scales at home. Step 1: Roll around in the dirt. Step 2: Magic.

Earthquake.flavorText: Shake it, sh-sh-sh-shake it like a Kalimdor fissure.

Eat! The! Imp!.flavorText: No need for flavor text, it's seasoned perfectly!

Eater of Secrets.flavorText: You don't want to be around after it has eaten an explosive trap. You thought Sludge Belcher was bad...

Ebon Dragonsmith.flavorText: Having a furnace-mouth is really handy for a blacksmith.

Echo of Medivh.flavorText: Medivh's echo haunts Karazhan, eternally cheating at chess and Hearthstone.

Educated Elekk.flavorText: "This reminds me of a saying. 'An elekk never…' something. I can't remember."

Edwin VanCleef.flavorText: He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.

Edwin, Defias Kingpin.flavorText: He’s not going to tear down the walls of Stormwind sitting around in the Hall of Fame.

Eerie Statue.flavorText: Don't blink! Don't turn your back, don't look away, and DON'T BLINK.

Efficient Octo-bot.flavorText: Pull the lever, Octo-bot... Wrong leverrrrr!

Eggnapper.flavorText: Often misunderstood, it's just that he likes to use the eggs as pillows.

Elder Longneck.flavorText: And so the bartender says, “Why the long neck?”

Elder Nadox.flavorText: For an Undead, is an elder the least or most dead?

Eldritch Horror.flavorText: Often wonders what path his life might have taken if he wasn't named, you know, "Eldritch Horror".

Electra Stormsurge.flavorText: "The coin? You used me for THE COIN!?"

Elemental Allies.flavorText: Reno’s lucky he wasn’t caught by a fire elemental.

Elemental Destruction.flavorText: I'm not a shaman or anything, but isn't Elemental Destruction the opposite of what they want to do?

Elise the Enlightened.flavorText: From cartographer to combatant, Elise has taken the road less traveled—because no one else could find it on a map.

Elise the Trailblazer.flavorText: Reno taught her that blazing her own trail is a lot more fun than following someone else's map.

Elise, Badlands Savior.flavorText: From the library to the field, she's proved herself to be a leading intellectual.

Elite Tauren Champion.flavorText: Strumming his guitar with a molten ember from the first fire of Azeroth, E.T.C.'s ear-splitting, heart-wrenching, head-banging solo held back Magatha and her forces of evil, single-handedly saving music for centuries to come.

Elite Tauren Chieftain.flavorText: He's looking for a drummer. The current candidates are: Novice Engineer, Sen'jin Shieldmasta', and Ragnaros the Firelord.

Elitist Snob.flavorText: "I heard the Sire invited a Murloc! How dreadful!"

Eliza Goreblade.flavorText: Dead men tell no tales, but Undead Pirates are yappers.

Elven Archer.flavorText: Don't bother asking her out on a date. She'll shoot you down.

Elven Minstrel.flavorText: "After that gig in Hamlin went south, I swore off rats."

Elwynn Boar.flavorText: Be grateful we lowered the requirement from 65,340,285.

Embalming Ritual.flavorText: "Guess what! We're getting a new cat."

Emberscale Drake.flavorText: The third little dragon made his armor out of adamantite.

Embrace Darkness.flavorText: Once you both get comfortable, darkness is actually pretty snuggly.

Embrace the Shadow.flavorText: For when your Auchenai Soulpriests call in sick.

Emerald Hive Queen.flavorText: She rules the emerald hive at the end of the yellow brick trail.

Emerald Reaver.flavorText: Not to be confused with clubbing enthusiast Emerald Raver.

Emerald Skytalon.flavorText: Sworn protectors of Ysera at the Emerald Dragonshrine, these majestic owls have been touched by the powers of the Emerald Dream, taking on an almost crystalline appearance.

Emeriss.flavorText: Taste your world's corruption! It tastes like chicken.

Emperor Cobra.flavorText: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray. And plate armor.

Emperor Thaurissan.flavorText: His second greatest regret is summoning an evil Firelord who enslaved his entire people.

Enchanted Cauldron.flavorText: Do you smell what the cauldron is cooking? If so, we apologize.

Enchanted Raven.flavorText: Once upon a midnight restive, Medivh pondered, feeling festive!

Enchanter.flavorText: "I know Scourgebane! Your materials and tips appreciated!"

Encroaching Insanity.flavorText: Pictured here is Loken stuck at his 20th hour on Diamond 5.

Encumbered Pack Mule.flavorText: "Now I can pick up EVERY knick-knack."

Energy Shaper.flavorText: '"I can do a snake for you?"

Enhanced Dreadlord.flavorText: Photo actually taken across the street in the reflection of a doorknob.

Enslaved Fel Lord.flavorText: He's not really chained up. He just wears that to scare the imps when they get too unruly.

Ensmallen.flavorText: Come on, you know- I ensmallen, you ensmallen? He she me Ensmallen? Ensmallogy: the study of ensmallening?! IT'S FIRST GRADE.

Enter the Coliseum.flavorText: You have to get past the vendors first. So many are lost to shopping...

Entitled Customer.flavorText: "Do you have any idea how much mana I've spent at your store? 6."

Entomb.flavorText: It's perfectly safe as long as you remember to put in air holes.

Entrapped Sorceress.flavorText: "If you're a city guard, you have to tell me. Otherwise, it's entrapment."

Envoy of Lazul.flavorText: "Note to self: possess someone who's local and knows directions next time."

Envoy of Prosperity.flavorText: "Our prosperity is beyond a shadow of a doubt!"

Eonar, the Life-Binder.flavorText: Protector of all living things, she once saved the nascent world-soul of Azeroth from annihilation. It seems mercy was her greatest wisdom.

Equality.flavorText: We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.

Eredar Brute.flavorText: After a while, the glowing purple stress ball became ineffective at containing his rage.

Eredar Deceptor.flavorText: But they were all of them deceived, for another Eredar was made.

Eroded Sediment.flavorText: A perfect minion for those feeling sedimental about their past.

Escape Pod.flavorText: You can only have two in your deck because we are confident that the Draenei will never run into any dire situations that would warrant any more!

Escaped Manasaber.flavorText: Captive manasabers don't behave much better--they're always scratching your furniture and coughing up mana balls.

Eternal Layover.flavorText: Get away from it all! Forever.

Eternal Sentinel.flavorText: Just try to avoid eye contact.

Eternal Servitude.flavorText: What do you mean I don't get overtime pay for this?!

Eternium Rover.flavorText: He's all beeps and smiles but you're just a walking pile of armor to him.

Ethereal Arcanist.flavorText: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

Ethereal Augmerchant.flavorText: According to him, undamaged minions just spell problems.

Ethereal Conjurer.flavorText: Despite the name, he's a solid conjurer.

Ethereal Oracle.flavorText: I see 2 spells in my future.

Ethereal Peddler.flavorText: Yeah, sure. That Ragnaros "fell off the back of a truck".

Eureka!.flavorText: Genius is 1% inspiration, and 99% drawing your Deathwing.

Evasion.flavorText: Works on weapons, missiles, and taxes.

Evasive Chimaera.flavorText: One head only tells the truth, while the other head only tells lies. But they both spit poison.

Evasive Drakonid.flavorText: Doesn't respond to spells, hero powers, calls, or text messages.

Evasive Feywing.flavorText: I've never heard of this fey-dragon called "Brightwing," but if I HAD, I’d say we’d be best friends.

Evasive Wyrm.flavorText: Deftly dodges spells like a real wiggle wyrm.

Eversong Portal.flavorText: In retrospect, it's pretty impressive that they had the Lynxes just ready to go.

Everyfin is Awesome.flavorText: Everyfin is cool when you're part of a murloc team!

Evil Heckler.flavorText: To be honest, heckling is not the most effective form of evil.

Eviscerate.flavorText: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent. You might tweak your elbow! That really hurts!

Evocation.flavorText: You too could be the winner of the national spelling spree!

Evolve.flavorText: So you say you want an evolution. Well, you know. We all want to change the board.

Evolving Spores.flavorText: The most powerful mushrooms are commonly found in boxes marked with "?".

Exarch Akama.flavorText: Akama fiercely led the Vindicators in the Draenei's quest to find a new home. If only he knew what would await him on the planet of Draenor…

Exarch Hataaru.flavorText: Severely outmatched by the Burning Legion, the Draenei had no hopes of survival… That changed with the invention of arkonite crystals, giving Hataaru and his Artificers new ways to empower their people.

Exarch Maladaar.flavorText: The Auchenai order was founded to preserve the memory of Draenei that have passed. But why stop at remembrance when they can live once more?

Exarch Naielle.flavorText: The Great Dark Beyond is vast, with each world containing unknown wonders and horrors alike. To distinguish between the two, Naielle leads the Rangari in surveying all planets the Draenei set foot on.

Exarch Othaar.flavorText: The temptation of limitless knowledge led some Eredar to join the Burning Legion. In the Sha’tari Draenei, the study of everything lives on.

Excavated Evil.flavorText: MOM! DAD! DON'T TOUCH IT! IT'S EVIL!!!!!!

Excavation Specialist.flavorText: With the jungles of Un’goro mapped out and the ruins of Uldum fully uncovered, explorers have to go a little out of their depth in their search of the great unknown.

Exotic Mountseller.flavorText: *Taps roof of mammoth* “You can fit so many squirrels in this thing!”

Expendable Performers.flavorText: When someone gets injured, it's considered performance art.

Expired Merchant.flavorText: The "best by" date is more like a guideline.

Explodinator.flavorText: When it absolutely, positively, has to blow up overnight.

Explodineer.flavorText: Explodineeeer... explodifaaaar... explode whereeeever you aaaaare...

Exploding Bloatbat.flavorText: We've all been there after a night of one-too-many funnel cakes.

Explore Un'Goro.flavorText: It turns out cards DO grow on trees!

Explorer's Hat.flavorText: Harrison Jones was disappointed that he didn't get to be part of the League of Explorers, but his hat did.

Explosive Evolution.flavorText: Let's give a big hand for goblin experimentation!

Explosive Runes.flavorText: Sometimes it's safer NOT to read the warning signs.

Explosive Sheep.flavorText: How is this supposed to work? Your enemies think, "Hey! Cute sheep!" and run over to cuddle it?

Explosive Shot.flavorText: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot. Then duck.

Explosive Trap.flavorText: It traps your food AND cooks it for you!

Extra Arms.flavorText: All the better to hug you with!

Extraterrestrial Egg.flavorText: I'll have mine starry-side up please.

Eye for an Eye.flavorText: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.

Eye of Shadow.flavorText: It's hard to makeup flavor text sometimes.

Eye of the Storm.flavorText: If that's the eye, I would hate to see the rest of the storm.

Eyestalk of C'Thun.flavorText: C'Thun sees all...even next week's lottery numbers.

Fable Stablehand.flavorText: She took over the job when Feeble Steeblehand left.

Face Collector.flavorText: “I’ll trade you a Malfurion for an Anduin.”

Faceless Behemoth.flavorText: Rejected names: Forty-Foot Faceless, Big ol' No-face, Huge Creature Sans Face, Teddy.

Faceless Corruptor.flavorText: What does Madame Lazul have against faces?!

Faceless Manipulator.flavorText: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.

Faceless Rager.flavorText: When you need to rage anonymously.

Faceless Shambler.flavorText: "What is that thing?!" "I'm not sure, but it seems to be sort of Ysera shaped."

Faceless Summoner.flavorText: They never get the recognition they deserve.

Faerie Dragon.flavorText: Adorable. Immune to Magic. Doesn't pee on the rug. The perfect pet!

Faire Arborist.flavorText: The bad apple never falls far from the treant.

Fairground Fool.flavorText: "What did Illidan say when his rocketeer broke down on the Darkmoon racetrack? YOU ARE NOT REPAIRED!"

Fairy Tale Forest.flavorText: Man, I wish fairy tales were real, Durg'tash the Sorcerer.

Fal'dorei Strider.flavorText: What’s worse? Seeing the spider, or NOT seeing the spider, but knowing it’s somewhere in your deck?

Fallen Sun Cleric.flavorText: It's hard to keep a Shattered Sun Cleric down.

Famished Fool.flavorText: He's not hungry for food, he's starving for attention!

Fan Club.flavorText: "Well that was weird. Yeah, I just walked up to the president of the fan club, he blabbered on for like 10 minutes, and then gave me a bike voucher..."

Fan of Knives.flavorText: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.

Fan the Hammer.flavorText: I thought Kurtrus was more of a fan of glaives.

Fancy Packaging.flavorText: Wow, this card is great value! Until you open it.

Fandral Staghelm.flavorText: Always manages to mention "Back when I was creating the World Tree…" in EVERY conversation. Sheesh! Enough already.

Fangbound Druid.flavorText: Bound by the law of the fang, these druid floss their teeth twice a day.

Fanottem, Lord of the Opera.flavorText: Writing a compelling symphony takes time. Usually around 20 turns or more.

Far Sight.flavorText: Drek'thar can't see, but he can see. You know what I mean? It's ok if you don't.

Farm Hand.flavorText: I know it's an Undead hand, but bending your pinky in that way can NOT be good for your joints.

Farraki Battleaxe.flavorText: Only two things in life are certain: death and axes.

Fate Splitter.flavorText: "What's the matter with these scissors!? The thread won't cut!!"

Fate Weaver.flavorText: Do not draw the attention of a Fate Weaver, for it will always loom over your destiny.

Fatespinner.flavorText: Her clothing? Pure silk, of course.

Fearless Flamejuggler.flavorText: This is incredibly easy with 6 arms.

Fearsome Doomguard.flavorText: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.

Feast and Famine.flavorText: Please sir, may I have some armor?

Feast of Souls.flavorText: Nothing fills you up like soul food!

Feat of Strength.flavorText: Generally happens right after the airing of grievances.

Feeding Time.flavorText: True, they're only 1/1s, but they eat as much as most 4/4s!

Feign Death.flavorText: The hardest part about doing a "Feign Death" convincingly is learning how to make the right smell. It takes a lot of commitment.

Fel Barrage.flavorText: Kurtrus leapt over a tombstone towards the demonic invaders, yelling "PEW! PEW!" as he shot them down with fel magic.

Fel Cannon.flavorText: The box says, "New and improved, with 200% more fel!"

Fel Fissure.flavorText: This will clear the board, I'm fisSURE of it!

Fel Guardians.flavorText: What happened after the guardians tripped? They Fel.

Fel Orc Soulfiend.flavorText: "Doc says the persistent burning sensation in my soul is probably just an ulcer."

Fel Summoner.flavorText: All's well that ends fel when the fel summoner summons well.

Fel'dorei Warband.flavorText: "Felerin, I made you a friendship bracelet!" "...what? I said WARband, not WRISTband..."

Felfin Navigator.flavorText: Return my fishes to me, and I myself shall carry you to the gates of Mrrhalla!

Felfire Bonfire.flavorText: It was then that Marsh and Mallow understood the meaning of their new nicknames.

Felfire Deadeye.flavorText: She only shoots people who pet her cat without asking first.

Felfire Potion.flavorText: Kazakus has a squad of imps bottling Felfire round-the-clock and he *still* can't keep up with demand.

Felfire Thrusters.flavorText: The coolness factor of a fire decal is universal.

Felfire in the Hole!.flavorText: Fear not, feebleminded friends, for failure to fell your foes with felfire is fundamentally farfetched!

Felguard.flavorText: Yes, he'll fight for you. BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

Felrattler.flavorText: It only rattles when YOU'RE in danger.

Felsaber.flavorText: Some drivers rev their engines. This one growls all on its own.

Felscale Evoker.flavorText: So it’s a demon and a naga, but NOT a dragon?

Felscream Blast.flavorText: All the souls start running when they see the felscream truck.

Felsoul Jailer.flavorText: He can lock 'em up, but he just can't keep 'em.

Felstalker.flavorText: This puppy chews up cards instead of shoes.

Felsteel Executioner.flavorText: "My mom said I could be anything I want."

Felstring Harp.flavorText: Playing it will singe your fingers and wither your soul, but at least it never needs restringing!

Felwalker.flavorText: How it feels to chew Fel Gum.

Fen Creeper.flavorText: He used to be called Bog Beast, but it confused people because he wasn't an actual beast. Boom, New Name!

Fencing Coach.flavorText: Good fencers make good neighbors, right?

Feral Rage.flavorText: Let's be honest. One option is a lot ragier than the other.

Feral Spirit.flavorText: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.

Ferocious Howl.flavorText: Have you ever heard the wolf cry to the blue corn moon?

Festival Security.flavorText: "Incident in the mosh pit? Copy that, be there in a year."

Feugen.flavorText: Feugen is sad because everyone likes Stalagg better.

Fiddlefire Imp.flavorText: Most find the stages set aflame by the Grimtotem too dangerous to perform on, but to him they're perfect!

Field Contact.flavorText: That's not a knife... THIS is a knife!

Field of Strife.flavorText: I heard it's lovely there around this time of year.

Fiendish Circle.flavorText: Like a knitting circle, but less evil.

Fiendish Rites.flavorText: "You have the right to sacrifice an ally. If you do not have an ally, then one will be sacrificed for you."

Fierce Outsider.flavorText: Look, if you stopped breaking stuff you wouldn't have to stay outside.

Fiery War Axe.flavorText: During times of tranquility and harmony, this weapon was called by its less popular name, Chilly Peace Axe.

Fight Over Me.flavorText: And you thought the battles between the Alliance and Horde got ugly…

Fight Promoter.flavorText: "Yeah, I can get you Knuckles. No, no, he's been clean for *weeks*."

Filletfighter.flavorText: "What do you mean this isn't the meal you asked for? ! I made you a Fillet Minion!"

Final Gasp.flavorText: And with a raspy whisper, he uttered his final words, "rez plz."

Find the Imposter.flavorText: My money is on the evil advisor to the king.

Fine Print.flavorText: Text in italics can't hurt you. (Yes it can.)

Finja, the Flying Star.flavorText: The last true master of Finjitsu.

Fire Breather.flavorText: "Phew! That skull has been stuck between my teeth for hours!"

Fire Elemental.flavorText: He can never take a bath. Ewww.

Fire Fly.flavorText: Archnemeses: small children with glass jars.

Fire Hawk.flavorText: It’s our fault for making all those card backs that look like food.

Fire Plume Harbinger.flavorText: Good for summoning elementals. Great for making s'mores.

Fire Plume Phoenix.flavorText: This is what happens when you use a volcano as a bird bath.

Fire Plume's Heart.flavorText: Why does an active volcano need to be defended? To save its ash.

Fire Sale.flavorText: Everything is 50% off now that our warehouse burned down.

Fireball.flavorText: This spell is useful for burning things. If you're looking for spells that toast things, or just warm them a little, you're in the wrong place.

Firebrand.flavorText: Too cool for school, too hot for thought.

Fireguard Destroyer.flavorText: Ragnaros interviews hundreds of Fire Elementals for the position of "Destroyer" but very few have what it takes.

Firelands Portal.flavorText: Come to beautiful Firelands! Where it's "Way nicer than the Abyssal Maw!"

Firetree Witchdoctor.flavorText: If your tree is on fire - stop, drop, and troll.

Firework Elemental.flavorText: The brightest spark can still go dark.

Fireworker.flavorText: The one job where a spark of creativity is unwanted.

Fireworks Tech.flavorText: She learns by trial and error. Mostly error.

First Day of School.flavorText: "Report to the bookstore to buy your books, the alchemist to buy your potions, and then get your wands at the… wandryroom?"

First Flame.flavorText: You never forget your first love: fire.

Fishflinger.flavorText: The scent of fish lingers on the fishflinger's fish fingers.

Fishy Flyer.flavorText: Like a fish out of water.

Flag Runner.flavorText: I see your argument, but…do you have a flag?

Flame Behemoth.flavorText: Always look both ways before crossing the Formation Grounds.

Flame Imp.flavorText: Imps like being on fire. They just do.

Flame Juggler.flavorText: At first he liked juggling chain saws, but then he thought, "Flames are better! Because FIRE!"

Flame Lance.flavorText: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.

Flame Leviathan.flavorText: Mimiron likes to take the Flame Leviathan out on some sweet joyrides.

Flame Ward.flavorText: Not to be confused with the burn ward.

Flamecannon.flavorText: Calling something a flamecannon really doesn't do much to distinguish it from other goblin devices.

Flamereaper.flavorText: Honestly it sows more flame than it reaps.

Flamestrike.flavorText: When the ground is on fire, you should not stop, drop, and roll.

Flametongue Totem.flavorText: Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems. There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.

Flamewaker.flavorText: Flamewakers HATE being confused for Flamewalkers. They just wake up fire, they don’t walk on it. Walking on fire is CRAZY.

Flanking Maneuver.flavorText: So, do we have advantage? Can I sneak attack?

Flanking Strike.flavorText: Wolves to the left and arrows to the right, here I am stuck in the middle with you.

Flare.flavorText: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!

Flark's Boom-Zooka.flavorText: It used to be a Ba-zooka but we ran out of sheep.

Flash Sale.flavorText: HOW LOW! HOW LOW! HOW LOW!

Fleethoof Pearltusk.flavorText: Guest interactions may vary over the duration of the visit.

Flesh Behemoth.flavorText: Perfect for fleshing out your Undead deck.

Flesheating Ghoul.flavorText: 'Flesheating' is an unfair name. It's just that there's not really much else for him to eat.

Fleshshaper.flavorText: Even THIS is better than paper straws.

Flickering Lightbot.flavorText: These bots are sent out with nearly drained batteries, for dramatic effect.

Flight Master.flavorText: Your gryphon will be summoned following a brief safety demonstration.

Flight of the Bronze.flavorText: You're telling me Hearthstone will make a 1 Mana 5/5 with Taunt? Maybe when bronze flies!

Flightmaster Dungar.flavorText: Flight’s a little bumpy, but there’s plenty of legroom.

Flik Skyshiv.flavorText: Junior explorers scan the night sky in fear of her candle’s flame!

Flint Firearm.flavorText: You'll never guess why they call him that.

Flipper Friends.flavorText: Despite the harsh conditions, friends can still be found under the sea.

Floating Watcher.flavorText: "Evil Eye Watcher of Doom" was the original name, but marketing felt it was a bit too aggressive.

Flobbidinous Floop.flavorText: Of all the scientists, he has the most knowledge (when measured in volume).

Floecaster.flavorText: His real name is Melvin, but he prefers his friends call him ... <sigh> ..."Floecaster."

Floop's Glorious Gloop.flavorText: How much gloop could Floop's Gloop gloop if Floop's Gloop could gloop gloop?

Floppy Hydra.flavorText: If you cut one of its heads off, it'll grow back twice as cute!

Florist.flavorText: Trade district. Trade district a shop. Color Legendary. Color Legendary golden. Rose is a rose is a rose is a rose.

Flowrider.flavorText: Her music sounds a lot better underwater where you can't hear it at all.

Fly Off the Shelves.flavorText: No, Whizbang, you can't pass off a poorly made shelf as a cool Priest spell.

Flying Machine.flavorText: To operate, this contraption needs a hula doll on the dashboard. Otherwise it's just a “falling machine.”

Foamrender.flavorText: No honey, we have Shadowmourne at home.

Focused Will.flavorText: Extreme focus is almost as effective as a really flashy distraction.

Foe Reaper 4000.flavorText: Foe reaping is really not so different from harvest reaping, at the end of the day.

Fogsail Freebooter.flavorText: Goes cheap on wardrobe so he can spend on weaponry.

Food Fight.flavorText: Now THIS is the deadliest catch.

Fool's Bane.flavorText: A fool and his bane are soon parted.

For Quel'Thalas!.flavorText: For kwell-kell.. for kell… for kwee- for the city!

Forbidden Ancient.flavorText: This Ancient was banned from the local tavern after tucking a 'Dr. Boom' up its sleeve.

Forbidden Flame.flavorText: WARNING: This flame is not to be used unless you are a licensed acolyte of the Old Gods.

Forbidden Fruit.flavorText: Not forbidden if you have a good dentist!

Forbidden Healing.flavorText: No one's quite sure why it's forbidden. And yes, that should make you nervous.

Forbidden Ritual.flavorText: Actually, C'Thun gives his full support for this ritual.

Forbidden Shaping.flavorText: But the minion arrives covered in goo.

Forbidden Words.flavorText: Please confirm your age before reading this flavor text.

Force of Nature.flavorText: "I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!" - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

Force-Tank MAX.flavorText: There is a factory in Tanaris for crafting force-tanks, but it only ever made two, because of cost overruns.

Foreboding Flame.flavorText: "I am the harbinger of the end times! Soon, destruction will reign and chaos will ensue in the culmination of your demise: waking up 15 minutes before your alarm!"

Forensic Duster.flavorText: He had plenty of experience with dusting things from his time as a butler, so when a murder was committed he saw a real job opportunity!

Forest Guide.flavorText: "Just sign this waiver, and we'll be on our way."

Forest Warden Omu.flavorText: She wishes all things could grow and flourish at Scholomance. If only she knew…

Forge of Souls.flavorText: Powerful weaponry forged by Bronjahm, the Godfather of Souls.

Forge of Wills.flavorText: Standing in the Forge of Wills fills you with a sense of DETERMINATION.

Forged in Flame.flavorText: Don't worry, your wounds are self-cauterizing!

Forgotten Torch.flavorText: Why does a forgotten torch turn into a roaring torch with no provocation? It's one of life's many mysteries.

Forked Lightning.flavorText: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.

Forlorn Stalker.flavorText: He's going to leave the dying up to you, if that's cool.

Former Champ.flavorText: The last time he saw action, Undertaker ruled the meta.

Forsaken Lieutenant.flavorText: WE didn’t forsake him. He CHOSE to defend a tower against the entire Alliance front line by himself.

Fortune Teller.flavorText: "I see a giant piano in your future."

Fossilized Devilsaur.flavorText: This was the only job he could get after the dinosaur theme park debacle.

Fossilized Kaleidosaur.flavorText: He's not that bad if you don't die turn 4.

Foxy Fraud.flavorText: His other street con involves a druid. He can't pull it off without a plant.

Fracking.flavorText: For fhe person who jusf cannof decide whaf card fo puf info a deck!

Framester.flavorText: "Who put these beans in my pocket?!" -Man With Beans in Pocket

Frantic Hippogryph.flavorText: It's killed and it'll kill again!

Frazzled Freshman.flavorText: "Late to bed, early to rise, makes a student unable to open her eyes."

Free Admission.flavorText: "Quick, get in before someone sees you, or worse, someone sees me."

Free Spirit.flavorText: His soul was supposed to go to Ardenweald, but you can't chain a free spirit down.

Freezing Potion.flavorText: This is delicious! Oh no. BRAIN FREEEEEEEZE!

Freezing Trap.flavorText: "Dang, that's cold." - appropriate response to Freezing Trap, or a mean joke.

Frenzied Felwing.flavorText: Not to be confused with the "friendsy” felwing.

Frequency Oscillator.flavorText: Our lawyer made us change the flavor text of this card so we wouldn't get sued.

Fresh Scent.flavorText: *Sniff, sniff* Elite troops... *sniff, sniff* ...armed to the teeth and... *sniff, sniff* ...BAAACON!

Freya, Keeper of Nature.flavorText: Good things come in pairs. Good things come in pairs.

Friendly Bartender.flavorText: "What'll it be? A Jade Brew? A Grimy Goose? A Kabal Manatini?"

Frightened Flunky.flavorText: Some people just aren't cut out to be supervillain material.

Frigid Snobold.flavorText: Ironically, the natural enemy of the snobold is THE CANDLE.

Frizz Kindleroost.flavorText: Frizz knows that baby dragons need warmth, care, and the highest possible level of goblin engineering.

From De Other Side.flavorText: Why did Drakuru cross the road?

From the Depths.flavorText: "This is why I'm afraid of the deep end of the pool."

From the Scrapheap.flavorText: Well that's a load of scrap.

Front Lines.flavorText: With the line in the sand crossed, the battle for the Throne of Tides had begun.

Frost Elemental.flavorText: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...

Frost Giant.flavorText: Don't ask him about the beard. JUST DON'T.

Frost Lich Cross-Stitch.flavorText: Do not fear power... Fear those who SEW IT!

Frost Lich Jaina.flavorText: "Arthas was a spoiled child, playing with toys he could neither control nor understand. Come into the cold. I will show you the true power of the Frozen Throne."

Frost Nova.flavorText: Hey man, that's cold. Literally and metaphorically.

Frost Queen Sindragosa.flavorText: With her final breath, Sindragosa cursed her consort and all who abandoned her to die in Icecrown. When she was reborn by the hands of the Lich King, her first freezing exhale wrought only pain.

Frost Strike.flavorText: Anyone up for some frost bowling?

Frostbite.flavorText: The sad reality of a raging toothpaste addiction.

Frostbitten Freebooter.flavorText: Alongside Eliza Goreblade and Peggy Brittlebone, the three Pirate Sisters terrorize the sea.

Frostbolt.flavorText: It is customary to yell "Chill out!" or "Freeze!" or "Ice ice, baby!" when you play this card.

Frostfin Chomper.flavorText: If you want good sushi, it is important to always keep your murlocs on ice.

Frostmourne.flavorText: Death Nights, Frost Morn, what's next - Blood Noon?

Frostsaber Matriarch.flavorText: They say “don’t poke the bear”, but they NEVER said “don’t poke the frostsaber or her cubs”.

Frostweave Dungeoneer.flavorText: It's a woven blanket of ice but surprisingly comforting.

Frostwolf Grunt.flavorText: Grunting is what his father did and his father before that. It's more than just a job.

Frostwolf Kennels.flavorText: The 1 reason Alliance members defect to the Horde is to adopt a cute frostwolf puppy.

Frostwolf Warlord.flavorText: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley. Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.

Frostwolf Warmaster.flavorText: “The spoils of war ain’t free… Unless you’re me!”

Frostwyrm's Fury.flavorText: Terrible destruction, but minty fresh breath!

Frosty D\u00e9cor.flavorText: "Yeah, Nature magic pays the bills, but my passion lies elsewhere."

Frothing Berserker.flavorText: He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.

Frozen Buckler.flavorText: "Hey, I bet I could shatter this."

Frozen Clone.flavorText: It's like déjà vu, times two.

Frozen Mammoth.flavorText: *record scratch* "So, you may be wondering how I got here."

Frozen Over.flavorText: We will find out who wins when we return in the spring.

Frozen Shadoweaver.flavorText: She still wears her Frozen Shadoweave set despite the many, many nerfs. She just can't let it go!

Frozen Touch.flavorText: Is this what Bob was talking about when he said he served a drink to a Death Knight once?

Full-Blown Evil.flavorText: This isn’t your average, everyday evil. This is ADVANCED evil.

Fungal Fortunes.flavorText: Far superior to a beanstalk boondoggle.

Fungalmancer.flavorText: Fungalmancy is the easy major for those who can't cut it at Waxmancy.

Funhouse Mirror.flavorText: Funhouse mirror on the wall, Who's the tallest gnome of all?

Funnel Cake.flavorText: After all this time…. I thought it'd be bigger!

Furbolg Mossbinder.flavorText: Behold, the unstoppable power of MOSS!

Furious Ettin.flavorText: One head is a morning person. The other head hates morning people.

Furious Felfin.flavorText: Signature moves include Eye Bream, Feast of Soles, and Metamorphofish.

Furious Fowls.flavorText: They were already mad and you had to call them 'foul'??

Furnace Fuel.flavorText: Remember Ultrasaur? This is him now. Feel old yet?

Furnacefire Colossus.flavorText: Smelts in his mouth, not in your hand.

Fury (Rank 1).flavorText: Rank 3 is when your mom uses your middle name.

Future Emissary.flavorText: When Murozond attacked the past, Nozdormu sought help from the future, even journeying as far as the Forbidden Reach.

Fye, the Setting Sun.flavorText: There is a dragon way down in Bloodrock They call the Setting Sun

G'huun the Blood God.flavorText: All of the other Old Gods used to laugh and call him names. They never let poor G'huun join in any Old God games.

Gadgetzan Auctioneer.flavorText: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.

Gadgetzan Ferryman.flavorText: Is it just me, or is there something fishy about that ferryman?

Gadgetzan Jouster.flavorText: It's not HER fault you didn't put a spinning saw blade on your horse.

Gadgetzan Socialite.flavorText: Comment on her height, and she'll go from flapper to kneecapper in seconds flat.

Gahz'rilla.flavorText: The Sen'jin High football team is The Gahz'rillas.

Gaia, the Techtonic.flavorText: Always planning ahead, Ini knew she'd need this invention to protect all her other inventions.

Galactic Crusader.flavorText: The will was very specific that in the event of the Crusader's death, you were to inherit these random spells. Very odd.

Galakrond, the Nightmare.flavorText: The enormous creature unfurled terrifying claws dripping with poisonous ichor. King Togwaggle was pleased, but inwardly disappointed the great Nightmare refused to wear the candle.

Galakrond, the Tempest.flavorText: Hagatha cried out over the winds: "Truly, you are as powerful as the Maelstrom!" To which the Tempest answered: "I AM THE MAELSTROM."

Galakrond, the Unbreakable.flavorText: The ground quaked beneath the behemoth as Dr. Boom continued: "…with over 400 TONS of solid Storm Silver plate." Then he beeped a small remote. "And luxury spikes!"

Galakrond, the Unspeakable.flavorText: Lazul called Galakrond’s name, her voice echoed by whispers from the deep. Both of Galakrond’s eyes opened… and then other eyes opened, as well.

Galakrond, the Wretched.flavorText: Fel-flames slowly writhed around the skeleton, until the great bones knit themselves together into a demonic monstrosity. Rafaam shielded his face from the heat but could not hide his grin.

Galloping Savior.flavorText: "Look to my coming on the first light of the third card."

Galvanizer.flavorText: Also known as a power zinc.

Game Master.flavorText: "You hear the mrgrgls of angry murlocs approaching. Roll initiative!"

Gang Up.flavorText: If you are thinking about visiting Moonbrook, you better roll deep.

Garden Gnome.flavorText: "Greetings, my little shrubs... It's whittlin' time."

Garrison Commander.flavorText: He'll never admit it, but he pushes you hard because he really cares about you.

Garrote.flavorText: "I don't have money… but what I do have is a particular set of skills."

Gaslight Gatekeeper.flavorText: This girl is such a boss.

Gather Your Party.flavorText: Thrilling adventure! Danger guaranteed! Loot uncertain! Death optional! Who’s with me?

Gattlesnake.flavorText: He used to be an ordinary snake until he slithered through a saloon during a brawl and walked out looking like this.

Gazlowe.flavorText: Gazlowe was voted "Most Likely to Explode" in high school.

Gelbin Mekkatorque.flavorText: He's the leader of the gnomes, and an incredible inventor. He's getting better, too; He turns things into chickens WAY less than he used to.

General Vezax.flavorText: Contrast this with Specific Vezax, who only gets resummoned if you have exactly 4 Armor.

Generous Mummy.flavorText: Yeah, she's mummified, but her money hasn’t dried up!

Genn Greymane.flavorText: Ever since Sylvanas killed his son, he's dreamed of getting… even.

Gentle Megasaur.flavorText: "Low, low rents! Must enjoy a nomadic lifestyle. Quasi-sentient, bipedal, amphibious humanoids ONLY!"

Genzo, the Shark.flavorText: Infamous in the seedy underground card rooms of Gadgetzan, he got his nickname winning the coveted Shark Plushie in the city's first Hearthstone tournament.

Geosculptor Yip.flavorText: Once crafted a gauntlet out of earwax and pure ambition.

Germination.flavorText: I regret asking how sporelings are made.

Ghastly Conjurer.flavorText: Wearing purple after the holidays? GHASTLY!

Ghastly Gravedigger.flavorText: Some people take their secrets to the grave.

Ghost Writer.flavorText: This eccentric scribe was cursed to an afterlife of never being recognized for his talents! Muahaha!

Ghostly Charger.flavorText: Maybe we should have called him Ghostly Rusher.

Ghoulish Alchemist.flavorText: AND I THREW IT ON THE GROUND!

Ghouls' Night.flavorText: "Ohmygosh, did you hear what Jessicorpse said to Deathanny??"

Giant Mastodon.flavorText: Still salty about it not being the "Year of the Mastodon."

Giant Sand Worm.flavorText: Banned from every all-you-can-eat buffet on Azeroth.

Giant Tumbleweed!!!.flavorText: Skarr's second-biggest hobby after laying waste to the Badlands is bowling.

Giant Wasp.flavorText: Float like a butterfly, sting like a giant wasp!

Gibbering Reject.flavorText: Don't get it wet or feed it after midnight.

Gibberling.flavorText: "As a Linguistics student I have studied the Gibberlings. I have determined they are speaking Gibberish."

Gift of Luminance.flavorText: You get a small version of yourself in a snow globe to remember the moment.

Gift of the Naaru.flavorText: What do I look like, a charity?

Gift of the Wild.flavorText: The gift that keeps on living.

Gifts of Azshara.flavorText: Barber: What do you want? Naga: You ever have a thirst for arcane power? Barber: Say no more.

Giftwrapped Whelp.flavorText: Don't forget to poke fire-breathing holes in the box!

Gigafin.flavorText: How much storage does Gigafin's Maw have? About a giga bite.

Gigantotem.flavorText: Totem Golem's uncle, gone too soon.

Giggling Inventor.flavorText: "I shall build a mighty golden paladin! And he will GREET the WORLD!"

Giggling Toymaker.flavorText: "HAHAhehehe. Hahaha he." -Me when I'm making toys

Gilblin Stalker.flavorText: "Shhh, I think I hear something." "Ah, it's probably nothing." - Every Henchman

Gilded Gargoyle.flavorText: You hear a coin rattling inside the slotted gargoyle...What could it mean?

Gilnean Royal Guard.flavorText: Admittedly, they kind of dropped the ball with Prince Liam.

Glacial Advance.flavorText: You just wait, I'll get there in 10 years and then you'll be sorry.

Glacial Mysteries.flavorText: The secret is in the frosting.

Glaciate.flavorText: We now have a more accurate answer to the age-old question "What's cooler than being cool?"

Glacier Racer.flavorText: It’s just not the same without a super suit.

Gladiator's Longbow.flavorText: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.

Glaivebound Adept.flavorText: "Initiate, this is your glaive. Think of it as an extension of yourself... Did you just throw it?!"

Glaiveshark.flavorText: Can smell a drop of vengeance in the water up to a mile away.

Glaivetar.flavorText: Might need tuning, I think it's a bit sharp.

Glaivezooka.flavorText: For the times when a regular bazooka just isn't enough.

Glide.flavorText: "Come with me, and you'll see, a whole new hand of possibly the same cards."

Glinda Crowskin.flavorText: Summon an unlimited* number of minions!** *Six **Wisps

Glitter Moth.flavorText: Some moths are attracted to flame. This one's attracted to disco.

Gloom Stag.flavorText: Majestic. Ethereal. Still pretty down in the dumps, though.

Gloomstone Guardian.flavorText: From the same people who brought you Choose One, and Choose Twice, comes the exciting prequel: Choose NEITHER!

Gloop Sprayer.flavorText: "Are you sure that's enough gloop?" "Hold on."

Glory Chaser.flavorText: When you've reached the peak of competition twice, how hard can winning one valley be?

Glow-Tron.flavorText: They tried for weeks to make a stealth version, but eventually decided to just let it glow.

Glowfly Swarm.flavorText: Glowflies are distant relations to spelling bees.

Glowstone Gyreworm.flavorText: Believe it or not, this is Tram Conductor Gerry's Gyreworm. But is it pronounced Gerry's Gyreworm, Gerry's Gyreworm, Gerry's Gyreworm, or Gerry's Gyreworm?

Glowstone Technician.flavorText: "Windell! More light!" "I'm givin' it all she's got, Kangor!"

Glugg the Gulper.flavorText: Food can be scarce in the Abyssal Depths, leading its top predators to pursue any potential source of sustenance. Even extra crunchy ones.

Gluttonous Ooze.flavorText: Three time winner of the Un'Goro weapon eating contest.

Gnash.flavorText: It's rude to gnash with your mouth open.

Gnomeregan Infantry.flavorText: The gnomes are valiant and ready to return to their irradiated, poorly ventilated homeland!

Gnomish Experimenter.flavorText: He's legitimately surprised every time he turns himself into a chicken.

Gnomish Inventor.flavorText: She's never quite sure what she's making, she just knows it's AWESOME!

Go with the Flow.flavorText: Just go with the flow, bro! No mo' woe fo' yo'!

Goblin Auto-Barber.flavorText: This guy is excellent at adjusting your haircut and/or height.

Goblin Blastmage.flavorText: If you can't find a bomb to throw, just pick up any goblin invention and throw that.

Goblin Bomb.flavorText: They're Dr. Boom's babies. His baby boomers.

Goblin Sapper.flavorText: He’s not such a binge exploder anymore. These days, he only explodes socially.

Goboglide Tech.flavorText: The word "glide" is always in quotes in the manual.

Going Down Swinging.flavorText: Halveria was outcast from Gilneas for being too edgy, which she sees as an achievement.

Golakka Crawler.flavorText: Universally adored by both control decks and ninjas.

Golakka Glutton.flavorText: We lost our last cook to one of these.

Gold Panner.flavorText: "I don't know why everyone's got their overalls in a jumble with Azerite minin' when there's all this GOLD for the takin'!"

Gold Road Grunt.flavorText: No, no, no, Gold Roads are very different from Yellow Brick Roads.

Golden Scarab.flavorText: Who actually puts all the gold plating on these things, and why?

Goldshire Footman.flavorText: If 1/2 minions are all that is defending Goldshire, you would think it would have been overrun years ago.

Goldshire Gnoll.flavorText: They're searching for one ring. They're pretty sure someone said Goldshire.

Goldwing.flavorText: This HAS to be worth more dust, right?

Golganneth, the Thunderer.flavorText: With dominion over the seas and skies, Golganneth fearlessly wields the power of nature to serve the Pantheon.

Goliath, Sneed's Masterpiece.flavorText: “Listen, this baby has blades, rockets, and rocket blades. Only thing it doesn’t have is good gas mileage.”

Gone Fishin'.flavorText: Rogues want me Fish fear me

Gonk, the Raptor.flavorText: There’s a word for Zandalari druids who refuse to pledge loyalty to Gonk: “Delicious.”

Goody Two-Shields.flavorText: These are my shields. There are at least two like them, and both are mine.

Gorehowl.flavorText: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe. Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession. Quite the mystery!

Gorgonzormu.flavorText: Don't remove this from your deck or else you'll be cutting the cheese.

Gorillabot A-3.flavorText: A-1 and A-2 went nuts, when they should have gone bolts.

Gorloc Ravager.flavorText: Be careful what you fish for.

Gorm the Worldeater.flavorText: His diet consists of entire WORLDS! Because moons upset his tummy.

Gormok the Impaler.flavorText: Gormok has been giving impaling lessons in a small tent near the tournament grounds. For only 25g you too could learn the fine art of impaling!

Grace of the Highfather.flavorText: The fish was thiiiiis big, can you believe it?

Gral, the Shark.flavorText: “… We’re gonna need a bigger board.”

Grand Crusader.flavorText: A veteran of a number of crusades, she is a force for light and goodness. Her latest crusade is against goblin telemarketers.

Grand Empress Shek'zara.flavorText: So is a Grand Empress an empress that's grand or an empress's empress?

Grand Finale.flavorText: Considering all the other hazards at Darkmoon, overindulgent pyrotechnics seem downright pedestrian.

Grand Lackey Erkh.flavorText: Esteemed leader of Rafaam's Inhuman Resources department.

Grand Magister Rommath.flavorText: A powerful mage known for his proficiencies in Fire, Frost, and Algebra.

Grand Magus Antonidas.flavorText: He's really disappointed Jaina became a frost mage.

Grand Totem Eys'or.flavorText: Some say it can see straight into the soul of any who dare to read its flavor text...

Granite Forgeborn.flavorText: If he stops being useful, just turn him into a kitchen countertop.

Grave Defiler.flavorText: She keeps her Fel spells nice and organized in her defiling cabinet.

Grave Digging.flavorText: Grave digging as a profession has high turnover; it's important to maintain headcount.

Grave Horror.flavorText: Trolls can regenerate lost limbs, but this is what they do with the leftovers.

Grave Rune.flavorText: I'm gravely sorry to rune this.

Grave Shambler.flavorText: I think one of the necromancers got a little carried away.

Gravelsnout Knight.flavorText: The mole of La Mancha rides again!

Graveyard Shift.flavorText: "Why are we even open at night? This place is dead!"

Gravity Lapse.flavorText: Did someone forget to pay the gravity bill?

Great Hall.flavorText: It's fabulous! It's grand! It's, well it's really very nice.

Greater Arcane Missiles.flavorText: Wow, and I thought Arcane Missiles was great!

Greedy Partner.flavorText: "Don't worry, we'll evenly split the bounty. Then I'll have two evenly sized piles of gold!"

Greedy Sprite.flavorText: Sparkliest of the seven deadly sprites.

Green Jelly.flavorText: This card really breaks out of the mold.

Green-Thumb Gardener.flavorText: Sometimes all a plant needs is, like, A LOT of water.

Grey Sage Parrot.flavorText: Nothing is more terrifying than a parrot squawking "Pyroblast!"

Greybough.flavorText: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The next best time is when you lose a minion.

Grievous Bite.flavorText: Ooh. I'll have a bite of this, and of this, and of this...

Griftah.flavorText: With Griftah in your deck, sometimes you start the game with The Coin!

Griftah, Trusted Vendor.flavorText: "Tiki mugs will match any kind of home décor! They're timeless!"

Grillmaster.flavorText: Do you want your steak well done, rare, or LEGENDARY?
