Grim Patron.flavorText: If you love getting your face punched, come to the Grim Guzzler!

Grimestreet Enforcer.flavorText: "Sir, you don't have a permit to park your mount here."

Grimestreet Informant.flavorText: "Naw, naw. You're talkin' about Grime BOULEVARD. I ain't know nuthin' 'bout that."

Grimestreet Outfitter.flavorText: If you bargain hard, he'll throw in the hat.

Grimestreet Pawnbroker.flavorText: "I don't know a lot about used GvG cards, so I'm going to have to call in an expert."

Grimestreet Protector.flavorText: Some new asphalt should do the trick.

Grimestreet Smuggler.flavorText: She's got anything you want. Need the latest derpinger? No problem!

Grimoire of Sacrifice.flavorText: "What kind of bedtime story is this?"

Grimscale Chum.flavorText: Listen, see? We'll take 'em to the docks, see? And throw 'em in the sea, see?

Grimscale Oracle.flavorText: These are the brainy murlocs. It turns out that doesn’t mean much.

Grimtotem Bounty Hunter.flavorText: He’ll take a big weight off your shoulders.

Grimtotem Buzzkill.flavorText: I'd be mad too if you called me a 'buzzkill'.

Grimy Gadgeteer.flavorText: "You look like a Gadgetgun 3000-Mark IV man, am I right?"

Grizzled Wizard.flavorText: When he was young, he was an Outrageous Magus.

Grommash Hellscream.flavorText: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes! Maybe not his best decision.

Grook Fu Master.flavorText: Grook Fu, the ancient Hozen art of bashing heads with a stick.

Groovy Cat.flavorText: "Like, what if we're all just cards living in this box called Hearthstone, man?"

Grotesque Dragonhawk.flavorText: They say that "grotesque is in the eye of the beholder," but that's just because they've never seen a Grotesque Dragonhawk. Yikes!

Groundskeeper.flavorText: It’s tricky for dryads to tend the garden without trampling the flowers.

Grove Tender.flavorText: Likes: Hiking and the great outdoors. Dislikes: Goblin shredders and sandals. (Can’t find any that fit!).

Grumble, Worldshaker.flavorText: The grumbling grew to a mighty rumbling, and out of the caverns the kobolds came tumbling.

Gruul.flavorText: He's Gruul "the Dragonkiller". He just wanted to cuddle them… he never meant to…

Guard the City.flavorText: At thousands of feet below the surface, it's a pretty high-pressure job.

Guardian Animals.flavorText: The guidelines specifically state: "Students may also bring an ironbeak owl OR an alleycat OR a toad." They never said how big.

Guardian Augmerchant.flavorText: "What doesn't kill you makes me money!"

Guardian of Kings.flavorText: Holy beings from the beyond are so cliché!

Guess the Weight.flavorText: "And then at the last second, I'll shapeshift into cat form!"

Guff Runetotem.flavorText: "By the twins above and twins below, our companions will lead us through." —Guff Runetotem

Guild Trader.flavorText: Somehow, she manages six different professions.

Guitar Soloist.flavorText: She is the hero of the guitar. The guitar hero. Trademark.

Gunslinger Kurtrus.flavorText: "I have given up (a single copy of) EVERYTHING! What have YOU sacrificed?"

Gurubashi Chicken.flavorText: “Ya hold it by da feet, mon. Den ya THROW.”

Gurubashi Hypemon.flavorText: Throw your hands in the air! They cost (1).

Gurubashi Offering.flavorText: For a limited time, loa blessings are on a pray-one-get-two deal (on selected sacrifices only).

Gyreworm.flavorText: This game of ring toss just got really intense.

Gyrocopter.flavorText: The hula doll is still absolutely required.

Hack the System.flavorText: Anything can be hacked, if you're holding an axe.

Hadronox.flavorText: The viziers of Azjol-Nerub released Hadronox as a last-ditch effort to hold back the Lich King. They did so by VERY carefully scooping him up in a LARGE newspaper and releasing him.

Hagatha the Witch.flavorText: Curse-bringer, tree-twister, mother of wretched things…Hanzo main.

Hagatha's Scheme.flavorText: "All shall suffer!" "But Hagatha, those are your minions..." "I said ALL!!!"

Hailbringer.flavorText: Knows every way to greet someone.

Hakkar, the Soulflayer.flavorText: ATTENTION: Do not enter any major city while infected with the Corrupted Blood!

Halazzi, the Lynx.flavorText: Remember, you’re only as strong as your weakest lynx.

Halduron Brightwing.flavorText: I wanted to generate a legendary, but I held da wrong Brightwing.

Haleh, Matron Protectorate.flavorText: Oh, how do you solve a problem like Onyxia?

Half-Time Scavenger.flavorText: One player's trash is another's “Best In Slot”.

Halkias.flavorText: Everybody tough until the sinstones start walking.

Hallucination.flavorText: It's the good kind of hallucination.

Halveria Darkraven.flavorText: You know someone's cool when their name sounds like a font.

Hammer of Wrath.flavorText: A good paladin has many tools. Hammer of Wrath, Pliers of Vengeance, Hacksaw of Justice, etc.

Hammer of the Naaru.flavorText: The naaru wasn't using it. It doesn't have arms.

Hand of A'dal.flavorText: When it meets the Hand of Gul'dan, they're SHAKING.

Hand of Gul'dan.flavorText: His skull also draws three cards. Imagine how many cards he could draw with HIS ENTIRE BODY!

Hand of Protection.flavorText: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins don’t know what it should be called anymore.

Handle with Bear.flavorText: We guarantee your luggage will arrive at the speed of bear.

Handmaiden.flavorText: Why did she unspool the last roll of royal toilet paper?!

Harbinger Celestia.flavorText: She wanders realities, taking on many forms. One was a unicorn princess.

Harbor Scamp.flavorText: Hey, that gnome looks awfully fishy…

Hardcore Cultist.flavorText: Thumb in = devil horns. Thumb out = I love you. A VERY important distinction when you're at a metal concert.

Harmonic Disco.flavorText: "Worry not, festival patrons! A disco is hardly any means for panic!"

Harmonic Hip Hop.flavorText: I can name four things that rhyme with 'orange': Four inch, Door hinge, Syringe, and uh… Shmorange.

Harmonic Metal.flavorText: I have bashed together plenty of pieces of metal in my day and not ONCE has it sounded harmonic.

Harmonic Mood.flavorText: ROYGBive your hero +2 Attack this turn.

Harmonic Pop.flavorText: Here with supporting vocals: Snap and Crackle!

Harmonica Soloist.flavorText: A magician never reveals their Secrets. A musician on the other hand...

Harrison Jones.flavorText: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”

Harrowing Ox.flavorText: Dead or alive, you're pulling that plow.

Harth Stonebrew.flavorText: "Grab a slice by the hearth and enjoy the festivities. This celebration is for all of us!" -Harth

Harvest Golem.flavorText: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."

Haunting Nightmare.flavorText: Not as scary as the one where all my teeth fall out.

Haunting Visions.flavorText: When you're awake at 3 AM and can't stop thinking about that time you called your teacher "mom."

Hawkstrider Rancher.flavorText: I prefer the Hawkstrider Nacho Cheeser.

Headcrack.flavorText: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.

Headmaster Kel'Thuzad.flavorText: "You wish to know my secrets, hmm? I carry little bits of tuna in the sleeves of my robe, he loves that. Oh, you meant the risen dead? That was trivial, trivial."

Healing Wave.flavorText: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.

Heart of the Legion.flavorText: It grew 3 sizes after trying to steal Winter Veil.

Heart of the Wild.flavorText: In each of us beats a wild heart. Except the Forsaken.

Heartbreaker Hedanis.flavorText: Hedanis has won over the hearts and minds of millions of fans all over Azeroth! Shadow magic had nothing to do with it - not that you asked or anything.

Heartthrob.flavorText: Oh no, Harth! Look out! He's here to rob you!

Heat Wave.flavorText: This is the hottest summer of your life so far.

Heavy Metal!.flavorText: This metal is so heavy it will satisfy your iron requirements for the next year.

Heavy Plate.flavorText: "You asked for unbendable, unwavering armor–I don't see why you're upset."

Hecklebot.flavorText: Built by goblins, designed by a troll.

Hecklefang Hyena.flavorText: Even their teeth are laughing at you.

Hedge Maze.flavorText: If you keep seeing a statue of the Sire, you’re not going in circles. There’s just so many of them.

Hedra the Heretic.flavorText: Hedra was cast out millennia ago for her divisive opinions among the Naga, such as "Turning into evil underwater serpent people was bad, actually."

Heistbaron Togwaggle.flavorText: A staunch ally of Rafaam, at least while the shinies keep flowing.

Hellfire.flavorText: It's spells like these that make it hard for Warlocks to get decent help.

Helm of Humiliation.flavorText: <whispers> "...and your father was a Murloc too."

Helmet Hermit.flavorText: I’d avoid asking if it wants to join the battle. It’s been pretty crabby lately.

Helpless Hatchling.flavorText: It can’t be all that helpful. Not wif dose widdle wings!

Helya.flavorText: Named after the first thing Odyn said after landing a sick kickflip.

Hematurge.flavorText: She's here to PUMP! YOU UP!

Hemet Nesingwary.flavorText: It's hard to make a living as a hunter in a world where beasts instantly reappear minutes after you kill them.

Hemet, Foam Marksman.flavorText: So THIS is who's been lowering the power level of all those Hearthstone cards in a foamly fashion.

Hemet, Jungle Hunter.flavorText: The goblin travel agency lost his luggage, but he's still having a great vacation!

Hench-Clan Burglar.flavorText: She’s more of a rat burglar.

Hench-Clan Hag.flavorText: The Hench Clan is an equal opportunity employer, no matter which parts of you came from where.

Hench-Clan Hogsteed.flavorText: This is CLEARLY their first rodeo.

Hench-Clan Sneak.flavorText: He’d be a lot sneakier if he wasn’t trailing 300 yards of power cable…

Hench-Clan Thug.flavorText: Hard time making ends meet? Hate the League of Explorers? Get a job henching!

Herald Volazj.flavorText: His whole job is yelling "Yogg-Saron comin'!"

Herald of Chaos.flavorText: They used to be called the Heralds of Order before all of this silly Sundering nonsense.

Herald of Light.flavorText: Wake up! No sleeping in with the fishes!

Herald of Lokholar.flavorText: “I don’t care how hot it is. I am not going over there to be your air conditioning."

Herald of Nature.flavorText: A mother of plants in mother of pearl.

Heroic Innkeeper.flavorText: We reserve the right to refuse service to any 1/1.

Heroic Strike.flavorText: Really, if you're a hero, this is every strike.

Hex.flavorText: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?

Hex Lord Malacrass.flavorText: Extremely awkward cousin of Hex Lord Malaclass.

Hi Ho Silverwing.flavorText: I swear this minion had 3000 Attack at one point!

Hidden Cache.flavorText: There is an urban legend that the first Toxic Sewer Ooze was born because a rookie Goon stashed an open container of milk in a Hidden Cache.

Hidden Gem.flavorText: This will be a staple in Unicorn Priest.

Hidden Meaning.flavorText: I'm telling you, if you play the song backwards at triple speed I SWEAR Mukla sings about the Burning Legion.

Hidden Oasis.flavorText: Amazing that it's been hidden, given the twenty-foot treant splashing around in it.

Hidden Objects.flavorText: There are 99 gnomes in this picture. Can YOU find them all?

Hidden Wisdom.flavorText: Find your own wisdom. Perhaps behind the couch.

High Abbess Alura.flavorText: She's all about hitting the books. Literally.

High Cultist Basaleph.flavorText: "It's not a cult! It's a collection of like-minded individuals that enjoy undead. And rituals. And doing what I say. "

High Exarch Yrel.flavorText: There can be no neutrality in the fight against darkness.

High Inquisitor Whitemane.flavorText: No one told her that champions want to sleep in.

High Noon Duelist.flavorText: "My ultimate is rea- ah, errr, I mean, I have enough Mana."

High Priest Amet.flavorText: All minions are equal, but some minions are more equal than others.

High Priest Thekal.flavorText: "…and then I beat him with 1 Health!"

High Priestess Jeklik.flavorText: If you love Jeklik, set her free. YOU CAN'T GET RID OF HER.

Highlord Fordragon.flavorText: "Through my faith and my courage, I shall be protected. And through my honor and sacrifice, another will rise in my place."

Hippogryph.flavorText: Known for its ferocious grace, the hippogryph is a truly majestic creature. Except when molting.

Hipster.flavorText: Oh, so you like Hearthstone? Name every spell.

Hired Gun.flavorText: He loves his job and would do it for free! (But don't tell his boss!)

Hoard Pillager.flavorText: Better to have stabbed and lost. And then found again!

Hoarding Dragon.flavorText: Keeps his two cents to himself.

Hobart Grapplehammer.flavorText: Grapplehammer is the horrible mind behind the Automatic Piranha Launcher (banned in 7 districts)!

Hobgoblin.flavorText: Hobgoblins are meeting next week to discuss union benefits. First on the list: dental plan.

Hodir, Father of Giants.flavorText: Giant ladies, this one's a Keeper.

Hog Rancher.flavorText: Suspiciously close to a Quilboar village.

Hogger.flavorText: Hogger is super powerful. If you kill him, it's because he let you.

Hogger, Doom of Elwynn.flavorText: When C'thun went to sleep, he checked under his bed for Hogger.

Hollow Abomination.flavorText: As soon as you land your first Honorable Kill, trust me, you'll be hooked!

Hollow Hound.flavorText: Uh oh, the hollow hound is coming out of its cage! Don't worry though, it's doing just fine.

Hologram Operator.flavorText: Help me, Temporary Draenei. You're my only hope!

Holomancer.flavorText: Help me, worthy opponent. You're my only hope.

Holotechnician.flavorText: Ironically, operating the spotlight comes with very little recognition.

Holy Champion.flavorText: She really likes seeing people get better. That's why she hurts them in the first place.

Holy Cowboy.flavorText: Wait, but… Isn't he more of a 'holy kodoboy'?

Holy Glowsticks.flavorText: Somewhere there's a Naaru missing a couple of shards.

Holy Light.flavorText: If you are often bathed in Holy Light, you should consider wearing sunscreen.

Holy Maki Roll.flavorText: If you use all 10 mana, that's called the 'Lunch Special.'

Holy Nova.flavorText: If the Holy Light forsakes you, good luck casting this spell. Also, you're probably a jerk.

Holy Ripple.flavorText: I still prefer the taste of banana fudge ripple.

Holy Smite.flavorText: It doesn't matter how pious you are. Everyone needs a good smiting now and again.

Holy Springwater.flavorText: Issa bah oh auh woh ah!

Holy Water.flavorText: For a healthier option, try Holy Water: Zero.

Hooded Acolyte.flavorText: Wait, what kind of acolyte doesn't wear a hood?

Hooked Reaver.flavorText: The hook is just an accessory. He can reave just fine without it.

Hooked Scimitar.flavorText: Oooooooooooow. I'm hooked on a scimitar!

Hope of Quel'Thalas.flavorText: Hey, give me a minute. I just need to load my.... uh, hope.

Horde Operative.flavorText: "We all have our secrets. I mean, your secrets."

Horn of Winter.flavorText: Much better than the Horn of Loseter.

Horn of Wrathion.flavorText: You can count the rings and find out Wrathion's true age.

Horrendous Growth.flavorText: Stop picking at it! You’re only making it worse.

Horseshoe Slinger.flavorText: Some people think this card is broken, but I think it's farrier than that.

Hostile Invader.flavorText: "And my Axe!" "And my Axe!" "And my Axe!"

Hot Air Balloon.flavorText: The Gadgetzan Pilgrim's Bounty parade is missing a float this year.

Hot Coals.flavorText: This is what Greatfather Winter gives you when you've been REALLY naughty.

Hot Spring Guardian.flavorText: NONE SHALL PASS until at least an hour after eating.

Hot Streak.flavorText: It's easy to catch fire when you're on fire.

Houndmaster.flavorText: "Who let the dogs out?" he asks. It's rhetorical.

Howdyfin.flavorText: You know who to blame if your drinking water tastes a little fishy.

Howlfiend.flavorText: The problem is that he carries those cards in his mouth.

Howling Blast.flavorText: For Death Knights, yelling really loudly is a valid attack strategy.

Howling Commander.flavorText: Enlistment in her battalion comes with several pairs of earplugs.

Hozen Healer.flavorText: He didn't go to school for healing, but we keep losing all the good healers to Ratchet, so I guess we'll take him.

Huddle Up.flavorText: Spell, Naga, Naga, Naga, Naga, Naga, Naga, Naga...

Hulking Overfiend.flavorText: To hulk, perhaps, to fiend: ay, there's the rub.

Hullbreaker.flavorText: Breaks through the hard shell to reach the ship's gooey interior.

Humility.flavorText: This card makes something really damp. Oh wait. That's "Humidity."

Humongous Razorleaf.flavorText: Loves goblins. In a light cream sauce.

Hungry Dragon.flavorText: Hungry Hungry Dragon is NOT a fun game.

Hungry Ettin.flavorText: How can he be hungry… if he's Ettin!?

Hunter's Mark.flavorText: Never play 'Hide and Go Seek' with a Hunter.

Hunting Mastiff.flavorText: "Shh! You're going to start a howl!"

Hunting Party.flavorText: Not sure I’d call it a good party if everyone ends up beside themselves.

Huntsman Altimor.flavorText: He loves all his Gargons equally. (Hecutis is his favorite and it's not close.)

Hydralodon.flavorText: Deep beneath the waves, this hydra grew to incredible size based on a steady diet of literally anything that crossed its path.

Hydration Station.flavorText: They're drinking in herds... they do drink in herds.

Hydration Totem.flavorText: This filtered water really cleanses the spirit.

Hydrologist.flavorText: Murloc hydrologists are pretty rare. Most murloc undergrads pick computer science.

Hyena Alpha.flavorText: Everything the sun touches is ours—so long as it's already dead.

Hyldnir Frostrider.flavorText: Don't be fooled, that polar bear's the one in charge.

Hysteria.flavorText: "My mount and I share a special connection. Just not a good one."

I Know a Guy.flavorText: Well… a guy who knows a guy.

Ice Barrier.flavorText: This is Rank 1. Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.

Ice Block.flavorText: Ice is nice, and will suffice!

Ice Breaker.flavorText: A great way to end a conversation.

Ice Cream Peddler.flavorText: I scream, you scream, we all scream when we see a Freeze Mage.

Ice Fishing.flavorText: Glow fish, war fish... blow fish, more fish...

Ice Lance.flavorText: The trick is not to break the lance. Otherwise, you have "Ice Pieces." Ice Pieces aren't as effective.

Ice Rager.flavorText: He's a lot cooler than Magma Rager.

Ice Revenant.flavorText: There must have been some magic in that old ice mace we found.

Ice Trap.flavorText: I literally watched the Hunter place it down in front of me and I still stepped in it.

Ice Walker.flavorText: Ice Walker you say? He doesn't have feet!

Iceblood Garrison.flavorText: On weekends, it hosts the local community theater rehearsals.

Iceblood Tower.flavorText: “Why is it called Iceblood Tower?” “Not really sure. Anyways, try not to lose your footing on any of the frozen bodies as you make your way in.”

Icecrown Brochure.flavorText: The Icecrown ski slopes really are to die for.

Icehowl.flavorText: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target. The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.

Icicle.flavorText: This may appear weak at frost glance, but it's actually a very ice spell.

Identity Theft.flavorText: Identity theft is not a joke, Jim!

Idol of Y'Shaarj.flavorText: Without a tongue, it speaks in seven. Without a voice, its echo lingers forever.

Idol's Adoration.flavorText: That is a mic, not a door.

Igneous Elemental.flavorText: We wanted to name him "Ingenious Elemental", but he just wasn't that bright.

Igneous Lavagorger.flavorText: Lava shark, doo doo doo doo doo doo.

Ignite.flavorText: "So there I was in the Deadmines, I had VanCleef by the throat, and I was just about to let him have it when... <sniff> What's that smell?"

Il'gynoth.flavorText: Well, that just sounds like damage with extra steps.

Illidan Stormrage.flavorText: Illidan's brother, Malfurion, imprisoned him beneath Hyjal for 10,000 years. Stormrages are not good at letting go of grudges.

Illidan's Gift.flavorText: "This gift's burden will always be yours to bear... I lost the receipt." -Illidan

Illidari Felblade.flavorText: A whirling dervish of demonic devastation.

Illidari Inquisitor.flavorText: Armed with fear, big eyes, ruthless efficiency, almost fanatical devotion to your hero, and nice brown robes.

Illuminate.flavorText: BEHOLD THE GLORY OF A NEW CUP!

Illuminator.flavorText: "LUMOS!" is not what they yell. What do you think this is, Hogwarts?

Immolate.flavorText: "Well if you cared about those cards so much, why didn't you play them?"

Immolation Aura.flavorText: If you can't take the heat, stop standing in the fire.

Immortal Prelate.flavorText: She protec. She attac. But most importantly, she come bac.

Immortalized in Stone.flavorText: They all secretly have 'Deathrattle: Become very mortalized.'

Imp Gang Boss.flavorText: His imp gang likes to sneak into Stormwind to spraypaint "Ragnaros Rulez" on the Mage Tower.

Imp King Rafaam.flavorText: Not even death can stop Rafaam from pursuing a life of crime.

Imp Master.flavorText: She would enjoy the job a lot more if she just could get the imps to QUIT BITING HER.

Imp Swarm (Rank 1).flavorText: Not a cauldron, or a mischief, or a cackle, but a swarm.

Imp-losion.flavorText: The shrapnel is waaaaay worse than the explosion.

Imp-oster.flavorText: There is an imposter among us.

Impbalming.flavorText: With your complexion, Imp Balm is a great demonizer.

Impending Catastrophe.flavorText: The imps end you, and the cats... well, they astrophe.

Impferno.flavorText: Imps don't get mad when you set them on fire. They think it's cozy.

Imployee of the Month.flavorText: Imployee of the Month, 666 months running.

Imported Tarantula.flavorText: Which forbidden forest did you get this from?

Imprisoned Antaen.flavorText: Can I get a pair of size XXXXXL manacles?

Imprisoned Celestial.flavorText: "Look at your deck, now back to me, now back at your deck, now back to me. Who am I? None of your—I'm on a horse."

Imprisoned Felmaw.flavorText: It doesn't care who woke it up, someone's getting bitten.

Imprisoned Gan'arg.flavorText: Factory Direct Fiery War Axe. Please allow two turns for delivery.

Imprisoned Homunculus.flavorText: He got a time out for excessive vulgarity.

Imprisoned Observer.flavorText: Currently serving two turns on charges of aggravated minion slaughter.

Imprisoned Phoenix.flavorText: It's actually pretty easy to escape chains when you can burst into flames.

Imprisoned Satyr.flavorText: "C'mon down to Illhoof's bargain bin! When the satyr's free, he'll lower your fee!"

Imprisoned Scrap Imp.flavorText: His impish imports imply impressively impetuous impropriety.

Imprisoned Sungill.flavorText: Imprisoned for ten thousand years! Not because it's a demon. Because of the dancing.

Imprisoned Vilefiend.flavorText: If you do the time, you gotta make up the time.

Improve Morale.flavorText: "The beatings will continue until MY morale improves."

In Formation!.flavorText: None can doubt the strength of the Scholomance student body.

Inara Stormcrash.flavorText: A fan favorite, Inara is always met with thunderous applause.

Incanter's Flow.flavorText: "Gettin' them discounts in bulk amounts, spells can come, and spells can go, castin' costs drop with my sweet, sweet flow."

Incindius.flavorText: "I had nothing to do with that eruption! I never even met Kezandius!"

Incorporeal Corporal.flavorText: You won't believe how long this was called "Incorporal Corporeal"…

Incriminating Psychic.flavorText: Good news: He knows Kazakus's secret identity! Bad news: Now he's here.

Infectious Ghoul.flavorText: They call him that because of his laughter! Also his plague.

Infectious Sporeling.flavorText: "The best thing about being me—there’s so many 'me's."

Infernal Stapler.flavorText: Excuse me, I believe you have my stapler…

Infernal Stratagem.flavorText: Archimonde INSISTS on calling it a stratagem instead of a strategy because it "sounds cooler."

Infest.flavorText: The best part is the look on their face when you jump out of the cake! Err… corpse.

Infested Goblin.flavorText: Trust us. DON'T go cheap on the scarab repellent.

Infested Tauren.flavorText: The Overmind and the Old Gods are surprisingly similar.

Infested Watcher.flavorText: This is why you don't eat watermelon seeds.

Infested Wolf.flavorText: A little flea powder will fix that right up.

Infiltrator Lilian.flavorText: She'll get to the bottom of this even if it kills her. Twice!

Infinite Amalgam.flavorText: The Infinite Amalgam sought Gammy, the greatest among them, though it feared the queen of the amalgams would never be found.

Infinitize the Maxitude.flavorText: When your music is instrumental, it doesn't matter if the words make no sense.

Ingenious Artificer.flavorText: He always brags that he's at the top of the bell curve.

Ini Stormcoil.flavorText: Before setting her sights on exploration, Ini was known for many inventions, such as the airborne breadmaking dirigible, the hypersprocket 200X zoom binoculars, and jobes (jean robes).

Initiation.flavorText: The things a murloc's gotta go through to graduate from Scholomance…

Injured Blademaster.flavorText: He claims it is an old war wound, but we think he just cut himself shaving.

Injured Hauler.flavorText: With how many cacti are all over the Badlands, this job has to be some sort of sick joke.

Injured Kvaldir.flavorText: Don't worry. With a little skin cream he's going to clear right up.

Injured Marauder.flavorText: He’ll keep going despite the neighsayers.

Inkmaster Solia.flavorText: Solia marks the Kabal with intricate tattoos that grant immense power. Also it makes it harder for other gangs to recruit from their numbers. BACK OFF, GOONS.

Inkveil Ambusher.flavorText: You’ve got it wrong. She releases ink when you’re scared.

Inner Demon.flavorText: Critical component of any tragic backstory.

Inner Fire.flavorText: Good idea: Buffing your minions. Bad idea: Starting a conversation in the Barrens.

Inner Rage.flavorText: They're only smiling on the outside.

Innervate.flavorText: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling "Innervate me!!" at them.

Inquisitive Creation.flavorText: This mech eats books for breakfast.

Insatiable Devourer.flavorText: You're not you when you're anima-starved.

Insatiable Felhound.flavorText: Back-to-back winner of the annual hot dog eating contest... and the judge-eating contest.

Insight.flavorText: Shouldn't the eyes be facing backwards for insight?

Instructor Fireheart.flavorText: When you have fire in your heart, even death can't stop you.

Instrument Tech.flavorText: A tech card without Tradeable? CRINGE.

Invent-o-matic.flavorText: The inventor was really proud, until they realized inventing something that invents things makes for poor job security.

Inventor Boom.flavorText: The best part of inventing stuff is blowing it up!

Inventor's Aura.flavorText: Ok, fine, I'll read the manual…

Investment Opportunity.flavorText: "It's a real fixer-upper. I mean a REAL fixer upper."

Invigorate.flavorText: No. 3 Most Internally Contentious Hearthstone Card of 2022.

Invigorating Sermon.flavorText: Every underdog sports coach knows this one.

Invincible.flavorText: No it's not, I can see it right there.

Invitation Courier.flavorText: Sending mail via steward is soooo old school.

Inzah.flavorText: Inzah plays the trumpet, saxophone, piano, guitar, AND bass. No wonder he's always so overloaded!

Irebound Brute.flavorText: "You don't understand… ogres are an untapped market for vengeance and hatred!"

Iron Hide.flavorText: Week 6. I remain covered head to toe with scales. They do not yet realize that I am not a dinosaur.

Iron Juggernaut.flavorText: The Iron Juggernaut guards Orgrimmar and has just earned the "Employee of the Month" award!

Iron Sensei.flavorText: Mechs like learning from him because he really speaks their language. 0110100001101001

Ironbark.flavorText: "The important thing, son, is to protect your spores! I have spoken!"

Ironbeak Owl.flavorText: Their wings are silent but their screech is... whatever the opposite of silent is.

Ironclad.flavorText: With one inch of clearance, Ironclad proved ineffective against speedbumps.

Ironforge Portal.flavorText: Come to beautiful Ironforge! Where irons are forged and the forges are iron!

Ironhide Direhorn.flavorText: "Boy! Bring me my masks and skull rams."

Ivory Rook.flavorText: Bringing back this cycle was risky, but the Ivory Queen thought it was worth the gambit.

Ivus, the Forest Lord.flavorText: He's always welcome at the local tavern, unlike a certain Ancient.

Ixlid, Fungal Lord.flavorText: We suggest crafting Ixlid; he'll grow on you. Literally.

JIVE, INSECT!.flavorText: "WHY IS NO ONE JIVING? I SPECIFICALLY REQUESTED IT!"

Jace Darkweaver.flavorText: As a former mage, making the transition from fire to felfire was quite easy.

Jackpot!.flavorText: Find someone who looks at you the way Hooktusk looks at loot.

Jade Behemoth.flavorText: I think we should talk about the jade elephant in the room.

Jade Blossom.flavorText: Meditating under a jade blossom is said to grant you wisdom, unless you have a pollen allergy.

Jade Chieftain.flavorText: Seeing his Jade Golem grow up into the tall, handsome 6/6 standing before him was the proudest moment of his life.

Jade Display.flavorText: The Jade Lotus just releases the same product every year but with an upgraded camera.

Jade Shuriken.flavorText: Good news is, after you remove it from your wound, you can use it to pay your medical bills!

Jade Spirit.flavorText: "He's so cute! I just want to squeeze him, then use him for Jade Golem parts!" - Aya Blackpaw

Jade Swarmer.flavorText: He's so good at swarming, he can swarm all by himself!

Jade Telegram.flavorText: Golem-gram for Han'Cho! Golem-gram for Han'Cho!

Jaina's Gift.flavorText: "On this day, my magic will bring us together." -Jaina

Jam Session.flavorText: Their skills will make you jelly.

Jan'alai, the Dragonhawk.flavorText: You mess with the Bird, you get the Firelord.

Jandice Barov.flavorText: Her parents own Scholomance. Of course she's going to play tricks on the students!

Jar Dealer.flavorText: What's in the jar? It could be anyone!

Jazz Bass.flavorText: No birds, plural, were harmed in the making of this bass.

Jeeves.flavorText: This robot is a lean, mean, butlerin' machine.

Jewel of N'Zoth.flavorText: This coveted gem calls for you to free it… and unleash an inescapable prison.

Jeweled Macaw.flavorText: It’s not LITERALLY jeweled. The goblins were terribly disappointed.

Jeweled Scarab.flavorText: It's amazing what you can do with super glue!

Jinyu Waterspeaker.flavorText: Waterspeakers can tell the future! So the Jade Lotus employs them to speculate on the Auction House.

Jitterbug.flavorText: The only bug that was intentional.

Job Shadower.flavorText: "Our prosperity… is beyond… a shadow of… a doubt! Ok, got it!"

Jolly Roger.flavorText: That's a great pose, Roger. But this time try happier, and with your mouth open.

Jotun, the Eternal.flavorText: He doesn't look like a turtle?

Journey Below.flavorText: Don't stop believing there's something below.

Joymancer Jepetto.flavorText: Joymancy (noun): The practice of bringing joy to others through the use of magic. (see also: ethics)

Judgment of Justice.flavorText: Look, we don't need a jury. We've got a paladin right here!

Juicy Psychmelon.flavorText: It's not juicy at all. IT'S JUST MESSING WITH YOUR HEAD.

Jukebox Totem.flavorText: If you really love Hearthstone, put another coin in the Totem baby!

Jumbo Imp.flavorText: Jumbo in size! Huge in E.V.I.L.!

Jungle Giants.flavorText: Forming the Golakka Crater was the end of Barnabus' disastrous career as a dancer.

Jungle Gym.flavorText: Yeah, I work out at the gym. The one with all the plushies and toys.

Jungle Jammer.flavorText: When asked what animal they would be, people always say things like "I'd be wolf-lion hybrid mix. King of the jungle, but still sociable and ferocious." No, you'd be a rat.

Jungle Panther.flavorText: Stranglethorn is a beautiful place to visit, but you wouldn't want to live there.

Junkbot.flavorText: One bot's junk is another bot's AWESOME UPGRADE!

Jury Duty.flavorText: The most criminal thing about paladins is that they actually like jury duty.

Justicar Trueheart.flavorText: It's like putting racing stripes and a giant spoiler on your hero power.

K'ara, the Dark Star.flavorText: Velen had never seen a shooting star in real life, so when the opportunity arose…

K'thir Ritualist.flavorText: Something evil this way comes… and it's bringing friends over!

K'ure, the Light Beyond.flavorText: The Draenei's story of survival should instill hope in you that anything is possible!! As long as you have the aid of an interdimensional manifestation of holy energy.

K9-0tron.flavorText: You merely adopted the Battlegrounds. I was born in it. Molded by it.

Kabal Chemist.flavorText: Sure you could have that Polymorph potion, but wouldn't you rather have this mystery potion? It could be anything. Even a Polymorph potion!

Kabal Courier.flavorText: Hey, you park your kodo under a harpy nest, you get what you deserve.

Kabal Crystal Runner.flavorText: "Listen, I can cut you in on a little of this premium mana, but you can't tell my boss."

Kabal Lackey.flavorText: I'll tell you one thing he doesn't lack: GUMPTION.

Kabal Outfitter.flavorText: Don’t ask her for feathers on your necklace though.

Kabal Songstealer.flavorText: Gadgetzan Writer’s Award goes to the player who writes the most compelling fanfic about why this Arakkoa has a golden frog in his hand!

Kabal Talonpriest.flavorText: Inkmaster Solia had to figure out how to tattoo feathers.

Kabal Trafficker.flavorText: She ships illicit mana crystals around the world in packages marked: FUNNEL CAKE.

Kael'thas Sinstrider.flavorText: You heard about Kael'thas? That's messed up, right?

Kael'thas Sunstrider.flavorText: “Descent of Dragons was merely a set back!”

Kaja'mite Creation.flavorText: You made this? I made this.

Kalecgos.flavorText: He was once the Aspect of Magic but gave it up to focus on cheap tricks.

Kalimos, Primal Lord.flavorText: All that's missing is a little heart.

Kangor's Endless Army.flavorText: "That's three, Kangor. Three isn't endless." - Countess Ashmore

Kangor, Dancing King.flavorText: After Dr. Boom's involvement with the League of EVIL, Kangor cut ties with the Boomsday Labs and began pursuing his true passion - DISCO!!!

Kanrethad Ebonlocke.flavorText: After Illidan's downfall, Kanrethad formed the Council of the Black Harvest to study Illidan's fel magic. Some say he was... green with envy.

Kara Kazham!.flavorText: This is what happens when you tell Khadgar to set the table.

Kargal Battlescar.flavorText: One if by land, two if by tree.

Kargath Bladefist.flavorText: He rules the Shattered Hand orc clan with an iron... bladefist.

Kathrena Winterwisp.flavorText: She’s not one of those treehugger elves – but she does like the occasional cuddle.

Kayn Sunfury.flavorText: "Armor and heals may slow my zeal, but fel and glaives excite me!"

Kazakus.flavorText: The mysterious leader of the Kabal is NOT a dragon, and does NOT deal in illegal potions. Any public statements to the contrary will be met with litigation and Dragonfire Potions.

Kazakus, Golem Shaper.flavorText: With a little love and some tenderness, we’ll CRUSH OUR FOES!

Kazakusan.flavorText: Kazakus had always seemed too clever a sort to bottle a brew that could do him any harm. Perhaps it should come as no surprise, then, that the originator of the Dragonfire Potion was a dragon himself.

Keen Reflex.flavorText: All of Onyxia's whelps were no match for Kurtrus' backflip.

Keeneye Spotter.flavorText: "No Rexxar, not the face, the minion right there. Yep that one righ-- Rexxar no!"

Keening Banshee.flavorText: "What are your strengths?" the interviewer asked. "Well," she replied, "I'm really good at keening."

Keeper of Uldaman.flavorText: U da man! No, U da man!

Keeper of the Grove.flavorText: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

Kel'Thuzad.flavorText: Kel'Thuzad could not resist the call of the Lich King. Even when it's just a robo-call extolling the Lich King's virtues.

Kel'Thuzad, the Inevitable.flavorText: Looks like Kel'Thuzad is borrowing some of Mr. Bigglesworth's nine lives.

Keli'dan the Breaker.flavorText: He calms down a lot if you just give him a turn.

Keyboard Soloist.flavorText: Give her a hand, everybody! Or maybe 4!

Keymaster Alabaster.flavorText: The key to his mastery is a solid stack of backup copies.

Keywarden Ivory.flavorText: She learned exactly one thing from her old man: copying.

Kezan Mystic.flavorText: They pretend to be wise and enlightened, but they mostly just hate to be left out of a secret.

Khadgar.flavorText: "What do you call two minions summoned at once? Twinions, haha! Wait... where are you going?"

Khaz'goroth.flavorText: Creator of the titan-forged races, Khaz'goroth intended them to safeguard the world of Azeroth from corruption and discord.

Kidnap.flavorText: Check your coat, but don't check the coat closet.

Kidnapper.flavorText: He just wants people to see his vacation photos.

Kil'jaeden.flavorText: With complete control of the Burning Legion's forces, Kil'jaeden will stop at nothing until all of the traitorous Draenei have been squelched. *right clicks the enemy hero*

King Krush.flavorText: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.

King Mukla.flavorText: King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.

King Phaoris.flavorText: When you're the king of the cats, the whole desert is your litterbox.

King Plush.flavorText: He's so fluffy you're gonna DIE!

King Togwaggle.flavorText: Management of the Kobold Empire requires a careful balance between a lack of social services and fiscal irresponsibility.

King of Beasts.flavorText: He never sleeps. Not even in the mighty jungle.

King's Defender.flavorText: "King's Attacker" is a shield. Funny, huh?

Kingpin Pud.flavorText: The good, the bad, and the ugly stats for the Cost.

Kingsbane.flavorText: But it has a soft spot for emperors.

Kiri, Chosen of Elune.flavorText: Now, when the Sun is between the Moon and the Azeroth... that's when you've got a problem.

Kirin Tor Mage.flavorText: The Kirin Tor reside in the floating city of Dalaran. How do you make a Dalaran float? Two scoops of ice cream, one scoop of Dalaran.

Klaxxi Amber-Weaver.flavorText: Amberweaving is a specialty course at the local trade school.

Knickknack Shack.flavorText: In a hole in the ground there... was a tourist trap?

Knife Juggler.flavorText: Ambitious Knife Jugglers sometimes graduate to Bomb Jugglers. They never last long enough to make it onto a card though.

Knife Vendor.flavorText: "They're perfectly safe! These gloves totally aren't hiding any bandages."

Knight of the Dead.flavorText: A Paladin will follow their oath to slay the undead, even when they count themselves among them.

Knight of the Wild.flavorText: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.

Knuckles.flavorText: When confronted with accusations of performance-enhancing bananas, Knuckles replied, "I get my fruit from trees I knock down with my bare hands like everyone else."

Kobold Apprentice.flavorText: Horrible secret: The Darkness is immune to Arcane Missiles.

Kobold Barbarian.flavorText: What is best in life? To make candle. To keep candle. To hear lamentations of candle-takers.

Kobold Geomancer.flavorText: In the old days, Kobolds were the finest candle merchants in the land. Then they got pushed too far...

Kobold Hermit.flavorText: To truly understand candles, it takes YEARS of quiet contemplation.

Kobold Illusionist.flavorText: He can make ANYTHING look like a candle.

Kobold Librarian.flavorText: Kobolds sort books using a gooey decimal system.

Kobold Miner.flavorText: A mining kobold that costs 2, has very low health, and gives you resources… what is this, Warcraft Rumble?

Kobold Stickyfinger.flavorText: He no take candle. He take sword.

Kobold Taskmaster.flavorText: Fabled questgiver of the “Get me candle”, “Get me another candle”, and “Get me 11 more candle” questline.

Kodo Mount.flavorText: No matter how big they are or how many times you tell them no, they STILL won't stay off the couch.

Kodohide Drumkit.flavorText: Stolen from a druidic drum circle, now destined to make music that is actually good.

Kodorider.flavorText: Someone called her a Rhinorider, and she's NOT HAPPY.

Kologarn.flavorText: "So am I just supposed to stand here forever, or...?"

Kor'kron Elite.flavorText: The Kor'kron are the elite forces of Garrosh Hellscream. Let's just say you don't want to run into these guys while wearing a blue tabard.

Kor'vas Bloodthorn.flavorText: Illidan taught her that demon hunters should sacrifice EVERYTHING… but she still brought Lifesteal just in case.

Korrak the Bloodrager.flavorText: “I live, I love, I slay, and I am undying.”

Krag'wa, the Frog.flavorText: Krag'wa has a ritual to honor his friends and a ritual to devour his enemies. No one can tell them apart.

Krolusk Barkstripper.flavorText: My friend went krolusk tipping once… once!

Kronx Dragonhoof.flavorText: The only one who knows how to properly prepare Galakrond's coffee.

Krul the Unshackled.flavorText: Spicklefizz pondered his life choices as he looked at the chain around his neck. "Become a warlock," they said. "You get to enslave demons," they said.

Kryxis the Voracious.flavorText: Tried intermittent fasting. It didn't stick.

Kul Tiran Chaplain.flavorText: The maritime Kul Tiran clergy are unique among priests for using holy saltwater.

Kun the Forgotten King.flavorText: Aya siphons a bit of Kun's soul to animate each golem in her Jade army. To his credit, he's being a great sport about it.

Kurtrus Ashfallen.flavorText: Kurtrus fled the Black Temple, abandoning Illidan's cause, to seek revenge against the Dreadlord Anetheron.

Kurtrus, Demon-Render.flavorText: "I dedicated my life to vanquishing demons, but I never thought to face the demons in me. Maybe, in time, I can help quell the demons in you." -Kurtrus, to Cariel

Kvaldir Raider.flavorText: Coming soon... to a tuskarr village near you!

Lab Patron.flavorText: When a Lab Patron fails out of school, they become a Grim Patron.

Lab Recruiter.flavorText: Join the chemistry lab! We've got all the solutions.

Lady Anacondra.flavorText: Do you think she got her name before or after she turned into a snake?

Lady Ashvane.flavorText: This is your brain on Azerite.

Lady Darkvein.flavorText: You're so vein. I bet you think this flavor text is about you.

Lady Liadrin.flavorText: When it comes to spells, she loves 'em then she librams.

Lady Prestor.flavorText: To her credit, the best bodyguard for the king WOULD be a dragon in disguise.

Lady S'theno.flavorText: Only a S'theno deals in absolutes.

Lady Vashj.flavorText: Personal handmaiden to Queen Azshara turned lieutenant to Illidan Stormrage. Also quite the hair sssstylist.

Lady in White.flavorText: She was a lady in polka dots until the gnomish laundromat incident.

Lake Thresher.flavorText: "There’s a monster in the lake?!" "That’s not a monster, that’s Gary."

Lakkari Felhound.flavorText: Guaranteed to track tar all over your carpet.

Lakkari Sacrifice.flavorText: They asked, “And what must we give in return?” Gul’dan lowered his hood and answered: “Six… cards…”

Lamplighter.flavorText: The elemental licked the oil and everybody laughed.

Lance Carrier.flavorText: Lance Carrier is an obscure entry level position in orcish armies. A mystery, since orcs don't generally use lances.

Landscaping.flavorText: We'll put a happy tree right here... and give him a little friend.

Landslide.flavorText: "And they win it by a landslide! Wait, where did all the other racers go?"

Laser Barrage.flavorText: "I say we take off and laser barrage the entire site from orbit - it's the only way to be sure."

Last Stand.flavorText: If you play two Last Stands in one game, you're a liar.

Lava Burst.flavorText: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!

Lava Shock.flavorText: Chocolate lava cake is shockingly delicious.

Lawful Longarm.flavorText: Loves to lob law bombs from his law blog.

Lay Down the Law.flavorText: The official term for "Because I said so!".

Lazul's Scheme.flavorText: "What's that you're dreaming? You're weak and you're screaming! It must be my scheming..."

Learn Draconic.flavorText: Upon taking up the spellbook, Reno realized with a start: "I can't read."

Leatherclad Hogleader.flavorText: The Hogchoppers, the terrors of Tanaris, can always be found at one tavern or another in Gadgetzan, refueling for totally real and legit adventures that they go on.

Leeching Poison.flavorText: No actual leeches were harmed in the creation of this card.

Leeroy Jenkins.flavorText: At least he has Angry Chicken.

Leper Gnome.flavorText: He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.

Lesser Amethyst Spellstone.flavorText: A purple stone Azari carved For dark hearts, craving, power-starved. The first to bow, the warlock Rin, Embraced the darkness, slew her kin.

Lesser Diamond Spellstone.flavorText: A diamond, white, this stone the eighth A precious jewel for those of faith A whispered prayer restores the lost But none among them know the cost.

Lesser Emerald Spellstone.flavorText: An emerald stone for Tauren hands Who sought its strength to save their lands Their tribes now lost, their rage released Who’s hunting now? And who’s the beast?

Lesser Jasper Spellstone.flavorText: In ancient woods, elves fought the curse The demon’s shadow to disperse But hatred raged and frail souls turned Now horned and hooved their forests burned.

Lesser Mithril Spellstone.flavorText: To dwarves of stone the demon called With promises of might, enthralled In grasping greed they found their doom Forever bound in mithril tombs.

Lesser Onyx Spellstone.flavorText: The trolls of old embraced the gift A jewel of black for daggers swift No party lasts who finds the stone Those wielding it soon stand alone.

Lesser Opal Spellstone.flavorText: For those seeking glory and power Be not swayed by Azari the Devourer The opal grants victory to the weak But leaves your soul barren and bleak

Lesser Pearl Spellstone.flavorText: In ages old, when Ancients broke Azari of the Legion spoke To tempt the mortals: gems of power The weak succumbed, their souls devoured.

Lesser Ruby Spellstone.flavorText: The final stone undid its master Spun into wards by nameless caster Azari wailed a savage roar Now sealed in nether, evermore.

Lesser Sapphire Spellstone.flavorText: A stone of blue, embraced with glee By murloc lords beneath the sea Soon numberless they swarmed the shore First two, then four, then more...and more...

Lesser Spinel Spellstone.flavorText: A story concluded, the kobolds had fought Yet here is a spellstone Azari forgot Pawned off to shops, considered a trinket Dark powers contained, none would think it

Leyline Manipulator.flavorText: The shortest distance between two points is a leyline.

Li'Na, Shop Manager.flavorText: Somebody has to do the paperwork around here.

Libram of Hope.flavorText: "Think you got lethal? Libram of NOPE!"

Libram of Judgment.flavorText: You really can't judge a book by its cover.

Libram of Justice.flavorText: Proper justice. Throw the book at him!

Libram of Wisdom.flavorText: The best wisdom is passed on.

Licensed Adventurer.flavorText: "Just point me in the vague direction of the things you want smashed, and you got yourself a deal!"

Life Sentence.flavorText: Also sentenced to laugh and love.

Life from Death.flavorText: Just because you came up with a nicer name for it doesn't mean that necromancy is any more justified.

Lifebinder's Gift.flavorText: Everyone's investing in Nature spells these days, but that bubble is about to burst.

Lifedrinker.flavorText: In a pinch, he'll also settle for Holy Water: Zero.

Lifeguard.flavorText: Hey, no aggro in the pool!

Lifesaving Aura.flavorText: One ring to rule them all, and in the sunlight save them.

Lifeweaver.flavorText: Lifeweaving is all well and good until it's time to cut the thread.

Light of the Naaru.flavorText: "Light it up!" - Command given to both Lightwardens and Goblins holding Flamecannons.

Light of the Phoenix.flavorText: It's 3 in the morning, could you PLEASE put out that phoenix?!

Light's Champion.flavorText: When there's something strange (say, a gibbering demon) in your neighborhood, who are you going to call?

Light's Justice.flavorText: Prince Malchezaar was a collector of rare weapons. He'd animate them and have them dance for him.

Lightbomb.flavorText: This is what happens when you allow goblins to be priests.

Lightbringer's Hammer.flavorText: This entire city must be purged. Or at least just the minions.

Lightforged Blessing.flavorText: Some might call this a lightforgery.

Lightforged Cariel.flavorText: Her faith, unshakable. Her shield, immovable. Her enemies, irredeemable.

Lightforged Crusader.flavorText: Self-appointed president of the Paladins Only Paladin Club.

Lightforged Zealot.flavorText: Card-carrying member of the Paladins Only Paladin Club.

Lightfused Manasaber.flavorText: Oh no, I ran out of fused Mana!

Lightfused Stegodon.flavorText: “Come now, Johnston. I think those horns are quite fetching on you.”

Lightmaw Netherdrake.flavorText: Do you think it's a glass half full kind of Netherdrake, or a glass half empty, inescapable void kind of Netherdrake?

Lightning Bloom.flavorText: Curiously, this plant never blooms in the same place twice.

Lightning Bolt.flavorText: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!

Lightning Breath.flavorText: Recipe: One dragon, four wool socks, thick shag carpet.

Lightning Reflexes.flavorText: If you can dodge a lightning bolt, you can dodge a ball.

Lightning Storm.flavorText: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.

Lightray.flavorText: Lightrays, much like rays of light, tend to be seen closer to the surface.

Lightshow.flavorText: Always remember P.L.U.R.: Peace, Laser-beams, Unity, Respect.

Lightshower Elemental.flavorText: The forecast calls for light showers, but you won’t need an umbrella.

Lightspawn.flavorText: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?

Lightsteed.flavorText: All the steed, half the calories.

Lightwarden.flavorText: She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.

Lightwell.flavorText: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.

Lil' Exorcist.flavorText: Warlocks have the town exorcist on speed dial in case they unleash the wrong demon.

Lilian Voss.flavorText: She doesn't feel pity, or remorse, or fear. And she absolutely will not stop... ever, until all necromancers are dead.

Lilypad Lurker.flavorText: Honestly, the frog did nothing wrong.

Line Hopper.flavorText: There are two things Demon Hunters know: hopping, and cutting.

Linecracker.flavorText: "Tell me if you’ve heard this one!"

Linedance Partner.flavorText: Where did you come from? (Linedance Partner's Battlecry) Where did you go? (Face)

Lion's Frenzy.flavorText: Only as sharp as your draw.

Lion's Guard.flavorText: She takes the lion's share of the credit, too.

Livewire Lance.flavorText: The lance is heavy but it’s the battery pack that really does a number on the shoulders.

Living Dragonbreath.flavorText: If you want that muscular physique, you've really gotta feel the burn.

Living Horizon.flavorText: Even in the darkest of days, the sun never sets on the Badlands.

Living Mana.flavorText: If you truly love your mana, set it free.

Living Monument.flavorText: This is not the greatest card in the world. This is just a monument.

Living Prairie.flavorText: Whoooooa, we're half way there Whooa-oh, -

Living Roots.flavorText: 2 out of 2 saplings recommend that you summon the saplings.

Living Seed (Rank 1).flavorText: Every desert needs an oasis. And it's Guff's duty to make it happen.

Load the Chamber.flavorText: Wait! Before we duel, I gotta install these shaders.

Loan Shark.flavorText: Pay up or you'll be swimming with the fishes.

Loatheb.flavorText: Loatheb used to be a simple Bog Beast. This is why we need stricter regulations on mining and agriculture.

Lock and Load.flavorText: Rexxar narrowed his eyes, grabbed his machine gun, and said: "It's go time. Lock and load." This card pays homage to that special moment.

Loken, Jailer of Yogg-Saron.flavorText: Really great at his job! - Yogg-Saron

Lokholar the Ice Lord.flavorText: Suddenly the names of Iceblood Tower and Iceblood Garrison make a lot more sense.

Lone Champion.flavorText: He is a champion, with no friends. He'll keep on fighting, til the end!

Loose Specimen.flavorText: You leave Deathstalker Rexxar alone in the lab for TWO minutes…

Lor'themar Theron.flavorText: Out of all his life accomplishments, making a 2/2 Tinyfin is his finest.

Lord Barov.flavorText: Alexei Barov stayed at Scholomance despite leasing it to Kel’Thuzad. He says it’s for "supervision."

Lord Godfrey.flavorText: Betrayed the Alliance. Betrayed the Horde. All for 200 achievement points and a sweet, sweet hat.

Lord Jaraxxus.flavorText: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"

Lord Marrowgar.flavorText: And now, Lord Marrowgar with the weather.

Lord of the Arena.flavorText: He used to be a 2100+ rated arena player, but that was years ago and nobody can get him to shut up about it.

Lorekeeper Polkelt.flavorText: quicksort [] = [] quicksort (x:xs) = quicksort small ++ (x : quicksort large) where small = [y | y <- xs, y <= x] large = [y | y <- xs, y > x]

Lorewalker Cho.flavorText: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.

Lost Exarch.flavorText: She resisted the temptation of the Burning Legion's power only to fall victim to the Scourge.

Lost Spirit.flavorText: She simply refuses to ask for directions.

Lost Tallstrider.flavorText: The message, "If found, please return to Mulgore," is tattooed on his rear.

Lost in the Jungle.flavorText: George and Karl were never heard from again.

Lost in the Park.flavorText: Mister, have you seen my Archdruid?

Lothar.flavorText: Has been around since before there were paladins and those newfangled paladin mechs.

Lothraxion the Redeemed.flavorText: So infused with the Light, he has to wear double sleep masks at night.

Lotus Agents.flavorText: Mostly, they stand around and look cool.

Lotus Assassin.flavorText: For 5000g, you can just give the Jade Lotus any name and they will assassinate and/or embarrass them.

Lotus Illusionist.flavorText: If you think her Xavius and Sylvanas cosplay is great, wait till you see her Reno Jackson!

Love Everlasting.flavorText: Poison Bloom was accused of plagiarizing the "Ooh, how long can this go on (ooh yeah)" hook from an old-school musical group called The Saronite Chain Gang.

Lucentbark.flavorText: Always feels refreshed after a little dirt nap.

Luckydo Buccaneer.flavorText: You can't just leave a Luckydo somewhere. You gotta keep 'em with you! Especially in Gadgetzan!

Luckysoul Hoarder.flavorText: Always brings his own reusable shopping bag, satchel, barrel, trunk, tray, and fluffy pillow.

Luna's Pocket Galaxy.flavorText: Luna became head of the astronomy department when her boss invented the Pocket Black Hole.

Lunar Eclipse.flavorText: When the Azeroth is between the Sun and the Moon.

Lunar Trailblazer.flavorText: Changing legend into fact, she will ride into history.

Lunar Visions.flavorText: The true mystery of lunar visions is how there is nothing to watch when there are so many channels.

Lushwater Murcenary.flavorText: You can't just switch sides because they have more fish!

Lushwater Scout.flavorText: Only knows how to play "Careless Murgl" and "Mrgl Mrgl Little Star."

Lynessa Sunsorrow.flavorText: A diet of pure magic is great for the complexion but wreaks havoc on one's mood.

Lyra the Sunshard.flavorText: Arise, fair sun, and kill my envious foes. They don't have a legendary as beautiful as you.

MC Blingtron.flavorText: If this is the outcome of the robot uprising, then sign me up!

Mad Bomber.flavorText: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.

Mad Hatter.flavorText: He's entirely bonkers. All the best goblins are.

Mad Scientist.flavorText: His mother wanted him to be a mage or a warlock, but noooooooo, he had to go and be a scientist like his father.

Mad Summoner.flavorText: Does he summon because of his madness, or is he mad from all the summoning?

Madam Goya.flavorText: She has set up her Black Market here in Gadgetzan for one purpose, to make a KILLING when Beanie Babies make their inevitable comeback.

Madame Lazul.flavorText: Of course she knows the future, she’s been looking at your cards the WHOLE TIME!

Maddest Bomber.flavorText: Talk about a name that limits design space.

Maelstrom Portal.flavorText: They bill this as a popular resort attraction, but they try and get your money up front.

Maestra of the Masquerade.flavorText: She doesn't drop character until after the DVD commentary.

Maexxna.flavorText: Maexxna gets super mad when people introduce her as "Maxina" or "Maxxy".

Magatha, Bane of Music.flavorText: Not to be confused with that one other "-agatha" that likes when you play minions.

Magehunter.flavorText: Hates waiting. Abhors chit chat. Fond of the color purple.

Magic Carpet.flavorText: Its small yet fierce riders are affectionately known as rug rats.

Magic Dart Frog.flavorText: There's a powerful throat in this frog.

Magic Trick.flavorText: The world is not ready for an illusion of this depth and intricacy!

Magical Dollhouse.flavorText: Build your own dollhouse in 3 easy steps! 1. Build a castle. 2. Miniaturize it. 3. GLITTER!

Magicfin.flavorText: The best part is when he pulls Deathwing out of a top hat!

Magister Dawngrasp.flavorText: Magister is a humble title for one who united warring armies against the greatest threat to Azeroth.

Magister's Apprentice.flavorText: "If this is the work I'll be doing, maybe I don't want to be just like you someday..."

Magma Rager.flavorText: He likes to think he is powerful, but pretty much anyone can solo Molten Core now.

Magnataur Alpha.flavorText: Playing him also gets you into the Magnataur Beta.

Magtheridon.flavorText: Came from another world to invade Outland and bend it to his will… only to be overthrown by an elf from another world who invaded Outland and bent it to his will.

Magtheridon, Unreleased.flavorText: Playing with this card can be penalized with up to a two-year suspension. Please wait until the card is officially released.

Maiden of the Lake.flavorText: Not a good basis for a system of government.

Maiev Shadowsong.flavorText: Go directly to Demon Jail. Do not attack minions, do not collect mana crystals.

Mailbox Dancer.flavorText: He is the reason why we have 7 mailboxes in this district.

Majordomo Executus.flavorText: You thought Executus turned you into Ragnaros, but really Ragnaros was in you the whole time.

Making Mummies.flavorText: "I do say, this gives me the vapors every single time!"

Mal'Ganis.flavorText: Mal'Ganis doesn't like being betrayed, so if you discard him, watch out.

Malchezaar's Imp.flavorText: Malchezaar used to have an imp named Dobby working for him, but there was a tragic accident.

Malefic Rook.flavorText: Was a regular Pawn but Fel in with the wrong toys.

Malevolent Strike.flavorText: "I don't know how those got in there, but I'm blaming you two."

Malfunction.flavorText: Bug Report: This card works perfectly.

Malfurion the Pestilent.flavorText: "Cenarius once taught me about the precarious balance between life and death. I have come to understand: there IS no balance. Death always wins."

Malfurion's Gift.flavorText: "May this imbue you with the life of the party!" -Malfurion

Malkorok.flavorText: Garrosh's best buddy. It's true. Look it up.

Malorne.flavorText: When Malorne isn't mauling hordes of demons, he enjoys attending parties, though he prefers to go stag.

Malted Magma.flavorText: Most celebrities nope out at this one.

Malygos.flavorText: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic. He gets so mad!

Malygos the Spellweaver.flavorText: After many years, Malygos has decided mortals can use magic. ALL THE MAGIC!

Malygos, Aspect of Magic.flavorText: It's official. We can say Malygeese.

Man the Cannons.flavorText: Now THAT’S a lotta splash damage!

Man'ari Mosher.flavorText: "E.T.C. is sooo mainstream. Have you heard of Blight Boar?"

Mana Addict.flavorText: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.

Mana Burn.flavorText: One way to ensure that they are not prepared.

Mana Cyclone.flavorText: It'll put a good spin on your spells.

Mana Geode.flavorText: Gadgetzan, where even the pet rocks have pet rocks.

Mana Giant.flavorText: Spell more and save more with a GIANT discount!

Mana Reservoir.flavorText: If it soaks too long, it becomes a reservoir hog.

Mana Tide Totem.flavorText: It is said that some shaman can say "Floatin' totem" 10 times, fast.

Mana Wraith.flavorText: They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. "Mmmmmm," they say.

Mana Wyrm.flavorText: These wyrms feed on arcane energies, and while they are generally considered a nuisance rather than a real threat, you really shouldn't leave them alone with a bucket of mana.

Manafeeder Panthara.flavorText: Feeds on mana, crystal kibble, and whatever it was you were just snacking on.

Manic Soulcaster.flavorText: When casting a tournament, you really have to put your soul into it!

Mankrik.flavorText: Relives his nightmare every day a new Horde player is created.

Mantle Shaper.flavorText: You got a fireplace? I've got a guy who shapes mantles.

Manufacturing Error.flavorText: You thought the 9-piece puzzle would be easy, didn't you?

Marin the Fox.flavorText: My name is Marin the Fox. You took my treasure. Prepare to die.

Marin the Manager.flavorText: Mawin! Mawin is what bwings us togethaaa... today.

Mark of Nature.flavorText: Druids call it the "Mark of Nature." Everyone else calls it "needing a bath."

Mark of Scorn.flavorText: Threat Level who? Mark of Scorn!

Mark of Y'Shaarj.flavorText: Y'Shaarj had three sons: Mark, Theodore, and Chris.

Mark of the Loa.flavorText: Ah, yes. Mark. The mightiest Loa.

Mark of the Lotus.flavorText: The mark of the Lotus is a little flower drawn in permanent marker on the ankle.

Mark of the Spikeshell.flavorText: "I'm DEFINITELY turtle-y enough for the turtle club."

Mark of the Wild.flavorText: Not to be confused with Jim of the Wild.

Marrowslicer.flavorText: Perfect for killing the first boss in Icecrown Citadel.

Marsh Drake.flavorText: She would have gotten away with it, if it weren't for that meddling Drakeslayer.

Marsh Hydra.flavorText: Three heads of marsh-mashing, bog-bashing, swamp-stomping fury!

Marshspawn.flavorText: Hopes to someday promote to Marshsqueen.

Maruut Stonebinder.flavorText: Savior of the World Pillar, Maruut valiantly fought the Twilight's Hammer to aid Therazane against the Cataclysm.

Mask of C'Thun.flavorText: Hide in the mask, but it will wear you. Through its gleaming eye, you shall see true.

Masked Contender.flavorText: Knew Mysterious Challenger back when he was a Mysterious Squire.

Masked Reveler.flavorText: "It's party time! P-A-R-T-Why? Because I gotta!"

Mass Dispel.flavorText: It dispels buffs, powers, hopes, and dreams.

Mass Hysteria.flavorText: Black Friday gets worse every year.

Mass Production.flavorText: Whenever you cast this, we make a new Nemsy portrait.

Mass Resurrection.flavorText: One's company, two's a crowd, and three's a “mass” resurrection, apparently.

Master Jouster.flavorText: Needs just a few more ratings points to become Grandmaster Jouster.

Master Oakheart.flavorText: His adventuring party consists of Goldshire Footman, Frostwolf Grunt and Hadronox.

Master Swordsmith.flavorText: He's currently trying to craft a "flail-axe", but all the other swordsmiths say it can't be done.

Master of Disguise.flavorText: She's actually a male tauren. People don't call him "Master of Disguise" for nothing.

Master of Evolution.flavorText: Will be really useful in the new "Hearthémon" game.

Maw and Paw.flavorText: Home is where the disfigured, rotten heart is.

Mawsworn Bailiff.flavorText: Bailiff, bring in the dancing lobsters!

Maxima Blastenheimer.flavorText: Believe it or not, this is only the faire's fourth most dangerous game.

Mayor Noggenfogger.flavorText: This flavor text was randomly generated. If it happens to form words and make sense, that is purely by chance.

Maze Guide.flavorText: "And if you look to your left, you'll see an even larger statue of Sire Denathrius!"

Meanstreet Marshal.flavorText: Remember, submit your bribes directly to the Marshal - it's the law!

Meat Grinder.flavorText: After the Horde and Alliance sieged Icecrown Citadel, they took these back to use in their delis.

Mech-Bear-Cat.flavorText: Crushes buildings with his BEAR hands.

Mecha'thun.flavorText: "Your software will fail. Your users will abandon you. You are already obsolete."

Mecha-Leaper.flavorText: Now to find my Mecha-Macaw and my Mecha-Titus and we'll be Mecha-Set.

Mecha-Shark.flavorText: "Why didn't you just build a normal submarine. Only you can fit inside" "WhY DiDn'T YoU JuSt BuIlD anormalsub-WHY DO YOU THINK WREZIG!! If you can build a freaking Mecha-Shark, then you build a freaking Mecha-Shark!"

Mechagnome Guide.flavorText: Theme park? Tropical island? Fiery pit of despair? We've got something for everyone.

Mechanical Whelp.flavorText: "Well if I didn't build the whelp and YOU didn't build the whelp…"

Mechanical Yeti.flavorText: The yetis of Chillwind Point are a source of both inspiration and savage beatings.

Mechano-Egg.flavorText: When you need more iron in your diet.

Mecharoo.flavorText: Its project name was KAN-GA. The little one was R-00.

Mechwarper.flavorText: Mechs that summon mechs? What's next? Donuts that summon donuts? Mmmmm.

Meddlesome Servant.flavorText: Has successfully gotten away with it too.

Medivh's Valet.flavorText: "Magus Medivh sir, I've brought the flaming balloons, as you requested."

Medivh, the Guardian.flavorText: If you think the party's great now, just wait 'til he invites the orcs over!

Meeting Stone.flavorText: "I'm clicking on it, but nothing's happening."

Mekgineer Thermaplugg.flavorText: He was obsessed with explosives until he discovered knitting. Now he yells, “SWEATERS! MORE SWEATERS!”

Melomania.flavorText: I once saw a horse that had watermelons for hair. It was a melon mane, ya?!

Melted Maker.flavorText: Melts what he makes (cheese) and makes a mean melt (grilled cheese).

Meltemental.flavorText: "Who left these wet bracers on the ground?"

Menacing Nimbus.flavorText: Electra stores her elementals in the cloud.

Menagerie Jug.flavorText: It's art imitating Battlegrounds imitating life.

Menagerie Magician.flavorText: Just between us, if things get tight the Menagerie Magician position will probably be the first to go.

Menagerie Mug.flavorText: He's a chip off the old jug.

Menagerie Warden.flavorText: Please? Can I keep him? I promise to clean his cage every day.

Merch Seller.flavorText: "Sorry, we're all out of Mediums. All we've got left are Gnome, Extra Large, and Annihilan."

Mes'Adune the Fractured.flavorText: Cracking open an elemental with the boys.

Messenger Buzzard.flavorText: The bird brings the word (which happens to be bird).

Messenger Raven.flavorText: You can make a collect CAW!

Messmaker.flavorText: The most painful 1 damage of your life.

Metal Detector.flavorText: Weirdly still works on Sand Coins.

Metaltooth Leaper.flavorText: Don't leave them out in the rain. In Un'Goro Crater there is a whole colony of rust-tooth leapers.

Metamorfin.flavorText: Always wanted to be the green ranger.

Metamorphosis.flavorText: As the humble caterpillar becomes a beautiful butterfly, so too does a demon hunter become a hideous mass of writhing destruction and unfettered chaos.

Meteor.flavorText: When you absolutely, positively have to kill all the dinosaurs.

Meteorologist.flavorText: Some say the world will end in fire. Some say in ice. Why not BOTH?

Mi'da, Pure Light.flavorText: Unfortunately, Mi’da’s touch will not turn things to gold.

Mic Drop.flavorText: The perfect card to play after emoting.

Micro Machine.flavorText: This card is the real thing.

Micro Mummy.flavorText: The dramatically detailed terrifically trimmed replica of the real thing!

Microtech Controller.flavorText: Best-selling author of "How to Make Friends You Completely Control."

Midnight Wolf.flavorText: Three of these would make for an EPIC T-shirt.

Midway Maniac.flavorText: Faire owners hate him! Learn his secrets with one simple spell!

Might of Menethil.flavorText: Menethil's Might, at night, fights the light, not quite the blight, right?

Militia Commander.flavorText: She only needs two commands: "Heel" and "Sic 'em!"

Mimiron's Head.flavorText: Do not push the big red button!

Mind Blast.flavorText: This spell blasts you directly in the MIND.

Mind Control.flavorText: Nominated as "Spell Most Likely to Make Your Opponent Punch the Wall."

Mind Control Tech.flavorText: Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.

Mind Eater.flavorText: Watch out brain, she'll chew you up! She's a Mind Eater!

Mind Vision.flavorText: I see what you did there.

Mindbender.flavorText: I like my brain unbent, thanks.

Mindbreaker.flavorText: He's a mind breaker, dream taker, ghoul trainer, don't you mess around with him.

Mindgames.flavorText: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.

Mindrender Illucia.flavorText: "…and that's how I ended up with a Murloc Cultural Studies major."

Minecart Cruiser.flavorText: Where are you drivin', Minecart Cruiser? Where is your bounty, fortune, and fame?

Minefield.flavorText: Dodge bombs like you're playing Tonksweeper!

Mini-Mage.flavorText: He is sometimes found hiding in the treasure chest in the Gurubashi Arena.

Minotauren.flavorText: "Why's he so mad?" "He's been stuck on one of Hearthstone's hidden maze puzzles for YEARS."

Miracle Growth.flavorText: I’ve got NO idea what’s in that fertilizer.

Miracle Salesman.flavorText: "Hey! Hope you’re well. Have you ever wanted to be your own boss?"

Mirage Caller.flavorText: Mirage is actually the name of its long-lost cat.

Mire Keeper.flavorText: "Hey.... Is that Mire for sale?" "No. I'm keeping it."

Mirror Entity.flavorText: "You go first." - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.

Mirror Image.flavorText: Oh hey it's Mirror Image! !egamI rorriM s'ti yeh hO

Mischief Maker.flavorText: Fair trade is for noble-minded suckers with dignity and honor.

Mischievous Imp.flavorText: Why is it when something happens, it is always you three?

Misdirection.flavorText: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.

Mish-Mash Mosher.flavorText: In the pit, he feels more alive than ever.

Mismatched Fossils.flavorText: Whoever put these fossils together must be really careless.

Missile Launcher.flavorText: We asked, "Where do the missiles go?" and he answered, "Yes."

Mistake.flavorText: We like to think of it as a happy accident.

Mister Mukla.flavorText: Music is Mukla's escape from his anger. When he's on-stage, it's like he's a whole different gorilla… Until you boo him.

Mistress of Mixtures.flavorText: Her favorite mixture is cola and lime.

Mistwraith.flavorText: One little Mistwraith sitting in a tree. M-I-S-T-I-N-G.

Mixologist.flavorText: You can't put your pinky up when you only have 3 fingers.

Mixtape.flavorText: That tape has got poetry and clarinet on it, Garona. POETRY. AND CLARINET.

Mo'arg Drillfist.flavorText: Also functions as the town dentist.

Mo'arg Forgefiend.flavorText: Enraged not by fel energies, but by an itchy nose he cannot scratch.

Moat Lurker.flavorText: He really enjoys lurking and gets a lot of job satisfaction out of it.

Mogor the Ogre.flavorText: Mogor helped reopen the Dark Portal once. You know you're in trouble when you have to rely on an ogre.

Mogor's Champion.flavorText: This champion has learned from the best. Except for his target selection.

Mogu Cultist.flavorText: Mogu cultists have the worst team-building exercises.

Mogu Fleshshaper.flavorText: He's here to shape *clap* you up!

Mogu'shan Warden.flavorText: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King. BOOOORRRINNG!

Mojomaster Zihi.flavorText: Sadly, she was still two credits short of her Witch Doctorate.

Mok'Nathal Lion.flavorText: Never underestimate a lioness when her pride is on the line.

Molten Blade.flavorText: It’s a sword! It’s a knife! It’s a swizzle-stick!

Molten Blast.flavorText: Well, how would YOU celebrate after finals week?!

Molten Breath.flavorText: Pizza so hot it burns OTHER PEOPLE’S MOUTHS.

Molten Giant.flavorText: He gets terrible heartburn. BECAUSE HE IS FULL OF LAVA.

Molten Rune.flavorText: It's post-ancient modern realist neoclassical impressionist art. No idea what it means though.

Monkey Business.flavorText: Why aren't the bananas randomly split???

Monstrous Parrot.flavorText: What kind of crackers are you feeding that thing?

Moonbeam.flavorText: The light of the moon may have disappeared from Zin-Azshari after the Sundering, but not its power.

Moonfang.flavorText: Moonforehead just didn't have the same ring to it.

Moonfire.flavorText: "Cast Moonfire, and never stop." - How to Be a Druid, Chapter 5, Section 3

Moonglade Portal.flavorText: Ain't no party like a Moonglade party ‘cause a Moonglade party got bears.

Moonlit Guidance.flavorText: Guff always makes the best decisions after 2 AM.

Moorabi.flavorText: Most disturbing is how Moorabi covers all those frozen minions with flavored syrup.

Mor'shan Elite.flavorText: "Fear not the orc who has slain a million training dummies, but the orc who keeps CAMPING MY CORPSE!"

Mor'shan Watch Post.flavorText: Pushing into Ashenvale made this post uneventful.

Mordresh Fire Eye.flavorText: You're not hardcore unless you died hardcore.

Moroes.flavorText: Moroes runs an army of stewards, but still ends up inflating the balloons himself.

Mortal Coil.flavorText: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.

Mortal Eradication.flavorText: Clearly anything with 6 or more health is immortal. Such as Street Trickster. We are nerfing Street Trickster for lore accuracy.

Mortal Strike.flavorText: "If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike." - The Warrior Code, Line 6

Mortuary Machine.flavorText: The ankle bone's connected to the shin bone. The knuckle bone's connected to the... eh, it'll be fine.

Mosh Pit.flavorText: Let the Corpses hit the floor!

Mosh'Ogg Announcer.flavorText: One's play-by-play. The other is off-color.

Mosh'Ogg Enforcer.flavorText: Can’t break the rules if you can’t read ‘em.

Mossy Horror.flavorText: The hills have eyes. And teeth. Pretty bad breath, too.

Mothership.flavorText: Has been known to abduct sea cows and leave kelp circles.

Motion Denied.flavorText: DO NOT PASS GO. DO NOT COLLECT 200 GOLD.

Mount Hyjal Imposter.flavorText: Among Tyrande's forces, Murozond had planted agents to ensure Archimonde's victory.

Mountain Bear.flavorText: If they want your picnic basket, I recommend giving it to them.

Mountain Giant.flavorText: His mother said that he was just big boned.

Mountainfire Armor.flavorText: Excuse me. Your mountain is on fire.

Mozaki, Master Duelist.flavorText: Treats her students like her peers, which means defeating them in one-sided duels all day long.

Mr. Smite.flavorText: “Please, Mr. Smite was my father. Call me Yorik.”

Muck Plumber.flavorText: If you drink muck, you go to the Maw before you die.

Muck Pools.flavorText: Making a dredger is easier than you'd think. You don't need to worry about mucking it up!

Muckborn Servant.flavorText: Party guests never tip as well as the patrons in Bob's tavern.

Muckmorpher.flavorText: Fan favorite in the muck morphin' sewer strangers.

Muensterosity.flavorText: We were going to put some cheesy joke here, but we goudan't come up with anything.

Mukla's Champion.flavorText: An elegant gorilla, for a more civilized age.

Mukla, Tyrant of the Vale.flavorText: Pro tip: DO NOT BOGART THE BANANAS.

Mulch.flavorText: Is this a noun or a verb? We will never know.

Multi-Strike.flavorText: “I said you get two attack, not two attacks!”

Murder Accusation.flavorText: Quote From Man Murdered: "What are you gonna do, murder me?"

Murgur Murgurgle.flavorText: Murlocs are not native to Outland. When the Sungills arrived, one among them rose to the challenge of this dark world. They call him... Murgurgle. Murgur Murgurgle.

Murkwater Scribe.flavorText: The pen is mightier than the trident.

Murloc Growfin.flavorText: Grows up to 8x its size! Just add water!

Murloc Holmes.flavorText: When you have eliminated the imfroggable, whatever remains, however uncroakable, must be the truth.

Murloc Knight.flavorText: Hee hee! Look at his cute little feet.

Murloc Raider.flavorText: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!

Murloc Tastyfin.flavorText: He was destined for the soup. One way or another…

Murloc Tidecaller.flavorText: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.

Murloc Tinyfin.flavorText: High mortality rate, from often being hugged to death.

Murloc Warleader.flavorText: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound? Nope! Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!

Murlocula.flavorText: The best part of Murlocula is when he said "IT'S MRRGLIN' TIME" and totally mrrgled those guys.

Murmy.flavorText: Unlike other mummies, they rolled him up with rice, sliced cucumbers, and soy sauce on the side.

Murozond the Infinite.flavorText: "Well, I'm glad YOU knew what I should be doing this turn."

Murozond, Thief of Time.flavorText: By unwinding the fall of C'Thun, Murozond would claim the Old God's power, and with it, the world.

Museum Curator.flavorText: He is forever cursing the kids who climb on the rails and the evil archeologists who animate the exhibits.

Muster for Battle.flavorText: "I'm bringing the guacamole!" – One of the most successful (yet rare) Silver Hand rallying cries

Mutanus the Devourer.flavorText: As long as Naralex stays under the blanket, Mutanus can't get him.

Mutate.flavorText: You'll get the transformation you want when murlocs fly.

Mutating Lifeform.flavorText: Who knows how many amazing discoveries are out there! ... Nevermind, I'm going home.

Myra Rotspring.flavorText: On her first day on the job, Myra removed the smoke detectors.

Myrmidon.flavorText: He didn't have time to Myrmidon the other half of his armor before combat started.

Mysterious Blade.flavorText: It knows every secret you have left.

Mysterious Challenger.flavorText: He may sound surly and antisocial, but he's actually just really shy.

Mysterious Visitor.flavorText: Dave, we can tell this letter is fake - it's in your handwriting. And take off that stupid hood, you're embarrassing us.
