Mystery Egg.flavorText: Which came first, the Mukla or the egg?

Mystery Winner.flavorText: Yeah, but the mystery prize could be anything! Even a boat!

Mystified To'cha.flavorText: We hired your elementary school math teacher to make this card.

Mythical Terror.flavorText: You cannot pet the Terror in Hearthstone.

N'Zoth's First Mate.flavorText: Hates when N'Zoth yells "Ahoy Matey!!", but there's not really much he can do about it.

N'Zoth, God of the Deep.flavorText: It really just wants to cuddle all the creatures of Azeroth.

N'Zoth, the Corruptor.flavorText: Has not been able to get "Under the Sea" out of his head for like FIVE THOUSAND YEARS.

Naga Corsair.flavorText: Hook-tails are nice and all but she keeps getting stuck on things.

Naga Giant.flavorText: He might be giant, but he’s still a couple thousand protein shakes away from competing in the Colossal Wrestling Championship.

Naga Sea Witch.flavorText: If she had studied harder, she would have been a C+ witch.

Naga's Pride.flavorText: Lionfish, Naga, and Spears, oh my!

Nagrand Slam.flavorText: Come on and slam, and welcome to Nagrand!

Najak Hexxen.flavorText: "I've got friends on the other side... of the battlefield."

Narain Soothfancy.flavorText: I predict... that you will be very happy with your reading!

Nat Pagle.flavorText: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman! He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).

Nat, the Darkfisher.flavorText: You can take away his humanity, but you will never take away his fishing pole.

Natalie Seline.flavorText: She discovered Xal'atath, Blade of the Black Empire, a terrible weapon of shadow magic that could both swallow a soul and cut a mean julienne.

Natural Causes.flavorText: What if the suspect was framed? What if the murder weapon was... a plant?

Natural Talent.flavorText: Unfortunately, they got 2nd place at the talent show with their synchronized swimming routine.

Nature Studies.flavorText: "I have a first edition! Go ahead, count the rings."

Naval Mine.flavorText: A Naval Mine? I'd rather it be Naval Yours.

Nazmani Bloodweaver.flavorText: Her first stage name, Ketchupweaver, failed to excite the audience.

Necrium Apothecary.flavorText: Necrium: Get the afterlife without the aftertaste!

Necrium Vial.flavorText: Two near-death experiences for the price of one!

Necrolord Draka.flavorText: We originally planned on giving Rogue a Legendary minion called "The Moon", but SOMEONE jumped in the frame.

Necromechanic.flavorText: If at first you don't succeed, die, die again.

Necrotic Geist.flavorText: An eye for an eye, and a ghoul for a ghoul.

Necrotic Mortician.flavorText: Her hair, just like her name, is full of 'tic's.

Need for Greed.flavorText: Sorry guys, I TOTALLY meant to click greed.

Needlerock Totem.flavorText: You put the Needlerock in to get the Bloodrock out.

Neeru Fireblade.flavorText: Look at this guy! He’s obviously evil! OBVIOUSLY!!!

Nefarian.flavorText: They call him "Blackwing" because he's a black dragon...... and he's got wings.

Neferset Ritualist.flavorText: The Neferset are great—they'll always make sure their friends are feline fine.

Neferset Thrasher.flavorText: Tough to do skateboard tricks with four legs.

Nellie, the Great Thresher.flavorText: Not to be mistaken for her freshwater cousin, Nessie, this massive creature was harnessed to carry Hooktusk's favorite ship.

Neptulon.flavorText: Neptulon is "The Tidehunter". He’s one of the four elemental lords. And he and Ragnaros get together and make really amazing saunas.

Neptulon the Tidehunter.flavorText: Neptulon, tired of filling hands, is now throwing hands.

Nerub'ar Weblord.flavorText: Weblords spend all day making giant trampoline parks.

Nerubian Egg.flavorText: Eggs are a good source of protein and Nerubians.

Nerubian Flyer.flavorText: Undead Air Miles only cover Northrend and the surrounding coast.

Nerubian Swarmguard.flavorText: How long can this go on? Apparently even in death.

Nerubian Vizier.flavorText: One of the essential constructors of the Northrend wide web.

Nesting Golem.flavorText: NESTING GOLEEEEEEEEEEEEM!!!!!!! Eh… It just doesn't feel the same.

Nesting Roc.flavorText: Roc eggs are great in omelettes, sandwiches, and as bait to turn poachers into bird food.

Nether Breath.flavorText: "Whether the Nether is cold, whether the Nether is hot, we'll burn together, whatever the Nether, whether we like it or not."

Nethersoul Buster.flavorText: Why did the demon cross the streams? To get to The Other Side.

Netherspite Historian.flavorText: She can tell you all about the history of people not STANDING IN THE GREEN BEAM!

Netherwalker.flavorText: You got to Nethercrawl before you can Netherwalk.

Netherwind Portal.flavorText: More aromatic than a regular portal.

Nethrandamus.flavorText: Missed the big descent with the other dragons. But better late and nether!

New Heights.flavorText: The sky's the limit (or at least 99 is).

Nexus-Champion Saraad.flavorText: The ethereals have their own jousting tournament, and Saraad is the reigning champion. Also he won the ethereal hot dog eating contest.

Nexus-Prince Shaffar.flavorText: Whatever you do, do not give him OR his ethereal parrot a magical lamp.

Night Elf Huntress.flavorText: A triple threat, all on her own.

Night Howler.flavorText: Honestly, he howls during the day, too.

Night Prowler.flavorText: Listen to the mew-sic of the night.

Nightbane Templar.flavorText: Originally joined to be Arcanagos’ Templar, but has to admit that ordering pizza has become waaaay easier.

Nightblade.flavorText: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.

Nightmare Amalgam.flavorText: Be all that you can be.

Nightshade Bud.flavorText: It actually thrives in partial sunlight.

Nine Lives.flavorText: Beware the night of the living pets!

Nithogg.flavorText: Not to be confused with Nithogger.

Nitroboost Poison.flavorText: Pouring iced milk into your vehicle's fuel tank does NOT provide a Nitro boost, but it does go great with your victory cookies.

Noble Minibot.flavorText: I always get the minibot with the wobbly wheel.

Noble Mount.flavorText: The Horde rued the day that Cariel was allowed to take her pet to work.

Nofin Can Stop Us.flavorText: "I'm having a good time! I don't want to stop at all!"

Nofin's Imp-ossible.flavorText: They have faces only a morrglr could love.

Nordrassil Druid.flavorText: The World Tree Nordrassil provides life-giving energy to the world--and excellent mana savings.

Norgannon.flavorText: His tremendous arcane magic was strong enough to save all of the spirits of the titans after Sargeras destroyed their physical forms.

North Sea Kraken.flavorText: You have no idea how tired this guy is of being released.

Northern Navigation.flavorText: Leads directly to Greatfather Winter's workshop.

Northshire Cleric.flavorText: They help the downtrodden and distressed. Also they sell cookies.

Northwatch Commander.flavorText: It was all going well until some Horde had the cunning idea of attacking from the south.

Nostalgic Clown.flavorText: He used to be kind of corrupt, but now he performs purely for the fun of it.

Nostalgic Gnome.flavorText: She remembers Alterac Valley like it was 833 days ago.

Nostalgic Initiate.flavorText: Nostalgic Initiate: "Man I wish I could relive my college days..." Kel'thuzad: "Say no more."

Nourish.flavorText: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.

Novice Engineer.flavorText: "Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.

Novice Zapper.flavorText: The novices would prefer that he did not.

Noxious Cadaver.flavorText: Shouldn't have eaten that gas station sushi.

Noxious Infiltrator.flavorText: Noxious, but not toxic - he's very polite!

Nozari.flavorText: In another timeline, she was called Yeszari.

Nozdormu.flavorText: Time to write some flavor text.

Nozdormu the Eternal.flavorText: Live life in the fast lane. As long as your opponent does too.

Oaken Summons.flavorText: The Guild used oak trees until they all turned to ash.

Oasis Outlaws.flavorText: With their oasis polluted by the Bloodrock Mining Company, Snake Eyes has set aside her differences with the outlaws of the Badlands to put an end to Bloodrock's operation.

Oasis Snapjaw.flavorText: His dreams of flying and breathing fire like his idol will never be realized.

Oasis Thrasher.flavorText: Didn't get tickets for E.T.C.'s show.

Obliterate.flavorText: Why is 6 afraid of 7? Because Obliterate 9!

Observer of Mysteries.flavorText: Nobody tell him, but he still has his Secrets set to the "Try Me" mode.

Obsessive Fan.flavorText: "Obsessed? No! I'm just really really really really really really really really really really into E.T.C.'s music and everything he says, does, thinks, lives, and breathes!"

Obsidian Destroyer.flavorText: No obsidian is safe around the Obsidian Destroyer!

Obsidian Revenant.flavorText: What is this? A Reven for Ants?!

Obsidian Shard.flavorText: You know you’re a Rogue when a sharp rock makes you go “Ooh! Dagger!”

Obsidian Statue.flavorText: The original artist spent many hours with a fine chisel perfecting the facial expression for maximum tauntiness.

Obsidiansmith.flavorText: Was able to produce more effective weapons than his predecessor, Kelpsmith.

Occult Conjurer.flavorText: Like mirror image, but more secretive and angsty.

Octo-masseuse.flavorText: Oh yeah, all of those are the spots.

Octosari.flavorText: Eight arms of sand-flinging, foe-wringing, card-slinging fury!

Odyn, Prime Designate.flavorText: The best offense is a good defense. 30 defense to be exact.

Ogre Brute.flavorText: Ogres have really terrible short-term chocolate.

Ogre Magi.flavorText: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.

Ogre Ninja.flavorText: He didn't have the grades to get into ninja school, but his dad pulled some strings.

Ogre Warmaul.flavorText: Simple, misguided, and incredibly dangerous. You know, like most things ogre.

Ogre-Gang Ace.flavorText: 100% chance to not play by the rules.

Ogre-Gang Outlaw.flavorText: Why don't they just buy another hat?

Ogre-Gang Rider.flavorText: Doesn't know his ride from his left.

Ogremancer.flavorText: After their third attempt, Tharg began to suspect that Krul was summoning the skeletons on purpose.

Oh My Yogg!.flavorText: Many wonders lie within, but they are not mere toys when your mind is their plaything.

Oh, Manager!.flavorText: "I'd like to speak with your admiral."

Old Murk-Eye.flavorText: He's a legend among murlocs. "Mrghllghghllghg!", they say.

Omega Agent.flavorText: They don't just find the truth. They give it a ten second head start, then hunt it down.

Omega Assembly.flavorText: They told Dr. Boom he could only pick one. He disagreed.

Omega Devastator.flavorText: The Alpha Devastator didn’t devastate enough. The Beta Devastator devastated too much. But the Omega was just right!

Omega Medic.flavorText: She feels waiting for healing makes you appreciate it more.

Omega Mind.flavorText: Has a side-business selling her lipstick shade, "Omega Red."

On the Hunt.flavorText: The mastiff giggles if you don't hit any ducks.

Once Upon a Time....flavorText: ...There was a humble little squirrel on a quest to defeat an evil dragon. With the help of its earthen friend, it saved the murloc princess from danger. The end.

One Hit Wonder.flavorText: They're trying to get a second hit in with their next single, "Divine Shield".

One-eyed Cheat.flavorText: When pirates say there is no "Eye" in "team," they are very literal about it.

Onyx Bishop.flavorText: B4 is a nice place to visit, but he wouldn't want to live there.

Onyx Magescribe.flavorText: Sometimes you gotta spend spells to earn spells.

Onyxia.flavorText: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor. You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.

Onyxia the Broodmother.flavorText: Throw more dots, throw more dots, more dots, more dots!

Onyxian Drake.flavorText: The best offense is a great defense.

Onyxian Warder.flavorText: Throwing more whelps at the problem might not help, but they certainly will hurt.

Oondasta.flavorText: Adorning devilsaurs with armor and feathers is a respected job in troll culture, although it has a high turnover rate.

Open the Cages.flavorText: "Coming out of my cage, and I'm dead by turn nine..."

Open the Waygate.flavorText: Although powerful, the incantation is simple. It’s just a jump to the left, and then a step to the right.

Opera Soloist.flavorText: It ain't over until the imp mother sings.

Optimistic Ogre.flavorText: "What if this goes wrong?" "But what if this goes right?"

Oracle of Elune.flavorText: Even the moon goddess needs to back up her databases.

Orbital Halo.flavorText: I can see your halo. HALO. Haaaalo.

Orbital Moon.flavorText: The blood moon orbits once again.

Order in the Court.flavorText: "I have nothing BUT contempt for this court!"

Orgrimmar Aspirant.flavorText: "Four out of three orcs struggle with math." - Angry Zurge

Origami Crane.flavorText: I was born with 1-Health and paper skin.

Origami Dragon.flavorText: The fire will give you a papercut, which CAN burn. Does that count?

Origami Frog.flavorText: For extra-realistic fly-snatching action, use tape!

Orion, Mansion Manager.flavorText: The secrets of the universe are vast... and will be revealed sometime later this game.

Ornery Direhorn.flavorText: "It's an herbivore. How dangerous can it be?" - Famous last words

Outfit Tailor.flavorText: She has this terrible habit of eating melted cheese while on the job.

Outrider's Axe.flavorText: "I only have to get 4 Zhevra hooves? How hard could that be?"

Overconfident Orc.flavorText: "I am da powerful! You are da poop!"

Overdraft.flavorText: Wait. It costs mana to be out of mana?!

Overflow.flavorText: It's a high five followed by a low tide.

Overflow Surger.flavorText: The drip on this elemental is straight fire!

Overgrown Beanstalk.flavorText: You'd need to be pretty jacked to climb this.

Overgrowth.flavorText: Zangarmarsh: it's a fungal out there!

Overlord Runthak.flavorText: Knows how to lift everyone up while tearing every enemy down.

Overlord Saurfang.flavorText: Eats more than his fair share of sour candy.

Overlord's Whip.flavorText: "This merit badge is for cruelty. This one's for whipping. And this one is for embroidery..."

Overplanner.flavorText: "Hey kids, what do you call an arrogant skydiving pirate? A condescending con descending!"

Overwhelm.flavorText: Scholomance student Brewfest prank gone terribly, terribly awry.

Overzealous Healer.flavorText: In another universe, she's Genji's best friend.

Owlonius.flavorText: They said you sound like an owl.

Ozruk.flavorText: Between you and me, Ozruk is a bit obsessed with his body.

Pack Kodo.flavorText: He looks simple, but there’s a lot to unpack.

Pack Tactics.flavorText: "Just you wait, I’ll go get on my main!"

Pack the House.flavorText: How many Pack the Houses would a pack house if a pack could house Pack the House?

Package Dealer.flavorText: I'm always getting my neighbor's mail. And my other neighbor. And my other neighbor. I'm stealing their packages.

Package Runner.flavorText: He could go... all... the... way!

Painted Canvasaur.flavorText: Oh this is a present? Would you like that gift raptor not?

Painter's Virtue.flavorText: For when the Light hits the painting at a certain angle.

Pandaren Importer.flavorText: She carries everything you didn't want and more!

Pantry Spider.flavorText: You have to admit, they make a cute couple.

Paparazzi.flavorText: When you're a Legendary minion, you get a shiny orange gem, a dragon emblem, and about 100 of these people following you everywhere.

Parade Leader.flavorText: He's always going to reign on his parade.

Paraglide.flavorText: I can see my hand from here!!!!!

Paragon of Light.flavorText: She’s all fun and games until someone rings that stupid bell.

Parallax Cannon.flavorText: Math is now cannon in the Warcraft universe.

Parched Desperado.flavorText: I'm green And I'm about to die Da ba dee da ba di

Park Panther.flavorText: Somebody called animal control once. It didn't work out very well for anybody.

Parrot Sanctuary.flavorText: Did you know? It's very loud in a parrot sanctuary. This has been bird facts with Ranger Gilly.

Parrrley.flavorText: Time to engage in some unfriendly negotiations.

Partner Assignment.flavorText: In every group assignment, someone does all the legwork.

Partner in Crime.flavorText: "You know what we need? Some rope." "That's stupid. Name one thing you'd need a rope for."

Party Animal.flavorText: He's the wildlife of the party!

Party Crasher.flavorText: "Do you ever wonder why you don't get invited anywhere?" "… no, not really."

Party Favor Totem.flavorText: It's the gift (totem) that keeps on giving (totems)!

Party Planner Vona.flavorText: She's known for her popular "occult ritual to summon an otherworldly being" parties.

Party Up!.flavorText: Random? But what if we don't get a tank?

Patches the Pilot.flavorText: Finally, a Patches you want to draw on turn 1!

Patches the Pirate.flavorText: What do sailors yell when Patches steals their treasure chest full of laws and other things being transported to parliament for a vote? "The Eyes have it!"

Patchwerk.flavorText: This card is so good, it might need patch work.

Patchwork Pals.flavorText: "I'll name you Misha, you Huffer, and you can be the third one."

Pathmaker.flavorText: You can never choose the wrong path if you make your own.

Patient Assassin.flavorText: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.

Peaceful Piper.flavorText: "Is there anything worth more than peace and love on the planet Azeroth?"

Peasant.flavorText: Better pay them, or they'll join the Defias.

Pebbly Page.flavorText: A good friend will lighten your Overload.

Pelagos.flavorText: He's a great judge of character.

Pelican Diver.flavorText: The pelican’s beak is so big, some Colossal minions can even fit inside!* *This is a lie.

Pen Flinger.flavorText: The pen is also a more aerodynamic short-range projectile than the sword.

Penance.flavorText: This is what happens when you don’t give a sincere apology.

Peon.flavorText: Joke's on the peon: the job's never done.

Perdition's Blade.flavorText: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

Perpetual Flame.flavorText: Flame is perpetual.* *Perpetual only applies to current turn.

Perplexing Anomaly.flavorText: I'm so confused... this is really a headscratcher... it doesn't make any sense... why does it cost 3 Mana?

Persistent Peddler.flavorText: Loves pyramid schemes and bike rides.

Pet Collector.flavorText: "And I'll call you Mrs. Snugglepants, and you Bubblecuddle, and you Cutie Cakes, and you ..."

Pet Parrot.flavorText: You are REQUIRED to give it crackers. It's the Bird Law.

Petting Zoo.flavorText: Welcome to the petting zoo. DO NOT TOUCH THE ANIMALS.

Petty Theft.flavorText: Room service at a pirate hotel really cleans house.

Phalanx Commander.flavorText: Turns out he's really good at herding cats.

Phantom Freebooter.flavorText: There's no such thing as a free boot.

Phantom Militia.flavorText: Recruited from the Gilnean opera house.

Pharaoh Cat.flavorText: Mightiest of mousers, enduring in kingship of the upper and lower cat tree, conqueror of the red dot, the all-wise Catshepsut.

Pharaoh's Blessing.flavorText: Life hack: Sneeze near a pharaoh.

Phase Stalker.flavorText: It's not just a phase! I don't have to tell you anything! GAWSH!

Pick Pocket.flavorText: He'll pick anyone's pocket, except a gnome's. He'd never stoop so low.

Piercing Shot.flavorText: Goblins hate wasting money on unnecessary ammunition.

Pile of Bones.flavorText: It's a very well-organized pile, I'll give you that.

Pilfer.flavorText: The class is always greener on the other side of the board.

Pilfered Power.flavorText: The Hozen don't get paid much, but at least they get to keep any excess mana.

Piloted Reaper.flavorText: New facial recognition systems keep out the Lorewalkers and Doomsayers.

Piloted Shredder.flavorText: Once upon a time, only goblins piloted shredders. These days, everyone from Doomsayer to Lorewalker Cho seems to ride one.

Piloted Sky Golem.flavorText: The pinnacle of goblin engineering. Includes an espresso machine and foot massager.

Pint-Size Potion.flavorText: I hope you didn't disenchant your Shadow Word: Horror!

Pint-Sized Summoner.flavorText: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.

Pip the Potent.flavorText: One time, I was trying to get Pip's attention to warn her that the dangerous outlaw Cheery Ollie, who also goes by just 'O', was headed her way. "Pip! Pip! Cheery O!", I shouted.

Pipsi Painthoof.flavorText: "Earthmother guide my paintbrush strokes, especially on the eyes."

Piranha Launcher.flavorText: A great improvement over the guppy launcher.

Piranha Poacher.flavorText: This snack certainly isn’t smiling back…

Piranha Swarmer.flavorText: One Fish, Two Fish. Less Fish? You wish.

Pit Fighter.flavorText: What did the pits ever do to you?

Pit Lord.flavorText: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

Pit Master.flavorText: If you win your duel, he'll throw in some of his famous Pit Master barbecue.

Pit Snake.flavorText: It could be worse. It could be a Snake Pit.

Plagiarizarrr.flavorText: He's also working on his own Hearthstone expansion: Festival of Epics.

Plagiarize.flavorText: Copying is just using your resources wisely.

Plague Scientist.flavorText: The excruciating pain means it's working!

Plague Strike.flavorText: Not wanting to infect anyone with his cold, the Death Knight politely coughed into his shoulder.

Plague of Death.flavorText: Don't worry, there's a happy little funhouse right under that sand pit.

Plague of Madness.flavorText: Don't bring a candle to a knife fight.

Plaguebringer.flavorText: One sip and you've got the grippe.

Plagued Grain.flavorText: Oh, don’t mind the smell. They're just aged!

Plagued Protodrake.flavorText: "What’s in the drake?! WHAT’S IN THE DRAKE?"

Plaguemaw the Rotting.flavorText: This is why you should brush your teeth three times a day!

Plaguespreader.flavorText: What do they mean by Patient Zero? I'm very patient!

Planted Evidence.flavorText: So you're telling me this wasn't Natural Causes?

Plated Beetle.flavorText: "Ok, your party has defeated the beetle." "I put it on my head." "What?" "I put it on my head. Like a hat."

Playhouse Giant.flavorText: WARNING: NOT A PLAYHOUSE. DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CLIMB.

Playmaker.flavorText: "Here's the plan: you go left, I go right, and the wounded guy takes the hit."

Plot Twist.flavorText: It’s coming from inside the deck!

Plot of Sin.flavorText: It's a great plot, but it's riddled with holes.

Plucky Paintfin.flavorText: Not everyone can become a great painter. But a great painter can come from anywhere.

Pocket Dimension.flavorText: On average, this gets you around 3 cards. And none of them have Overload.

Pocket Sand.flavorText: I was only trying to get it in your eyes, man. YOU didn't need to open your mouth like that!

Pogo-Hopper.flavorText: Once you hop, you just can't stop!

Poison Seeds.flavorText: "Poisonseed Bagel" is the least popular bagel at McTiggin's Druidic Bagel Emporium.

Poisoned Blade.flavorText: How much more poisoned can a blade get? The answer is a lot. A lot more poisoned.

Polluted Hoarder.flavorText: Roll ‘greed’ OR THIS COULD HAPPEN TO YOU.

Polymorph.flavorText: There was going to be a pun in this flavor text, but it just came out baa-d.

Polymorph: Jellyfish.flavorText: While Ini’s first use of the Spontaneous Gelatin Transmalgamizer may have gotten her banned from the Gnomish Cooking Convention, she’s never one to throw away a new invention.

Pompous Thespian.flavorText: Alas poor Annoy-o-Tron! A fellow of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy!

Pop'gar the Putrid.flavorText: All around the arid badlands The Outlaws chased the Townsfolk Gerry had a train full of sludge POP! goes the sludge train

Popsicooler.flavorText: Just passing through Alterac on its way to apply for a job at the Ice Cream Citadel.

Popular Pixie.flavorText: Popular Pixie personally prefers particularly powerful pop performances.

Portal Keeper.flavorText: No longer allowed to be “it” when playing demon tag.

Portal Overfiend.flavorText: It’s like an interdimensional game of demon tag.

Posse Possession.flavorText: Keep your friends close, your enemies closer, and your shadows at gunpoint.

Possessed Lackey.flavorText: If you don't keep up with your payments, it'll be a repossessed lackey.

Possessed Villager.flavorText: It's like a pinata! A lame disgusting horrific pinata.

Possessifier.flavorText: Beating the best, being the best, and brainwashing the rest.

Potion Vendor.flavorText: Everyone gets two because that’s all she can hold.

Potion of Illusion.flavorText: Unfortunately, there's no potion that can make you unsee all the faces in that bottle.

Potion of Madness.flavorText: You'd be insane NOT to drink it!

Potionmaster Putricide.flavorText: "Good news everyone! I'm a Rogue card now!"

Pounce.flavorText: Comes with an overwhelming urge to jump into the nearest open box.

Power Chord: Synchronize.flavorText: "It's all about you, girl On your 16,000th birthday"

Power Infusion.flavorText: It infuses, it enthuses, it amuses!

Power Overwhelming.flavorText: We cannot even describe how horrible the death is. It's CRAZY bad! Maybe worse than that. Just don't do it.

Power Slider.flavorText: There's a huge difference between a battle-axe and an axe-guitar. One is for combat, and the other is for combat AND rocking out.

Power Spike.flavorText: Jeff, when I said this deck needs a power spike I did not mean it like that.

Power Word: Feast.flavorText: Some people are here for the stellar, world-renowned academic program. Others are here for the buffet.

Power Word: Glory.flavorText: The promise of glory is a powerful tool to get minions to do your bidding. Only slightly less powerful than the promise of an ice cream bar!

Power Word: Replicate.flavorText: Available as a bundle, along with Power Words: Detonate, Animate, Annihilate, and Paper Weight.

Power Word: Shield.flavorText: Sure the extra protection is nice, but the shield really reduces visibility.

Power Word: Tentacles.flavorText: Because you're wrapped in a protective layer of… tentacles?

Power of Creation.flavorText: Mostly used for party tricks, to be honest.

Power of the Wild.flavorText: Never look a panther in the eye. Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'? Well, it's one of those.

Powermace.flavorText: People assume that shamans control the elements, but really, they have to ask them stuff and the elements are like, "Yeah ok, sure."

Pozzik, Audio Engineer.flavorText: "I'm down here, fixin' all the Gnomish tech that breaks down mid-set while that buffoon Fizzle is up there taking pictures of the sky. YOU tell ME who's the better engineer!"

Praise Galakrond!.flavorText: "Turn to Galakrond, Chapter 3 Verse 12. 'SNARL! ROAR! GRAAAAGH!' Let us reflect on this wisdom."

Predation.flavorText: No need to worry! The squid is actually being sent to a nice kelp farm upstate.

Predatory Instincts.flavorText: Somebody’s been eating their funnel cakes.

Prescience.flavorText: Wait don't change the channel! I love this vision.

Pressure Plate.flavorText: The appropriate dishware for stressful situations.

Prestor's Pyromancer.flavorText: Ah, yeah. This guy. Definitely not an evil dragon in disguise either.

Pride Seeker.flavorText: When you're putting your head in the lion's mouth, you may as well dress the part.

Pride's Fury.flavorText: Day 4: I think they're starting to suspect.

Priest of the Deceased.flavorText: "Funnel cakes? I haven't had those in years…"

Priest of the Feast.flavorText: Now that's a world champion cheesecake!

Priestess Valishj.flavorText: Some of the more stoic priestesses worry that she's living too lavishjly.

Priestess of Elune.flavorText: If she threatens to "moon" you, it's not what you think.

Priestess of Fury.flavorText: Furious that she only has six warglaives. The Sightless Watcher has eight! The fel is always greener on the other side.

Primal Dungeoneer.flavorText: They wanted a Mature Dungeoneer. Instead they got this.

Primal Fusion.flavorText: Golce and Dabbana have a new line of Earth Totems available at vendors everywhere this holiday season.

Primal Talismans.flavorText: All that remained from the first kobold colony: a single talisman and the word "Flamestrike."

Primalfin Champion.flavorText: Sure, he'll return your stuff. OVER HIS DEAD BODY!

Primalfin Lookout.flavorText: Lookout is a self-appointed title that's mostly an excuse to beat things up.

Primalfin Totem.flavorText: Emits a sound only murlocs can hear, which is good because it’s REALLY annoying.

Primordial Drake.flavorText: Before he became a rap artist.

Primordial Explorer.flavorText: "We're letting the poisonous dude carry the bags?"

Primordial Glyph.flavorText: It's the Ancient Tol'vir symbol for "Whoops!"

Primordial Protector.flavorText: I thought the "shape of water" meant something else.

Primordial Studies.flavorText: A long forgotten tome whose very essence seeps of magic. 40 dust, used.

Primordial Wave.flavorText: A primordial hello to you too!

Prince Keleseth.flavorText: Three Princes stand before you. This one wants to buff his brothers.

Prince Liam.flavorText: "I have a very particular set of skills. Skills that make me a nightmare for witches like you."

Prince Malchezaar.flavorText: He was super excited to acquire Gorehowl at a garage sale! Then super disappointed to find out it was a foam reproduction.

Prince Renathal.flavorText: A lot of kids go through a rebellious phase, but Prince Renathal's was a bit extreme.

Prince Taldaram.flavorText: Three Princes stand before you. This one wants to copy others.

Prince Valanar.flavorText: Three Princes stand before you. This one devours one after another.

Princess Huhuran.flavorText: She flitters around Ahn'Qiraj dreaming of the day she will meet a sweet prince, whom she can lay thousands of eggs with.

Princess Talanji.flavorText: Everyone wants to be a princess, but nobody ever considers the size of the hat.

Prismatic Beam.flavorText: Seven colors of the rainbow, one for each enemy minion.

Prismatic Elemental.flavorText: Disappointed they were rejected from the Magical Guardian tryouts.

Prismatic Jewel Kit.flavorText: The divine trick to jewelcrafting is tumbling your own rocks.

Prismatic Lens.flavorText: Mined exclusively from the dark side of the moon.

Prison Breaker.flavorText: Flavor fail! Demolition Renovator did it FIRST!

Prison of Yogg-Saron.flavorText: "We've finally captured Yogg-Saron! How should we keep him contained?" "How about... an open pit... right below us... with four loose chains?" "PERFECT!"

Private Eye.flavorText: Eye see what you did there.

Prize Plunderer.flavorText: But he'll never be able to plunder the prize of a happy childhood.

Prize Vendor.flavorText: He's just making sure they're real. Authentic tickets taste like strawberry.

Pro Gamer.flavorText: Wow... who could have guessed? Another rock user ruining the meta for everyone as usual.

Product 9.flavorText: We're fresh out of Toyrantus right now but lemme show you something we have that's just as good!

Professor Putricide.flavorText: Among his more notable inventions: A tentacle-groomer, a plague that would wipe out all life on Azeroth, and a fidget spinner.

Professor Slate.flavorText: "Don’t worry, this will be over in a second. It might FEEL like an eternity, but I assure you, it’s quite quick!"

Promotion.flavorText: And with the new title of 'Golden Hand Recruit', you also get a pay raise!

Prophet Velen.flavorText: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.

Prosecutor Mel'tranix.flavorText: "Your Honor. The Defense isn't a clown, he's the whole circus."

Prospector's Caravan.flavorText: Prospectors came from all around in the Golden Legendary Rush of '49.

Prosthetic Hand.flavorText: It's creaky and it's rusty! It's spooky and it's dusty!

Protect the King!.flavorText: Form ranks! Everyone into the King's Tuskarr Defense!

Proud Defender.flavorText: It'll take a humble offender to defeat him.

Proving Grounds.flavorText: 1v1 me on Proving Grounds, DH only, no items, 4 stocks.

Provoke.flavorText: "Heh, Greetings. Heh, Greetings. Heh, Greetings. I will crush you!"

Psych-o-Tron.flavorText: "Annoyinger-o-Tron" was just too unwieldy. And accurate.

Psyche Split.flavorText: This is how the arakkoa make friends.

Psychic Conjurer.flavorText: "I see... a WISP? Why do you have a wisp?!"

Psychopomp.flavorText: "Come with me if you want to re-live."

Psyfiend.flavorText: Listens to a LOT of K-pop.

Pterrordax Hatchling.flavorText: Aww. So cute. Want to feed him another finger?

Public Defender.flavorText: Happy to defend any public offender!

Puddlestomper.flavorText: He pays homage to Morgl, the great murloc oracle! (Who doesn't??)

Pufferfist.flavorText: "...and then I'll hit 'em with the ol' puffercut!"

Punch Card.flavorText: Don't forget to punch out when you Cleave.

Puppetmaster Dorian.flavorText: Though Dorian may officially be working under Dr. Boom, we all know who's really pulling the strings...

Purify.flavorText: Even better than a hot shower with vigorous scrubbing!

Purifying Power.flavorText: I sure do love making my minions better!

Pursuit of Justice.flavorText: "Is this about justice or just us?"

Puzzlemaster Khadgar.flavorText: Khadgar Khadgar in the ball, who is the smartest white-haired, tall, handsome mage of them all?

Pyroblast.flavorText: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

Pyros.flavorText: If you strike her down, she shall become more powerful than you can possibly… well, she'll become a 6/6 anyways.

Pyrotechnician.flavorText: The difference between a pyrotechnician and a pyromaniac is a paycheck.

Quality Assurance.flavorText: I assure you this card is quality.

Quartermaster.flavorText: His specialty? Dividing things into four pieces.

Quartz Elemental.flavorText: These elementals, along with feldspar and mica, are often taken for granite.

Quartzite Crusher.flavorText: It's not just a weapon… it's a rock!

Queen Azshara.flavorText: Hobbies include: Ordering subjects around, making deals with old gods, and taking long walks under the beach.

Queen of Pain.flavorText: Her sister is the Queen of Pane who sells windows and shower doors.

Queensguard.flavorText: Archnemesis of the Guardian of Kings.

Questing Adventurer.flavorText: "Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?"

Questing Explorer.flavorText: Earned her merit badges the hard way—twelve zhevra hooves at a time.

Quick Pick.flavorText: QUICK! Pick which quick pick trick will stick in the thick of the wick! Lickety split!

Quicksand Elemental.flavorText: Use a light abrasive to buff blemishes away but use a heavy abrasive to debuff problems.

R.C. Rampage.flavorText: This place has really gone to the dogs.

Rabid Worgen.flavorText: "I'm sorry, son. We had to send Old Howler off…to a farm…to play…"

Radar Detector.flavorText: "Yup! I definitely don't know how to read radar."

Radiance of Azshara.flavorText: Uses Arcane, Fire, and Frost magic to vanquish Queen Azshara's foes. And for her skincare routine!

Raging Felscreamer.flavorText: Screaming loudly will not reduce the cost of non-demonic goods.

Raging Worgen.flavorText: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.

Ragnaros the Firelord.flavorText: Ragnaros was summoned by the Dark Iron dwarves, who were eventually enslaved by the Firelord. Summoning Ragnaros often doesn’t work out the way you want it to.

Ragnaros, Lightlord.flavorText: What happens when you try and corrupt a corrupted firelord? DOUBLE NEGATIVE, INSECT!

Raid Boss Onyxia.flavorText: Onyxia chose her guises to manipulate mortals, but her true form? That was reserved for ending them.

Raid Negotiator.flavorText: "What do you mean by aggressive negotiation tactics?" "Negotiations in bear form."

Raid the Docks.flavorText: Winning the annual Ratchet Regatta really went to their heads.

Raid the Sky Temple.flavorText: "Why can't I hold all these scrolls?"

Raiding Party.flavorText: And a bowl of chips. And some of those little cocktail weenies!

Rain of Fire.flavorText: You know it’s autumn when the skies rain brimstone and fire. Also: pumpkin spice!

Rain of Toads.flavorText: "Oh, THAT'S how she brings the warts!"

Rainbow Glowscale.flavorText: She prefers saying that she has Arcane, Fel, Fire, Frost, Holy, Nature, and Shadow Spell Damage +1.

Rainbow Seamstress.flavorText: Is this card any good? It would seam sew.

Raise Dead.flavorText: Technically, it’s just really late healing.

Raj Naz'jan.flavorText: When you play the Coin, he deals emotional damage.

Rake.flavorText: When you're done shredding through your enemies, use it on your leaves!

Rally!.flavorText: One for the squire, two for the gnome, three for the glory, and GO, GO, GO!

Rallying Blade.flavorText: As far as blades go, this one is pretty great in the motivation department.

Ram Commander.flavorText: Get your RAM in pairs for better performance.

Ram Tamer.flavorText: Pump up the ram, pump it up. While your hooves are stompin’.

Ram Wrangler.flavorText: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.

Rambunctious Stuffy.flavorText: The Lich King can't sleep without his stuffy.

Ramkahen Wildtamer.flavorText: She gets to decide what cards go to the Hall of Fame.

Ramming Mount.flavorText: Tavish has some road rage issues to work through.

Rancor.flavorText: Wise men say "Only fools rush in." Wise Orcs say the opposite.

Rangari Scout.flavorText: Always takes credit for other people's discoveries.

Ranger Gilly.flavorText: Get you someone who looks at you the way Ranger Gilly looks at that Crocolisk.

Ransack.flavorText: "Fred's a talking ghoul. He can do whatever he wants." "I want to steal!"

Raptor Hatchling.flavorText: They’re just baby teeth. Lots and lots of baby teeth.

Ras Frostwhisper.flavorText: Always the favorite of Headmaster Kel'Thuzad, Ras nonetheless received a chilly reception from the other faculty.

Rat Pack.flavorText: He's gonna do it his way.

Rat Sensei.flavorText: The old teacher needed to find some tokens with attitude.

Rat Trap.flavorText: MISSING: One giant rat. Please return to King Togwaggle.

Ratcatcher.flavorText: He's on the hunt for Togwaggle's missing rat.

Ratchet Privateer.flavorText: There's a fine line between privateering and pirating. It comes down to tax breaks.

Rats of Extraordinary Size.flavorText: They don't care if you believe they exist.

Rattlegore.flavorText: He looks bad now, but he was pretty handsome in his 20/20s.

Ravaging Ghoul.flavorText: But goes by "Ravishing Ghoul" when he hits the club.

Ravasaur Runt.flavorText: Doesn't like to adapt unless others are watching. Some minions are such show-offs.

Raven Familiar.flavorText: Quoth the raven, 'Does yours cost more?'

Raven Idol.flavorText: Was petrified when it found out it didn't make the cut for Azerothian Idol.

Ravencaller.flavorText: That Friends and Familiars Plan is really paying off!

Ravenholdt Assassin.flavorText: Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold. He'll take care of the rest.

Ravenous Kraken.flavorText: He's witewally hitting the squiddy wight now.

Ravenous Pterrordax.flavorText: For better results, feed your pterrordax low-fat, high-fiber minions.

Ray of Frost.flavorText: If you have zero chill, this can help.

Raylla, Sand Sculptor.flavorText: Is this flavor text raylla the best we can do?

Raza the Chained.flavorText: "Could you do me a favor and get the keys from Kazakus?"

Raza the Resealed.flavorText: The 10th anniversary edition of a classic bestseller!

Razorboar.flavorText: And this little pig built his house out of VENGEANCE.

Razorfen Beastmaster.flavorText: It's a homebrew variant on my favorite role-playing game.

Razorfen Hunter.flavorText: Someone did mess with Tuskerr once. ONCE.

Razorfen Rockstar.flavorText: Quilboar feel Rock in their blood. And blood in their rocks.

Razorglaive Sentinel.flavorText: For the worgen that has everything: more claws.

Razormane Battleguard.flavorText: Where there's a quill, there's a way.

Razormane Raider.flavorText: "Call me hedgehog one more time. I dare you."

Razorpetal Lasher.flavorText: The reason why there are no zombies in Un'goro.

Razorpetal Volley.flavorText: The result of a fundamental misunderstanding of the phrase "flower power".

Razorscale.flavorText: A razorscale, razormane, and razorclaw walk into the tavern.

Razzle-Dazzler.flavorText: Look out Dancin' Deryl, he's coming for your job.

Reap What You Sow.flavorText: With a hat like that, I'd say their tailor did all of the sowing.

Rebuke.flavorText: When one buke just isn’t enough.

Reckless Apprentice.flavorText: It’s all a great learning experience until someone accidentally aggros the boss.

Reckless Experimenter.flavorText: It's hard to call her reckless when it's clear she knows what she's doing.

Reckless Flurry.flavorText: Look. Cautious Flurries will only get you so far in life.

Reckless Rocketeer.flavorText: One Insane Rocketeer. One Rocket full of Explosives. Infinite Fun.

Reckoning.flavorText: He would henceforth be known as "Karmerr, the Doom of Kazzak."

Recombobulator.flavorText: For when you didn’t combobulate quite right the first time around.

Reconnaissance.flavorText: “But Commander, I already did the connaissance.”

Record Scratcher.flavorText: A Rogue's favorite audio sample is an orchestral stab.

Recruiter.flavorText: Join the Argent Crusade! We have attractive tabards and you get to carry really nice swords!

Recurring Villain.flavorText: Mwahahaha! You'll never catch him this time!

Recycle.flavorText: Druidic recycling involves putting plastics in one bin and enemy minions in another bin.

Red Card.flavorText: Finally, Demon Hunter has expanded its color palette to TWO colors!

Red Giant.flavorText: Lots of cards get played around it, but it's the real star.

Red Herring.flavorText: He's got gill-ty written all over him!

Red Mana Wyrm.flavorText: It has double the Attack. "Go on." And double the Health. "Yes??" And its trigger has twice the effect. "WHAT???" And it costs… Five times more.

Redband Wasp.flavorText: Also comes in other colors, but red's in fashion this season.

Redeemed Pariah.flavorText: "Look at this stick. Look at it!"

Redemption.flavorText: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time. It’s a mystery!

Repentance.flavorText: Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.

Replicat-o-tron.flavorText: According to the Boom Labs sales brochure, it "impractically makes itself!"

Replicating Menace.flavorText: It's a car! *Whomp whomp whomp* It's a robot! *Whomp whom-CRUNCH* It's… three.. smaller robots!

Repulsive Gargantuan.flavorText: "EW, YUCK, GROSS, ICKY-" "Stop, you're hurting my feelings!"

Research Project.flavorText: Abstract: Analyzing systemic applications of coldlight data sets vis-a-vis shuffle-related paradigms. Conclusion: Yay, cards!

Reserved Spot.flavorText: She needs a spot to make sure she can quickly get to her trunk.

Resistance Aura.flavorText: Perfect for defending against Beasts. Specifically small ones. Like, a very specific species of small insectoid animal. Ants. It resists ants.

Resizing Pouch.flavorText: Just don't put a Resizing Pouch inside the Resizing Pouch.

Reska, the Pit Boss.flavorText: Overseer of the Bloodrock Mine, Reska will work you to the bone. They'll then reanimate your bones and work THOSE bones to the bone.

Resurrect.flavorText: I walked into the dungeon and noticed a slain adventurer. In his final moments, he had scrawled out a message in the dust on the wall beside him. Two words: "rez plz"

Return Policy.flavorText: Sorry, the Workshop has a strict 'no-takesies-backsies' policy.

Revenant Rascal.flavorText: Turns out his face really did get stuck that way.

Revenge.flavorText: This is better than Arcane Explosion, so I guess warriors are finally getting revenge on mages for Mortal Strike being worse than Fireball.

Revenge of the Wild.flavorText: My roommates only use Revenge of the Passive Aggressive.

Reverberations.flavorText: This sounds much louder in the void.

Revolve.flavorText: "Please don't ride the carousel for thirty minutes after eating. After the carousel eats, I mean."

Rewind.flavorText: If you don't find the spell you want, just cast this one more time and see if you get lucky.

Rheastrasza.flavorText: Rheastrasza ascends above loyalty to just her dragonflight to serve all dragonkind. She believes all flights deserve a future and will give her life for the future dragon prince.

Rhyme Spinner.flavorText: For ONCE we're not talking about ice!

Rhythm and Roots.flavorText: For Zok's latest song, he decided to go back to his roots. Like the ones on a tree. Tree roots.

Rhythmdancer Risa.flavorText: Shadowstep to the left! Double jump to the right! Class cross!

Ricochet Shot.flavorText: Simple geometry? Actually, I find it's quite complex.

Riftcleaver.flavorText: Brings you face to face with your destructive impulses.

Righteous Cause.flavorText: "And I hereby dub thee a cadet of the Explorer’s League! NEXT!"

Righteous Defense.flavorText: Paladins... Always stealing someone else’s thunder. And stats.

Righteous Protector.flavorText: Original name was Tubular Protector, but this seems more bodacious.

Righteousness.flavorText: Shield yourself in righteousness! It feels like a warm fuzzy blanket.

Rimescale Siren.flavorText: She will freeze the Scourge dead in their tracks.

Rimetongue.flavorText: Warriors are red, Frost spells are blue, If you're being hit by a weapon, Rimetongue's got you.

Rin, Orchestrator of Doom.flavorText: Rin's orchestra is the best of the best. When your replacement is just one summoning away, you have to play perfectly.

Rin, the First Disciple.flavorText: Signed and sealed, she delivers oblivion.

Ring Matron.flavorText: But where does she keep them?

Ring Toss.flavorText: If you liked it, then you shoulda put a ring on it!

Ring of Courage.flavorText: Now to find the Ring of Wisdom and Ring of Power.

Ringmaster Whatley.flavorText: His main qualification is that he'll work with anyone. Or anything.

Ringmaster's Baton.flavorText: A mech, a dragon, and a pirate walk into an Old God's gaping maw. The mech was too crunchy, the dragon was too hot, but the pirate was just right.

Rinling's Rifle.flavorText: This rifle needs a muzzle for its muzzle.

Rise to the Occasion.flavorText: Faith is never lost, only repurposed.

Rising Waves.flavorText: How do you expect them to do the wave if their arms are buried in the sand??

Rising Winds.flavorText: Do not talk to me or my chick ever again.

Risky Skipper.flavorText: Sworn enemy of the Safety Matey.

Ritual of Doom.flavorText: "Who wants to sing the Doom song?!"

Rivendare, Warrider.flavorText: More like the 4 Horsemen of the "Can't Get Here On Time."

River Crocolisk.flavorText: Edward "Lefty" Smith tried to make luggage out of a river crocolisk once.

Robes of Protection.flavorText: Warning: Robes of Protection are intended for targeted effects only and are not an effective defense against Flamestrike, Twisting Nether, or other AOE attacks.

Robocaller.flavorText: When I was your age, robocallers had to dial themselves!

Rock Master Voone.flavorText: After several audience members were burnt to a crisp, Voone's band became a lot less all-in on Dragons.

Rock Rager.flavorText: Still doesn't understand why he can't beat Paper Rager.

Rockbiter Weapon.flavorText: This would be real handy if your enemy is made of rock.

Rocket Augmerchant.flavorText: "Don't worry, this won't hurt me a bit."

Rocket Boots.flavorText: This is the happiest moment of Grik's life. We'll miss him.

Rocket Hopper.flavorText: Are y'all gonna ask for THIS one to be orange too!?

Rodent Nest.flavorText: Pig sty? No, this is a rat's nest.

Rokara.flavorText: "Tread carefully, but stand tall, and stand together. For strength and honor!" —Rokara

Rokara, the Valorous.flavorText: As strong-willed and stubborn as her first day in the Horde, Rokara now wielded a weapon that rivaled even her tenacity.

Rolling Fireball.flavorText: Why don't they ever run perpendicular?

Rolling Stone.flavorText: Sadly, the mariachi band it used to play in gathers no más.

Rotface.flavorText: Daddy! I think I made a Legendary!

Rotgill.flavorText: In the summer: Hotgill. Mechanized: Botgill. Everyone else: Notgill.

Rotnest Drake.flavorText: Clean your room, or I'm taking your favorite minion away!

Rotten Rodent.flavorText: It's dead, but it's not a mouse.

Rotting Necromancer.flavorText: You can't spell dredge without D-E-D.

Rowdy Fan.flavorText: "This song is so good, it makes me want to PUNCH SOMEONE IN THE FACE!!"

Royal Librarian.flavorText: Books on how to flip the Auction House are down that way.

Rumble Enthusiast.flavorText: There's always room for one more game in the tavern!

Rumbletusk Shaker.flavorText: Rub a dub dub, three trolls in a tub. And who do you think dey be? Da Shaker, Da Breaker, and Da Undatakah. And all of dem comin' for me.

Rummaging Kobold.flavorText: "Broken longsword is brand new shortsword." - Kobold Proverb

Runaway Blackwing.flavorText: It has been 5 minutes since our last Azeroth Racing League violation.

Rune Dagger.flavorText: Turns out being stabbed makes you more vulnerable to magic.

Rune of the Archmage.flavorText: “It’s not a slot machine! It took YEARS of rigorous studying the intricacies of the universe to unravel the strands of reality. The arcane knowledge alone would enfeeble even the most brilliant of minds. Give it the credence it deserves. It’s a magic slot machine.”

Runed Mithril Rod.flavorText: "Please, I need these greens to disenchant them." —Every Enchanter Ever

Runed Orb.flavorText: The most dangerous Winter Veil ornament.

Runeforge Haunter.flavorText: Don't worry, he'll keep an eye on that for you.

Runeforging.flavorText: I swear the runes are genuine!

Runefueled Golem.flavorText: Hmm, glyph gauge is running low. Better fill up at the next town.

Runi, Time Explorer.flavorText: In the future, Xyrella's daughter would become a hero of time, but Nozdormu needed her now, for this moment.

Runic Adornment.flavorText: Rune, rune on the wall, who's the greenest of them all?

Runic Carvings.flavorText: "That totem was beautiful… and you runed it!"

Runic Egg.flavorText: Oh man! Runic omelettes are the best!

Rush the Stage.flavorText: Left Shark, get to the stage now!

Ruststeed Raider.flavorText: Three-time winner (and sole survivor) of the Crashes of Outland motocross!

Rustsworn Cultist.flavorText: "Rust… I love it. It's all coarse, and rough, and irritating. And it gets everywhere."

Rustsworn Initiate.flavorText: The Rusted Legion's training leaves a little to be desired. He hasn't even had a tetanus shot yet!

Rusty Recycler.flavorText: Ironic. It could recycle others, but not itself.

SECURITY!!.flavorText: Check all of the boxes that contain VENGEANCE to play this card.

SI:7 Agent.flavorText: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities. Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.

SI:7 Assassin.flavorText: You can't keep the streets clean if you're afraid to get your hands dirty.

SI:7 Extortion.flavorText: "It's a dangerous world out there. It'd be a shame if your protection insurance were to suddenly run out…"

SI:7 Infiltrator.flavorText: What will she destroy? It’s a secret!

SI:7 Informant.flavorText: Sitting in a tavern all day and looking scary is hard work, but somebody has to do it.

SI:7 Operative.flavorText: What do you mean you're out of ponies?

SI:7 Skulker.flavorText: Burying bones and calling it skullduggery.

SI:7 Smuggler.flavorText: After a while, Onyxia's regurgitated rats start to taste pretty good.

SN1P-SN4P.flavorText: "It's gonna be snip this, snap that. Bada-snip, bada-snap!"

SP-3Y3-D3R.flavorText: The itsy bitsy spider magnetized onto the water spout.

Sabotage.flavorText: Rogues can't stand it. They know you planned it! They are going to set you straight!

Saboteur.flavorText: Listen all y'all it's a saboteur!

Sabretooth Stalker.flavorText: It's gotten a bit long in the tooth.

Sacrificial Pact.flavorText: This is the reason that Demons never really become friends with Warlocks.

Sacrificial Summoner.flavorText: Summoning will cost you an arm and a brother.

Saddle Up!.flavorText: And then they rode off into the sunset, not knowing they left their stove on.

Saddlemaster.flavorText: Seat covers. Check. Racing stripes. Check. Cupholder. Check.

Safeguard.flavorText: Keep it secret. Keep it safeguarded!

Safety Expert.flavorText: Remember: Always wear your helmet when strapped to a bajillion explosives.

Safety Goggles.flavorText: Remember, always be safe in the lab to mitigate injuries! *painfully snaps goggles onto face*

Safety Inspector.flavorText: "All right, you're good. No sign of safety anywhere."

Saidan the Scarlet.flavorText: An orc mage accidentally kited him all the way from Stratholme.

Saloon Brewmaster.flavorText: Brewmaster Bru brought Barrelbrim bursting barrels of barely brewed barley brew. Barrelbrim bought Bru's barley brew, barring the barrels broken from the brazen brunch brawl.

Salty Dog.flavorText: He's recently recovered from being a "scurvy dog."

Sanc'Azel.flavorText: That castle has some serious drip.

Sanctuary.flavorText: Few quests are completed by cowering under a table.

Sanctum Chandler.flavorText: Has been burning at both ends to keep the place illuminated.

Sanctum Spellbender.flavorText: "I'll take that... and that... aaand that."

Sand Breath.flavorText: After Uldum, EVERYONE had sand breath.

Sand Drudge.flavorText: Loves long walks on the beach, raising the dead, and chocolates.

Sandbox Scoundrel.flavorText: "Really? A bunch of fake plastic gems AGAIN!?"

Sandhoof Waterbearer.flavorText: Used to carrying for his team.

Sandstorm Elemental.flavorText: Doot doot doot doot doot [Pause] Doot doot doot doot doot DEE doot doot doot doot doot!

Sandwasp Queen.flavorText: Oooh, see that wasp! Watch that sting! Dig in the Sandwasp Queen!

Sanguine Depths.flavorText: There may not be any skeletons in the closets at Castle Nathria, but there sure are souls in the basement.

Sanguine Reveler.flavorText: Have some! This drink is to die for!

Sanguine Soldier.flavorText: They just need someone to ouch for them.

Sanitize.flavorText: We were originally going to make a joke about a popular streamer, but one of our designers is a total germaphobe.

Sargeras, the Destroyer.flavorText: Formerly the Defender of the Pantheon, he became disillusioned by his mission and formed the Burning Legion to destroy all life within the universe.

Saronite Shambler.flavorText: They play the best rock music at the saro-nite club.

Saronite Taskmaster.flavorText: Don't even think of asking for time off.

Saruun.flavorText: BORN FROM THE HEAT DEATH OF COLLIDING SUPERNOVAS, SARUUN SEEKS TO INCINERATE ALL THAT WHICH REVOLVES AROUND THEM TO MERE ASHES AND STARDUST!!!! Which is pretty neato!

Sasquawk.flavorText: He makes your last turn this turn. But if you play him next turn, your next turn is this turn. Doing both would make this turn last turn and next turn this turn. Which turn is this next turn last turn?

Sated Threshadon.flavorText: Bet you can't eat just one murloc!

Sathrovarr.flavorText: Just wait until you also find a copy in your pocket. And your desk! And your FRIDGE!!

Satyr Overseer.flavorText: What he lacks in communication skills, he makes up for with highly responsive staffing allocations.

Sauna Regular.flavorText: She's getting that "falls off the bone" tenderness.

Savage Combatant.flavorText: Maybe if you whistle a tune it will soothe him. Yeah... Try that.

Savage Roar.flavorText: What do they roar? Nobody can quite tell, but it sounds like "Elephant Macho Breeze". It's probably not that, though.

Savage Ymirjar.flavorText: When is an Undead door not an Undead door? When it's a(Ymir)jar!

Savagery.flavorText: It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.

Savannah Highmane.flavorText: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

Savory Deviate Delight.flavorText: "Savory" is a creative way to put it.

Saxophone Soloist.flavorText: He used to play to crowds of adoring Murlocs, but 20 years later all that's left is gigs at secluded clubs and regrets. Where did all the time go? His dreams of fame and fortune, snuffed out like the flame of a small candle in a dimly lit bar. Nothing but smoke in the wind.

Sayge, Seer of Darkmoon.flavorText: There are no secrets between us... or refunds.

Scabbs Cutterbutter.flavorText: "Never lie, steal, cheat, or drink. Unless you're compelled to, that is…" —Scabbs Cutterbutter

Scalding Geyser.flavorText: ”Wow, what’s that land formation called?” “It s’cald a Geyser.”

Scale Replica.flavorText: Get it!?! It's because dragons have hides - commonly known as scales - and this is a model of a dragon on a smaller level, also known as a scale. IT'S THE SAME WORD!

Scaled Nightmare.flavorText: I like it because it scales.

Scalelord.flavorText: It's about what they have in common, not what makes them different.

Scalerider.flavorText: Do Re Me Fa So La Spear Throw!

Scaleworm.flavorText: A popular local alternative to bananas.

Scarab Egg.flavorText: They say you can’t make an omelet without AHHH THEY’RE EATING MY FACE!

Scarab Keychain.flavorText: "How do you keep losing your keys!? They couldn't have just gotten up and walked away!"

Scargil.flavorText: Wanna know how he got those scars? So does he.

Scarlet Crusader.flavorText: Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.

Scarlet Purifier.flavorText: The Scarlet Crusade is doing market research to find out if the "Mauve Crusade" would be better received.

Scarlet Subjugator.flavorText: At the Scarlet Monastery, he learned the sacred art of kicking people when they're up.

Scarlet Webweaver.flavorText: Isn't that nice? The spider made the explorer a sleeping bag!

Scavenger's Ingenuity.flavorText: "A beast, barely alive. Gentlemen, we can rebuild it! Make it stronger, faster... spikier."

Scavenging Hyena.flavorText: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything. Even Brussels sprouts.

Scavenging Shivarra.flavorText: Say what you want but finding a matching set of six swords takes commitment.

School Teacher.flavorText: She also tutors 3 Piranha Swarmers on her off hours.

Schooling.flavorText: A group of Piranha are known as a Scholomance.

Scorch.flavorText: The hoof. The hoof. The hoof is on fire.

Scorp-o-matic.flavorText: Back in my day, we had to manually scorp.

Scourge Rager.flavorText: Why's he so mad? Well you'd be mad too if you were created as a joke!

Scourge Tamer.flavorText: He's a hunter AND a gatherer.

Scourge Troll.flavorText: This is where I'd put my Deathrattle - IF I HAD ONE!

Scourgelord Garrosh.flavorText: "You dare to challenge me? Come! Draw your last breath - and then, you are mine."

Scrap Shot.flavorText: Make your foe's armor your fauna's fashion!

Scrapbooking Student.flavorText: "…and this is the time I rode a dinosaur, and this is the time that I helped solve a murder, and this is the time I got corrupted by the Old Gods..."

Scrapsmith.flavorText: Takes the ugly scraps of armor from dead players and combines them into ridiculous looking PVP armor sets.

Screaming Banshee.flavorText: Her singing will be sure to wake you up (wake you up inside).

Screwjank Clunker.flavorText: If it breaks, just kick it a couple of times while yelling "Durn thing!"

Scribbling Stenographer.flavorText: A truly staggering 180 scribbles per minute!

Sea Reaver.flavorText: A little better than Sea Minus Reaver.

Sea Shanty.flavorText: Time for some well-earned arrr and arrr.

Sea Shill.flavorText: She shills shea sells down at the sea shtore.

Seabreeze Chalice.flavorText: If your luck has been particularly poor lately, try the extra salted rim!

Seadevil Stinger.flavorText: Pretty harmless unless you're a Seadevil.

Seafloor Savior.flavorText: "TURTLE PROCURED. ADMINISTRATING BANDAGES AND KISSES. BOO BOO MUST BE ELIMINATED."

Seaforium Bomber.flavorText: Dress for the bomb you want, not the bomb you have.

Seal Fate.flavorText: Firmly press the seal of your fates instead of leaving the flap open.

Seal of Light.flavorText: The walrus of Light restores EIGHT Health.

Seance.flavorText: “The spirits spoke to me.” "What did they say?" "You had lethal two turns ago."

Seascout Operator.flavorText: The Mechafish are actually totally autonomous. We gave her a fake control pad, as a joke.

Seaside Giant.flavorText: Everywhere's the shallow end when you're 88 feet tall.

Seaweed Strike.flavorText: Even as mechs, fish will still end up wrapped in seaweed.

Second-Rate Bruiser.flavorText: He'll be a first-rate bruiser once he gets used to his contacts.

Secret Passage.flavorText: I use this to sneak out at night and do some villainous baking in the kitchen.

Secret Plan.flavorText: The secret is... There is no plan!

Secretkeeper.flavorText: Where is Mankrik’s wife? She’ll never tell.

Secure the Deck.flavorText: "Tied it down, boss. I don't really know why you asked me to do that."

Security Automaton.flavorText: Honestly, I feel less secure when it's around.

Seedcloud Buckler.flavorText: A shield to some, a frisbee to others (mainly dogs).

Seek Guidance.flavorText: Xyrella was looking for spiritual guidance but found deck-building tips instead.

Seeping Oozeling.flavorText: Uh, you might want to get that looked at.

Selective Breeder.flavorText: His ethics are top notch. Just look at that smiling kitty!

Self-Sharpening Sword.flavorText: You no longer have to bring a stack of 2 swords to a test!

Selfish Shellfish.flavorText: Keeps any ancient book it finds all to its shelf.

Selfless Hero.flavorText: "Don't worry about me… I'll just be here... under these tentacles."

Selfless Sidekick.flavorText: "I got a real sense of humility from her when she bashed that quilboar's head in."

Sen'jin Shieldmasta.flavorText: Sen'jin Village is nice, if you like trolls and dust.

Sense Demons.flavorText: Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.

Sensory Deprivation.flavorText: You'll come out a new person.

Serena Bloodfeather.flavorText: She’s really into networking! After all, she’s introduced countless low-level Horde players to the Spirit Healer.

Serenity.flavorText: Ra-den loves teaching yoga on his off-hours.

Sergeant Sally.flavorText: "Who is she? Where did she come from? We don't even have a police force here in Gadgetzan!!" - Mayor Noggenfogger

Serpent Egg.flavorText: These things go from "adorable danger noodle!" to "MY FACE IS MELTING!" all too quickly.

Serpent Ward.flavorText: When snakes get sick, they get sent to the Serpent Ward.

Serpent Wig.flavorText: Legends say that all those who look into her eyes are turned to plush.

Serpentshrine Portal.flavorText: This is why you never flush a three-cost minion.

Serrated Bone Spike.flavorText: Draka, in an attempt to help, threw them a bone.

Servant of Kalimos.flavorText: He's doing his best, but his mom thinks that if he had just applied himself in school Kalimos would be working for HIM.

Servant of Yogg-Saron.flavorText: Yogg-Saron always likes to complain about how he has too many servants and there are too many mouths to feed.

Service Ace.flavorText: No shirt, no shoes, YES service!

Service Bell.flavorText: The bell tolls for us! Waiter, we need more water!

Sesselie of the Fae Court.flavorText: They claim they're from the Fae Court, but that might be a Fae Kout.

Sethekk Veilweaver.flavorText: The Sethekk weren't able to survive this long by being wasteful with their power. Or their wacky hats.

Sewer Crawler.flavorText: His clothing is "ratty" in more ways than one.

Shade of Naxxramas.flavorText: I would've thought the giant, floating necropolis that is Naxxramas would cast a bigger shadow.

Shadehound.flavorText: This Shadehound wasn't just a good boy. He was the best.

Shadestone Skulker.flavorText: Sharing is caring - and they don't care.

Shado-Pan Rider.flavorText: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.

Shadow Ascendant.flavorText: When you're at the bottom, there's nowhere to ascend, but up.

Shadow Bolt.flavorText: It’s a Bolt. It's made out of Shadow. What more do you need to know!

Shadow Chord: Distort.flavorText: For some unknown reason, using distortion intentionally in your music will attract hundreds of geckos to your location.

Shadow Clone.flavorText: "You thought you were attacking face, but it was me! You!"

Shadow Council.flavorText: Why is everybody in Outland replacing their hands?!

Shadow Essence.flavorText: Difficult to bottle up and sell. But it packs a punch.

Shadow Hunter Vol'jin.flavorText: You wouldn’t see this swap-meet on the Zandalari Roadshow.

Shadow Madness.flavorText: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.

Shadow Sculptor.flavorText: Carving out new territory in the realm of shadow puppetry.

Shadow Sensei.flavorText: He used to be Aya's tutor, but she fired him for bugging her too much.

Shadow Strike.flavorText: It's like a backstab, only from the front. And with two more stabs.

Shadow Suffusion.flavorText: Be honest - you had to look up what that means.

Shadow Visions.flavorText: This one’s a bird. And here’s a bunny!

Shadow Waltz.flavorText: They're dancing to one of Rin's demonic symphonies. Her music might not be famous now, but just you wait!

Shadow Word: Death.flavorText: If you miss, it leaves a lightning-bolt-shaped scar on your target.

Shadow Word: Devour.flavorText: Devouring souls is like a buffet. You have to take a little bit of everything.

Shadow Word: Forbid.flavorText: At last, Priest has no more weaknesses.

Shadow Word: Horror.flavorText: It's more succinct than "Shadow Word: Suck Into Vortex."

Shadow Word: Pain.flavorText: A step up from a spell cast by many beginning acolytes: "Shadow Word: Annoy".

Shadow Word: Ruin.flavorText: Discovered by a worgen priest after a giant spilled a drink on her new white robes.

Shadow Word: Steal.flavorText: Anduin will literally take your stuff and say it's a Shadow Word.

Shadow Word: Undeath.flavorText: We like to call it FUNdeath here!

Shadow of Demise.flavorText: Each time you cast a spell, transform this into a copy of its flavor text.

Shadowblade Slinger.flavorText: Throwing knives isn’t easy for a warlock. It’s quite painful, in fact.

Shadowbomber.flavorText: Shadowbomber does her job, but she's kind of phoning it in at this point.

Shadowborn.flavorText: You merely adopted the shadows; I was born in them!

Shadowboxer.flavorText: Punching is its primary function. Also, its secondary function.

Shadowcaster.flavorText: I mean, it's not creepy if you ASK before you steal their shadow to make a small replica of them to keep on your shelf.

Shadowcloth Needle.flavorText: Makes light of the darkest repair jobs.

Shadowcrafter Scabbs.flavorText: Sneaking behind enemy lines isn't so different from being a line cook. People are hostile, something's on fire, and your only hope is to get out of there with all your fingers.

Shadowed Spirit.flavorText: They can't all be grim grinning ghosts.

Shadowfiend.flavorText: Hopes to be promoted to "Shadowfriend" someday.

Shadowflame.flavorText: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!

Shadowform.flavorText: If a bright light shines on a priest in Shadowform… do they cast a shadow?

Shadowhoof Slayer.flavorText: Was a humble Elven Archer before Sargeras got to him.

Shadowjeweler Hanar.flavorText: What is a shadowjeweler? A miserable little pile of secrets.

Shadowlight Scholar.flavorText: Imagine having the power of soul magic and using it as a reading light.

Shadowreaper Anduin.flavorText: "I will tell you what Velen never taught me. Whosoever stands before the Light… inevitably casts a shadow."

Shadowstep.flavorText: Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance. Crowds love it.

Shadowtouched Kvaldir.flavorText: Four out of five deck doctors say this works great with Reno Jackson!

Shadowy Figure.flavorText: Terrible at shadow puppets: “This is… a tentacle! And this is… two tentacles!”

Shady Bartender.flavorText: One sin and tonic, coming right up.

Shady Dealer.flavorText: I have great deal for you... for 4 damage to your face!

Shaku, the Collector.flavorText: Aya even staged an intervention once, but Shaku still insists that he is not a hoarder.

Shaky Zipgunner.flavorText: The Grimy Goons can get you any weapon you want but if you want it to not explode you gotta pay extra.

Shale Spider.flavorText: The 2nd member of the VERY exclusive Is-Called-A-Spider-But-Isn't-A-Beast Club.

Shallow Gravedigger.flavorText: It's hard to put them six feet under when you're three feet tall.

Shambling Chow.flavorText: And step, and shamble, and step, and flip the hair!

Shan'do Wildclaw.flavorText: She holds both an academic post and a scratching post.

Shard of the Naaru.flavorText: Fell from the sky, huh? I'll give you ten gold.

Shark Puncher.flavorText: "And remember, if you come face-to-face with a shark, punch it in the nose." "Yes. Me punch you in nose with shark." "No, th- OW!"

Sharkfin Fan.flavorText: His taste in soup is criminal.

Sharp Shipment.flavorText: Pre-check is amazing these days. New rules say you don't have to take off your shoes, helmet, or daggers!

Sharp-Eyed Seeker.flavorText: If you give it treats, it will give you shiny objects!

Shattered Reflections.flavorText: Get mad at your mirror once, see Shattered Reflections forever :(

Shattered Sun Cleric.flavorText: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!

Shattering Blast.flavorText: Let's be honest, they weren't going to unfreeze anyway.

Shattershambler.flavorText: Someone didn’t realize the ‘cold, black heart’ thing was supposed to be a metaphor.

Shatterskin Gargoyle.flavorText: Don't worry, this one's just a statue.

Sheldras Moontree.flavorText: Sheldras really went to the park for his pilgrimage.

Shell Game.flavorText: I thiiink… It's under all three of 'em!

Shellshifter.flavorText: Master of the Three Shell Monte.

Shenanigans.flavorText: It's not personal, it's just monkey business.

Sheriff Barrelbrim.flavorText: Is that Sheriff Barrelbrim, owner of the Badlands Barrelbuilding?

Shield Block.flavorText: Shields were invented because Face Block is USELESS.

Shield Shatter.flavorText: "Is the shield being shattered or doing the shattering?" "Yes."

Shield Slam.flavorText: "What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?" - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9

Shield of Askara.flavorText: One can never have too many shields.

Shield of Galakrond.flavorText: Realistically, she's the shield for Galakrond's big toe.

Shield of Honor.flavorText: "Sir, this shield would've been more helpful last turn!"

Shieldbearer.flavorText: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game?? This is no easy job.

Shieldbreaker.flavorText: Can also break up fights, relationships, and unions.

Shielded Minibot.flavorText: He chooses to believe what he is programmed to believe!

Shieldmaiden.flavorText: She has three shieldbearers in her party to supply her with back ups when she gets low on durability.

Shifter Zerus.flavorText: It's like being able to play with THREE angry chickens!

Shifting Scroll.flavorText: Next turn, this is going to be AMAZING.

Shifting Shade.flavorText: Yeah, it's cooler in the shade, but you're also more likely to get JACKED.

Shifty Sophomore.flavorText: Experienced enough to do crimes, inexperienced enough to be super obvious about it.

Shimmer Shot.flavorText: I hope I don't jinx the outcome.

Shimmerfly.flavorText: Plenty of buzz around this card.

Shimmering Courser.flavorText: A courser is a courser of course, of course, she's more of a unicorn than a horse...

Shimmering Sunfish.flavorText: Just keep shimmering, just keep shimmering.

Shimmering Tempest.flavorText: HATES being summoned for Kirin Tor party lighting.

Shining Sentinel.flavorText: OMG, I FINALLY GOT A SHINING SENTINEL AFTER 3 PHASES AND 8192 RESETS!!!!!

Ship's Cannon.flavorText: If you hear someone yell, "Cannonball!" you're about to get wet. Or crushed.

Ship's Chirurgeon.flavorText: Knows the answer to every medical question except how to pronounce his name.

Shirvallah, the Tiger.flavorText: On bended knee Thekal placed his weapon upon Shirvallah’s altar, whereupon she slowly knocked it off with her paw.

Shiver Their Timbers!.flavorText: Who knew there was overlap between pirates and lumberjacks?

Shivering Sorceress.flavorText: Remember to use your sick days wisely.

Shock Hopper.flavorText: Who is shocked about a frog hopping?

Shockspitter.flavorText: That blue raspberry candy was very sour.

Shoplifter Goldbeard.flavorText: "Arr, this plunder be great for Cap'n Fourteeth's baby shower!"

Shoulder Check.flavorText: One... two... yeah, all present and correct.

Showdown!.flavorText: An epic confrontation between the outlaws and the in-laws.

Shriek.flavorText: The first warning sign of an oncoming warlock temper tantrum.

Shrieking Shroom.flavorText: Auditioning for the next Fungal Idol.

Shrink Ray.flavorText: Actually works by enlarging the rest of the world.

Shrinkmeister.flavorText: After the debacle of the Gnomish World Enlarger, gnomes are wary of size-changing inventions.

Shroomscavate.flavorText: As Globb shroominated on his situation, toiling endlessly in the mushroom mines, he came to the startling realization. His boss wasn't a very fun guy.

Shu'ma.flavorText: How to tell your mother to go away.

Shudderblock.flavorText: Beware the hinges that pinch, the scales that splinter!

Shudderwock.flavorText: Beware the Shudderwock, my son. We're fresh out of vorpal daggers.

Siegebreaker.flavorText: Has a side hustle as a siegebroker.

Sif.flavorText: She is Sif. He is Malygos. They are not the same person. They may have similar spell damage, they may have similar colors but they are different nonetheless.

Sightless Magistrate.flavorText: Does "Justice is Blind" still apply with Spectral Sight?

Sightless Watcher.flavorText: What he lacks in sight, he makes up for in sleight-of-tentacle tricks.

Sigil of Alacrity.flavorText: Red means stop. Purple means GO REALLY FAST.

Sigil of Flame.flavorText: "Huh, it reads F-I-R-E. Wonder what that means?"

Sigil of Summoning.flavorText: Look, summoning ain’t exactly a science. Sometimes it takes a turn.

Sigil of Time.flavorText: Sigil of Right A Down Right A Down.

Silas Darkmoon.flavorText: "You might remember me from such attractions as 'Being Shot out of a Cannon' or 'That Carousel Ate My Friend.'"

Silence.flavorText: Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.

Silent Knight.flavorText: He used to be a librarian. Old habits die hard.

Silithid Swarmer.flavorText: If your hero doesn't attack, it's just "Silithid Loner".

Silk Stitching.flavorText: The slogan of their very exclusive sewing club is "You can't stitch with us."

Siltfin Spiritwalker.flavorText: The elements respond to anyone who calls them for a worthy cause, even if you call them by yelling, "MRGHRGLGLGL!"

Silver Hand Knight.flavorText: It's good to be a knight. Less so to be one's squire.

Silver Hand Regent.flavorText: The Silver Hand is the best paladin organization. The Argent Crusaders are super jealous.

Silver Sword.flavorText: Silver’s malleability limits its utility as an edged weapon. On the other hand... SHINY!

Silver Vanguard.flavorText: Float like a Faerie Dragon, sting like a Hivequeen.

Silverback Patriarch.flavorText: He likes to act like he's in charge, but the silverback matriarch actually runs things.

Silverfury Stalwart.flavorText: Don't strike until you see the whites of their teeth.

Silverleaf Poison.flavorText: Kazakus has taken to a more direct approach in recent times.

Silvermoon Arcanist.flavorText: This turn only, I'm something of an Arcanist myself.

Silvermoon Brochure.flavorText: It's lovely to visit this time of year. Just ignore that enormous scarred area outside.

Silvermoon Guardian.flavorText: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…

Silvermoon Portal.flavorText: What's Millhouse Manastorm doing in Silvermoon?

Silvermoon Sentinel.flavorText: I spent 8 mana polishing this shield, PLEASE don't make me bash you with it.

Silverware Golem.flavorText: From the secret research labs of the Swiss Army.

Simulacrum.flavorText: It's like déjà vu, times two.

Sindragosa.flavorText: "I recognize your effort but I think your magic still has room for improvement." - Sindragosa after taking a class on giving constructive feedback.

Sinfueled Golem.flavorText: That poor golem is going to be stuck as a guard forever. He can never get a head!

Sinful Sous Chef.flavorText: If this dinner party goes well, she thinks she has a good shot at being on Fel's Kitchen.

Sing-Along Buddy.flavorText: One of the buttons makes you sound JUST like Ragnaros. BY FIRE BE HEARD!

Sinister Deal.flavorText: "So, what's in the sack?" "Something... sinister." "Okay, it's a deal."

Sinister Soulcage.flavorText: Also a pretty neat night light!

Sinister Strike.flavorText: There's something about this strike that just feels off. Sinister, even.

Sinrunner.flavorText: Blanchy was said to be an affectionate and well-behaved horse in life. How she ended up in Revendreth? We're too afraid to ask.

Sinstone Graveyard.flavorText: A graveyard in the realm of the dead; a bit redundant, don't you think?

Sinstone Totem.flavorText: This one's heavier than the wooden totems. Mostly from the weight of your sins.

Siphon Mana.flavorText: Why spend mine when I can take yours?

Siphon Soul.flavorText: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul. You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.

Sir Finley Mrrgglton.flavorText: In addition to fluent Common, he also speaks fourteen dialects of 'mrgl'.

Sir Finley of the Sands.flavorText: "The sands shall be my sea! And this scarab shall be my, er, strange and wriggly boat!"

Sir Finley, Sea Guide.flavorText: "No need to worry, ol' chums, I have the map right here. It says to continue going straight down!"

Sir Finley, the Intrepid.flavorText: And exactly how does Finley turn everyone into a murloc?

Sira'kess Cultist.flavorText: "Sira'kess, she's the best! Puts her followers to the test.

Sire Denathrius.flavorText: History has a way of altering villains so that we can no longer see ourselves in them. Unfortunately for the Venthyr, they all look like Sire Denathrius.

Siren Song.flavorText: "Sing along if you know the lyrics! -- WEEWOOWEEWOO!"

Skarr, the Catastrophe.flavorText: We're not in Karazhan anymore, Reno.

Skelemancer.flavorText: What do you mean there's no such thing as "Skelemancy?" But "Dinomancy" is ok?
