Skeletal Dragon.flavorText: I wish to complain about this dragon what I purchased not half an hour ago from this very boutique.

Skeletal Sidekick.flavorText: He's got your back. And your arm.

Skeleton Crew.flavorText: They don't sweat, breathe or need lit candles... what more could you ask?

Skeram Cultist.flavorText: Just before he comes into play, there is an AWESOME training montage with C'Thun.

Sketch Artist.flavorText: Never ask an artist how many pieces they've finished.

Sketchy Information.flavorText: "I trust the Forsaken as far as I can smell them. Which, I guess is actually pretty far."

Sketchy Stranger.flavorText: More of a 'Painted Stranger' if you ask me.

Skulking Geist.flavorText: It's as though a million Jade Idols cried out, and were suddenly silenced.

Skull of Gul'dan.flavorText: A fellow of evil possessed, of most devious shadow. He hath turned on his kin a thousand times, and now, how abhorred in all imagination he is!

Sky Claw.flavorText: Carefully engineered to never grab the Mimiron plush toy.

Sky Mother Aviana.flavorText: It's a bird! It's a plane! It's 10 copies of Leeroy Jenkins!

Sky Raider.flavorText: Maybe he should've hatched a plan that could actually carry booty back too.

Skybarge.flavorText: It's more of a ship-gun than a gunship.

Skycap'n Kragg.flavorText: What's more boss than riding a parrot with a jawbone for a shoulderpad while wielding a giant hook-lance-thing and wearing a pirate hat? NOTHING.

Skydiving Instructor.flavorText: "Is it dangerous?" "For me? Not at all. Now jump!"

Skyfin.flavorText: "Do you want to be a murloc or a dragon?" "Yes."

Skyvateer.flavorText: When you go without fruits in an airship, you get a nasty case of skyvy.

Slagmaw the Slumbering.flavorText: You delved too greedily and too deep. You know what they awoke in the darkness of the Badlands: Rush and Taunt.

Slam.flavorText: "Dun da dun, dun da dun": if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.

Sleep with the Fishes.flavorText: If you're sleeping with the fishes, we highly suggest not bringing an electric blanket.

Sleepy Dragon.flavorText: Local villagers call her "Naps Under the Mountain."

Sleepy Resident.flavorText: Shouldn’t this be a Priest card?

Sleet Skater.flavorText: How do you do, fellow Ice Elementals?

Slimescale Diver.flavorText: You try putting on a wetsuit with scales.

Slithering Deathscale.flavorText: Colossal minions know her better as Slithering Damagescale.

Sludge Belcher.flavorText: DO NOT GIVE HIM A ROOT BEER.

Sludge Slurper.flavorText: You can't stop slurping this delicious sludge!

Small-Time Buccaneer.flavorText: "Oh, I'm not serious about it. I only pirate on the weekends."

Small-Time Recruits.flavorText: Now we know why they wear tiny watches.

Smelt.flavorText: Due to his heightened olfactory system, Kha'zgoroth is cursed with always being the one that dealt it.

Smothering Starfish.flavorText: Is a sucker for small talk.

Smug Senior.flavorText: You want to see something funny? Go visit him in five years.

Smuggler's Crate.flavorText: Are you sure these are the crates that are supposed to go to the Gadgetzan petting zoo?

Smuggler's Run.flavorText: One of the most famous busts in Gadgetzan’s history happened on Smuggler’s Run, where Sergeant Sally apprehended a cadre of Grimy Goons transporting a massive number of illegal fish heads.

Snack Run.flavorText: "I'll have two monster churros, a combo box of Yogg-Saron, and one of those turkey legs that ate the Silver Hand Recruit."

Snake Eyes.flavorText: Hey, put ALL of your hands on the table!

Snake Oil Seller.flavorText: This oil is absolutely essential to your gameplan.

Snake Trap.flavorText: Why did it have to be snakes?

Snakebite.flavorText: Don't look her in the eyes or you'll turn to ROCK!

Snap Freeze.flavorText: Lick the ice block. I triple-double-dog-dare-you.

Snapdragon.flavorText: Good synergy with Crackledragon, not so much with Popdragon.

Snatch and Grab.flavorText: Snatch grabbed the snacks and Grab snatched the grub. The perfect crime.

Sneaky Delinquent.flavorText: All right, now open your lid and say "Ahh!"

Sneaky Devil.flavorText: The result of a tragic accident involving a Defias Thug, a Wand of Polymorph, and a bundle of Fel Lotus.

Sneaky Scout.flavorText: Do you know what they call Scouts that aren't sneaky? Target practice.

Sneaky Snakes.flavorText: You're a sneaky lil snake, aren'tcha?

Sneed's Old Shredder.flavorText: When Sneed was defeated in the Deadmines, his shredder was sold at auction to an anonymous buyer. (Probably Hogger.)

Snipe.flavorText: A great sniper hits the spot. Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.

Snoozin' Zookeeper.flavorText: You snooze, you lose (track of a very large and hungry panther).

Snow Shredder.flavorText: "Yeah dude, snowboarding is like, totally safe. I've only ever been injured once."

Snowball Fight!.flavorText: Woahwoahwoah, we said no friendly fire!

Snowblind Harpy.flavorText: Not snowblind; she can spot a level 51 noob over 40 yards away.

Snowchugger.flavorText: Do the slow chant when he waddles by: "Chug! Chug! Chug!"

Snowed In.flavorText: “What do you mean school isn’t cancelled?! It’s a snow day!”

Snowfall Guardian.flavorText: You’re finally awake! That fall looked really bad. Demon Hunters? Mercenaries? What are you talking about? Come on, I just unpacked a Golden Moorabi, let’s go build a Freeze Shaman deck.

Snowflipper Penguin.flavorText: On land, a group of penguins is called a "waddle."

Snowfury Giant.flavorText: This minion goes all the way to 11!

Snuggle Teddy.flavorText: Someone really put their heart into making this.

Sock Puppet Slitherspear.flavorText: The right hand of Queen Azshara is Lady Vashj. This is her left hand.

Soggoth the Slitherer.flavorText: Don't tell Soggoth, but in the future he gets totally owned by the Master's Glaive and his skull becomes a tourist attraction.

Solar Eclipse.flavorText: When the Moon is between the Sun and the Azeroth.

Solar Flare.flavorText: Saruun is quite the dancer. Their pirouette is deadly.

Soldier's Caravan.flavorText: It’s a clown car… for JUSTICE!

Solemn Vigil.flavorText: Each year, folk gather in front of Blackrock Mountain to mourn those who were mind-controlled into the lava.

Son of Hodir.flavorText: You look dehydrated, drink some water! Come on, chug! Chug! Chug! Chug!

Sonya Shadowdancer.flavorText: Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like a 1/1 is watching.

Soot Spewer.flavorText: The inventor of the goblin shredder is involved in several patent disputes with the inventor of the soot spewer.

Soothsayer's Caravan.flavorText: With tusks like those, you might call her a "Toothsayer."

Sorcerer's Apprentice.flavorText: Apprentices are great for bossing around. "Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee! Make that a mana coffee!"

Sorcerer's Gambit.flavorText: After "the incident," the Stockades really had to reevaluate their anti-mage protocols.

Sorcerous Substitute.flavorText: This substitute's substitution is a dangerous institution.

Soul Barrage.flavorText: Works especially well on jazz musicians.

Soul Cleave.flavorText: The way to a demon's soul is through its stomach.

Soul Infusion.flavorText: People called him a soulless monster. We're not sure this is better.

Soul Rend.flavorText: About as close to feeling guilt as a warlock's ever going to get.

Soul Seeker.flavorText: The Soul Seeker's job is to look for a snitch.

Soul Shear.flavorText: "Just a little off the sides please."

Soul Split.flavorText: Spoiler: they're both the evil twin.

Soulbound Ashtongue.flavorText: He claims to be "soulbound," but I just think he's clingy.

Soulbound Spire.flavorText: Ah yes, EVERY Starship needs a fragile obelisk full of dead people!

Soulburner Varia.flavorText: Captain's Log. 8/11/2023 There are 60 minutes remaining until the Flavor Text is due. It is Friday at 4 PM. We are out of stamina and ideas. Please send funnies, punnies, quippies, or your finest hahas. - The Design Team

Soulciologist Malicia.flavorText: If you value your life, don't call it a "soft science."

Souleater's Scythe.flavorText: Would you like those souls for here or to-go?

Soulfire.flavorText: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.

Soulfreeze.flavorText: An effective way to freeze someone's soul is to just freeze their body.

Soulshard Lapidary.flavorText: Also known as a soul sequincer.

Soulstealer.flavorText: "Wanna see what destruction looks like? Here it is in undead form - it's your boy Soulstealer!"

Sound the Bells!.flavorText: Weirdly, the bells stop ringing after 5.

Soup Vendor.flavorText: Fresh from the floor of the arena!

South Coast Chieftain.flavorText: It got the conch. You let it speak!

Southsea Captain.flavorText: When he saves enough plunder, he's going to commission an enormous captain's hat. He has hat envy.

Southsea Deckhand.flavorText: Pirates are into this new fad called "Planking".

Southsea Scoundrel.flavorText: "…and here we see the Southsea Scoundrel in their natural habitat: a den of scum and villainy."

Southsea Squidface.flavorText: Quick! Before I drown! Let me sharpen your sword for you.

Spammy Arcanist.flavorText: You don't have to jump while spamming, but it’s more fun that way.

Spark Drill.flavorText: Preferred weapon of Dr. Boom's orthodontist.

Spawn of Deathwing.flavorText: Aww, who’s the most dangerous threat to the world? You are!

Spawn of N'Zoth.flavorText: Who's a cute widdle N'Zoth? You are! Yes you are! Yes you're the cutest widdle N'Zoth in the whole world!!!

Spawn of Shadows.flavorText: What did you expect to happen? He's a Spawn. Of Shadows.

Spawnpool Forager.flavorText: Putting food on the table requires persistence, enthusiasm, and the finest murloc Gloves of Foraging.

Speaker Gidra.flavorText: If a teacher lectures in a forest, does she even make a sound?

Specimen Claw.flavorText: Great at catching alien species. Not so much their plushies.

Spectral Cutlass.flavorText: So sharp it can cut through a spectral tomato!

Spectral Knight.flavorText: What do Faerie Dragons and Spectral Knights have in common? They both love pasta!

Spectral Pillager.flavorText: It turns out you CAN take it with you.

Spectral Sight.flavorText: "Pick a card, any card! Preferably the left- or right-most card."

Spectral Trainee.flavorText: After graduating at the top of her class from Scholomance, she was granted an eternal scholarship to study abroad in Naxxramas.

Spellbender.flavorText: While it's fun to intercept enemy lightning bolts, a spellbender much prefers to intercept opposing Marks of the Wild. It just feels meaner. And blood elves... well, they're a little mean.

Spellbook Binder.flavorText: You're bound to love his work!

Spellbreaker.flavorText: Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders. The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.

Spellcoiler.flavorText: "Look, I know plenty of spells. I just need to see one first is all."

Spellslinger.flavorText: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about. Who can say?

Spellward Jeweler.flavorText: The fanciest possible way of distracting enemies with shiny things.

Spellweaver.flavorText: Spells offer twice the moisture wicking of cotton.

Spellzerker.flavorText: But don’t ask her to use it in a sentence.

Sphere of Sapience.flavorText: This is what it sounds like when spheres scry.

Spice Bread Baker.flavorText: The secret ingredient is love. And a LOT of butter.

Spider Bomb.flavorText: Wrecks a dude, any size. Catches thieves, eats those guys. Look out! Here comes a Spider Bomb!

Spider Tank.flavorText: "What if we put guns on it?" -Fizzblitz, staring at the spider-transportation-machine

Spiked Hogrider.flavorText: Did you know the Hogchoppers compete every year at the Mirage Raceway? They do. It's a real group.

Spiked Wheel.flavorText: Great for driving, terrible for steering.

Spirit Alpha.flavorText: Just like in the natural world, the alpha of the species is bright purple.

Spirit Bomb.flavorText: Might take a few episodes to power up.

Spirit Claws.flavorText: They'll be MUCH easier to use once they add the spiritthumb.

Spirit Echo.flavorText: I guess you can say they’re… “soul survivors.”

Spirit Healer.flavorText: "You again? What did I tell you about trying to fight ALL the quilboars."

Spirit Jailer.flavorText: "Sure, they're in your deck, but the mind is like, the REAL prison."

Spirit Lash.flavorText: We've got spirit, yes we do! We've got spirit, stolen from you!

Spirit Mount.flavorText: Bru'kan said his spirit would always be with us. He failed to mention that his raptor’s would be too.

Spirit Peddler.flavorText: *facepalm* I asked for an art piece of a ghost on a bicycle...

Spirit Poacher.flavorText: Always poach from your local spirit shelter.

Spirit of the Badlands.flavorText: That's the spirit! Of the Badlands.

Spirit of the Bat.flavorText: Nah nah nah nah, nah nah nah nah, nah nah nah nah, nah nah nah nah

Spirit of the Dead.flavorText: Just because you’re dead doesn’t mean you’re off the team.

Spirit of the Dragonhawk.flavorText: Dragonhawks aren’t known for their accuracy.

Spirit of the Lynx.flavorText: Much of this shrine’s power lies in the can-opener noise it makes.

Spirit of the Raptor.flavorText: “Loti! LOTI! Drop it. Drop it Loti! Down! Down Loti!”

Spirit of the Rhino.flavorText: Where did they get this preposterous hypothesis?

Spirit of the Shark.flavorText: It has Stealth, but its ominous theme music keeps giving it away.

Spirit of the Tides.flavorText: Cleans the ocean better than any store-brand competitor - guaranteed or your Mana back!

Spirit of the Tiger.flavorText: Less of a cantrip and more of a cat-nip.

Spiritsinger Umbra.flavorText: She sees the fate of anyone she meets, but it's always the same: dinosaur attack.

Spiteful Smith.flavorText: She'll craft you a sword, but you'll need to bring her 5 Steel Ingots, 3 Motes of Earth, and the scalp of her last customer.

Spiteful Summoner.flavorText: Sometimes she'll summon a Doomsayer. Out of spite.

Spitting Camel.flavorText: Were you expectorating another bad pun?

Splendiferous Whizbang.flavorText: After his work at Boomsday Labs, he's taken what Dr. Boom taught him and applied it to the most important inventions of all - TOYS!!!

Splintergraft.flavorText: We're going to need some bigger tweezers.

Splish-Splash Whelp.flavorText: Little Whelpy, you're the one You make Mana lots of fun

Splitting Axe.flavorText: The ancient shaman chant, "Control Axe, Control Vee."

Splitting Festeroot.flavorText: No use crying over split Festeroot,

Splitting Image.flavorText: Sometimes you get punched so hard they see double.

Splitting Spacerock.flavorText: Space rock. *pew* Spa ce ro ck. *pew* S p a c e r o c k .

Spore Empress Moldara.flavorText: Sorry for not explaining the Spores in the textbox. We just didn't have that mushroom.

Spot the Difference.flavorText: Ah, I see now! One of them is a picture of a Chillwind Yeti, and the other is a Blood Elf.

Spotlight.flavorText: Everyone's eyes are on you! Well, they're also looking at the giant Elemental that we're using as a spotlight, but mainly at you!

Spreading Madness.flavorText: Most citizens of Darkshire wear those surgical masks to prevent spreading Madness to tourists.

Spreading Plague.flavorText: In the past, plagues were spread by mice or fleas. These days they're spread by elves.

Spring the Trap.flavorText: Talk about starting off on the wrong foot.

Springpaw.flavorText: The terrible thing about lynxes is lynxes are terrible things. Their teeth are made out of biting, their paws are made out of springs!

Spurfang.flavorText: He's always smiling… Not by choice, but because it hurts to close his mouth.

Spymistress.flavorText: Spies in Outland must blend into the environment. That means hot-pink gear and bright green hair. It’s a weird place.

Squallhunter.flavorText: "Oh, the weather outside is frightful… But Squallhunter's so delightful! And since we've gone down this road--overload, overload, overload!"

Squashling.flavorText: Everyone hail to the squashling song!

Squirming Tentacle.flavorText: Yeah, I think we can agree that killing the squirming tentacle first is a good idea.

Stablemaster.flavorText: Takes way better care of her pets than her brother, Unstablemaster.

Staff of the Primus.flavorText: THE PRIMUS, RULER OF MALDRAXXUS, MASTER STRATEGIST, AND wielder of toothpicks!

Stage Hand.flavorText: Holds everything himself because people wouldn't stop touching the prop table.

Stalagg.flavorText: Stalagg want to write own flavor text. "STALAGG AWESOME!"

Stalwart Avenger.flavorText: A good defense is a good offense which is a good defense which is a good offense which is a good defense which is a good offense which is a good defense which is a good offense which is a good defense which is a good offense which is a good defense which is a good offense which is a good defense which is a good offense which is a good defense which is a good offense!

Stampede.flavorText: Many hunters long for the pitter-patter of enormous feet.

Stampeding Kodo.flavorText: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.

Stampeding Roar.flavorText: The Gurubashi Arena has an extremely permissive policy on pets in the workplace.

Stand Against Darkness.flavorText: Or if you're too tired, you can just kind of lean against the darkness.

Star Aligner.flavorText: "You're a Sagittarius? Me too! Just gimme a sec."

Star Power.flavorText: Five of the spectators were star-struck.

Star Student Stelina.flavorText: Cheating is just using your resources wisely.

Star Vulpera.flavorText: He was a star before he even flew his first ship.

Starfall.flavorText: Is the sky falling? Yes. Yes it is.

Starfire.flavorText: Balance is important to druids. This card is perfectly balanced.

Stargazing.flavorText: See those dots up there? Those are called "stars." Except for that one. That's called an "airplane."

Starlight Groove.flavorText: In space, no one can hear you groove.

Starlight Wanderer.flavorText: Not all who wander are lost, but some most definitely are and could really use directions right about now.

Starlight Whelp.flavorText: Starlight, star bright, first whelp I see tonight.

Starscale Constellar.flavorText: You'll understand how to best make use of its effect once you connect the dots.

Starshooter.flavorText: Shoot for the stars! And if you miss, just don't hit me.

Starstrung Bow.flavorText: Shoot for the stars, but if you miss, aim for the enemy hero.

Starving Buzzard.flavorText: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.

Static Waveform.flavorText: LET ME SEE YOU MAKE SOME NOISE!!!

Stealer of Souls.flavorText: The tooth fairy gig didn't work out.

Steam Guardian.flavorText: Its boiling steam and erupting magma serve as a pretty good form of 2-Factor Authentication.

Steam Surger.flavorText: Explorers nicknamed him the Teapot Elemental.

Steamcleaner.flavorText: Business is slow since the anima shortage began. Things just don't get stained like they used to!

Steamwheedle Sniper.flavorText: Goblins seldom have the patience for sniping. Most prefer lobbing explosives.

Steel Beetle.flavorText: Steel you can trust—fashioned from the husk of an over-sized creepy-crawly.

Steeldancer.flavorText: Pretty powerful if you blade your cards right.

Stegodon.flavorText: Level 40 Tortollan Paladins quest to tame a Stegodon. There are no level 41 Tortollan Paladins.

Steward of Darkshire.flavorText: Turns out divine shields are way cheaper if you buy in bulk.

Steward of Scrolls.flavorText: Oh dang it, I spilled ink elemental all over my essay!

Stewart the Steward.flavorText: How many bites does it take to get the center of an hors d'oeuvre?

Stick Up.flavorText: Dude, Velarok, give me a minute to play my turn, the rope's burning!

Sticky Situation.flavorText: "Now this is what I'd call..." "...just shut up."

Stiltstepper.flavorText: Circus school was tough, sometimes you had to step on people to make it to the top.

Stitched Creation.flavorText: To defend Naxxramas from the oncoming adventurers, the Scourge created a monstrosity the world had never seen before: an abomination wearing clothes!!

Stitched Tracker.flavorText: He's just exercising his right to bear arms.

Stockades Guard.flavorText: "You there! Defend this prison with your life. It's my break."

Stockades Prisoner.flavorText: She was arrested for lockpicking. Her imprisonment was not well thought out.

Stolen Goods.flavorText: It fell off a kodo, I promise!

Stone Drake.flavorText: "I am the great Stone Drake - good morning!"

Stone Sentinel.flavorText: He and his friends just want to rock out.

Stoneborn General.flavorText: Leads with an iron fist and a stony demeanor.

Stoneheart King.flavorText: I, too, am a king at playing Heart Stone.

Stonehearth Vindicator.flavorText: “True strength comes from within your deck” is a whole lot less inspiring.

Stonehill Defender.flavorText: Briefly tried stand-up comedy under the name "Stonehill Offender", but turtles are just too thin-skinned.

Stonemaul Anchorman.flavorText: "Brug will read anything you put on the parchment prompter. Anything."

Stoneskin Armorer.flavorText: Pretty sensitive for someone made of thick skin.

Stoneskin Basilisk.flavorText: He got that way from looking into a mirror.

Stonesplinter Trogg.flavorText: The only thing worse than smelling troggs is listening to their poetry.

Storm Chaser.flavorText: Best drank after a stiff gale.

Storm Giant.flavorText: Storm Giant, Frost Giant, Molten Giant... I want Fair-weather and Sunshine Giant!

Storm's Wrath.flavorText: How many dragons does it take to destroy a hot air balloon? One, two, three, CRUNCH!

Stormcrack.flavorText: WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE PURPLE BALL OF LIGHTNING

Stormhammer.flavorText: It brings the storm before the calm.

Stormpike Aid Station.flavorText: Known by some as the “Stormpike Naptime Lounge.”

Stormpike Battle Ram.flavorText: Baa ram ewe! To your dwarves, your beard, Stormpike clan be true!

Stormpike Commando.flavorText: The Stormpike Commandos are demolition experts. They also bake a mean cupcake.

Stormpike Marshal.flavorText: The Stormpike have a very direct take on life insurance.

Stormpike Quartermaster.flavorText: Frozen funnel cakes taste just like ice cream, if you pretend real hard.

Stormwind Avenger.flavorText: "I swear if you heal me I will DPS."

Stormwind Champion.flavorText: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.

Stormwind Freebooter.flavorText: "Just don't stab the ankles! I want his boots!"

Stormwind Knight.flavorText: They're still embarrassed about "The Deathwing Incident".

Stormwind Piper.flavorText: Throws crazy parties with the Rat King—except when it's raining.

Stowaway.flavorText: Cut him a break. Even economy class tickets are pretty expensive these days.

Stranded Spaceman.flavorText: Would you say you're floating in a most peculiar way?

Stranglethorn Heart.flavorText: The Stranglethorn mentality is to be happy with the bare necessities.

Stranglethorn Tiger.flavorText: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!

Street Sweeper.flavorText: The sweeper hit of the set.

Street Trickster.flavorText: His first trick: making your wallet disappear!

Streetwise Investigator.flavorText: "Hmmmm… Call it a hunch, but I'm starting to think that there may be some kind of criminal activity going on in Gadgetzan."

Strength in Numbers.flavorText: One minion, two minions... tree minions!

Strongman.flavorText: Sure, it looks impressive until you realize it's a barrel of helium.

Strongshell Scavenger.flavorText: It isn't "grave robbing" when there's no grave. It's just scavenging…

Stubborn Gastropod.flavorText: Stubbornly pursuing its dream to become Azeroth's fastest animal!

Stubborn Suspect.flavorText: He keeps saying "I'll never talk," but no one has actually asked him anything.

Student of the Stars.flavorText: She is getting her major in Ursa.

Submerged Spacerock.flavorText: Time for some out of this world RNG.

Suckerhook.flavorText: A moderately better dining companion than Suckerbeard.

Sudden Betrayal.flavorText: You thought he was your bro-bold, but turns out he's your foe-bold.

Sudden Genesis.flavorText: Being hurt can make you another person.

Suffocate.flavorText: He's already floating in the void of space. The shadow magic seems like overkill, idk.

Suffocating Shadows.flavorText: "Reading is good for you," they said.

Sul'thraze.flavorText: “Griftah here with de Sul’chop. One chop, you get four damage. Two chops, eight damage - you gonna change de way you fight."

Summer Flowerchild.flavorText: "Ugh, those Winter Floweradults just don't get our music."

Summoner Darkmarrow.flavorText: Some people say your name can influence what career you go into. Summoner Darkmarrow is not one of those people.

Summoning Portal.flavorText: NOT LESS THAN 1! Don't get any ideas!

Summoning Stone.flavorText: Sometimes it feels like it's always the same slackers that are waiting for a summon.

Summoning Ward.flavorText: You couldn't handle one Snowflipper Penguin. So what hope do you have… against two?!

Sunborne Val'kyr.flavorText: Bring valor to Odyn's halls, Champion!

Sunfire Smithing.flavorText: It's simple, just throw it into the sun.

Sunfury Champion.flavorText: Champion of the Great Blood Elf Bake Off 12 years running.

Sunfury Clergy.flavorText: Why is the sun so mad? Won't anyone ask about its feelings?

Sunfury Protector.flavorText: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.

Sunreaver Warmage.flavorText: What, did you expect the Sunreavers to be coldages?

Sunsapper Lynessa.flavorText: Paladins are sooo lawful that they start feeling like a Rogue just by sitting on someone else's beach chair.

Sunscale Raptor.flavorText: And they don't stop coming and they don't stop coming and they don't stop coming and they don't stop coming and they don't stop coming and they don't stop coming and they—

Sunset Volley.flavorText: When the light is just right during Golden Hour, that is when you take out the selfie stick and start casting.

Sunspot Dragon.flavorText: THIS is why you shouldn't look directly at the sun.

Sunstruck Henchman.flavorText: There is E.V.I.L. here that DOES sleep.

Sunwalker.flavorText: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun. It's just a name. Don’t worry!

Sunwell Initiate.flavorText: Initiates don’t study pronunciation until level 20.

Sunwing Squawker.flavorText: Most parrots repeat curses, not blessings.

Supercollider.flavorText: Boom's Second Law of Motion: HIT IT VERY HARD!

Supernova.flavorText: People who enjoy the heat will say this looks like perfect weather.

Supreme Archaeology.flavorText: Archaeology is the discovery of rare and powerful artifacts. Supreme Archaeology is TAKING THEM!

Surfalopod.flavorText: Hi! Octopus expert here. This is NOT funny. Octopi only do this when they're extremely rad.

Survival of the Fittest.flavorText: Sometimes the fittest is the one smart enough to not start a fight with seven 6/6 Treants.

Suspicious Alchemist.flavorText: Side effects may include feeling totally fine! Don't even worry about it.

Suspicious Peddler.flavorText: The best snake oil this side of Azeroth.

Suspicious Pirate.flavorText: EVERY party should be a costume party.

Suspicious Usher.flavorText: "Oh please, let me take your jacket, luggage, and absurdly large shoulder pads."

Swamp Dragon Egg.flavorText: Would you eat them in a ditch? Would you eat them with a witch?

Swamp King Dred.flavorText: Swamp King Dred, more like Swamp King Dead, amiright?

Swamp Leech.flavorText: A face only a druid could love.

Swampqueen Hagatha.flavorText: Rafaam mainly enjoys working with Hagatha because she never laughs at Dr. Boom's jokes.

Swarm of Lightbugs.flavorText: No, I asked for 'lightNING in a bottle'!

Swarm of Locusts.flavorText: Good things never come in swarms.

Swarthy Swordshiner.flavorText: Everyone knows swords are slashier when they're shiny!

Sweet Tooth.flavorText: He's been eyeballing that ice cream cone all day!

Sweetened Snowflurry.flavorText: "You want a piece of me!? Will that be one scoop or two?"

Swiftscale Trickster.flavorText: If you play your cards fast enough, who's to say how much they cost?

Swindle.flavorText: You know, it's probably just cheaper to find a place that sells the plushie…

Swinetusk Shank.flavorText: Comes with a rack of ribs!

Swipe.flavorText: When a bear rears back and extends his arms, he's about to Swipe! ... or hug.

Switcheroo.flavorText: Would you rather fight one Whale-sized Goldfish, or 100 Goldfish-sized Whales?

Sword Eater.flavorText: How tough is he? He eats swords for breakfast! Without any milk.

Sword and Board.flavorText: Stab and Slab. Charge and Targe. Slash and Bash. You get the idea.

Sword of Justice.flavorText: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!

Sword of the Fallen.flavorText: Hoarding secrets is no fun, so play each and every one.

Swordfish.flavorText: While you were partying, I studied the fish.

Sylvanas Windrunner.flavorText: Sylvanas was turned into the Banshee Queen by Arthas, but he probably should have just killed her because it just pissed her off.

Symphony of Sins.flavorText: Makes for some killer final boss music.

Synthesize.flavorText: After the invention of elemental audio processing, Azeroth went through a major synth phase.

Tabletop Roleplayer.flavorText: "And then I uh... I curse them with... uh... OH! I got it! They have to speak in rhymes or they turn into a crab!"

Tae'thelan Bloodwatcher.flavorText: He's a big fan of Control Death Knight live streams.

Taelan Fordring.flavorText: After growing up with the Scarlet Crusade for most of his life, Taelan finally realized they were maybe not the nicest people.

Tainted Remnant.flavorText: A sore sight of eyesores for sore eyes.

Tainted Zealot.flavorText: The love she shares seems to go nowhere. Now she's lost her Light, tosses and turns, she can't sleep at night...

Taintheart Tormenter.flavorText: Oh boo hoo, did someone's World Tree burn down?

Tak Nozwhisker.flavorText: "One for me and one for future me!"

Take to the Skies.flavorText: This is one step above reaching for the skies.

Talented Arcanist.flavorText: "Ey mon, you don't get this good just on raw talent ... but it helps."

Tame Beast (Rank 1).flavorText: "Trust me laddie, I never eat seafood!"

Tamsin Roame.flavorText: In life, Tamsin Roame was one of the Alliance's most promising mages; now she is the Horde's most dangerous warlock.

Tamsin's Phylactery.flavorText: Eau de Morte. Guaranteed to take your date’s breath away

Tanaris Hogchopper.flavorText: The Hogchoppers are well-known throughout Kalimdor for being a real, actual group.

Tanglefur Mystic.flavorText: Doom! Only doom for you! But pay good tip, maybe less doom.

Tar Creeper.flavorText: If you won't come to the tar pits, we'll bring them to you!

Tar Lord.flavorText: Tar Lord, man... legendary monster? Aw, forget it.

Tar Lurker.flavorText: Hi, Tar here. Long time lurking, first time taunting…

Tar Slick.flavorText: Has +2 Attack on its opponent's turn.

Target Dummy.flavorText: The engineering equivalent of a "Kick Me" sticker.

Taurajo Brave.flavorText: "He's brave, but splinters will make any Tauren cry."

Tauren Warrior.flavorText: Tauren Warrior: Champion of Mulgore, Slayer of Quilboar, Rider of Thunderbluff Elevators.

Tavish Stormpike.flavorText: "Hurry up, laddie, we're getting overrun! Serpents everywhere! They may look cute, but do ye see the fury in their eyes?!" —Tavish Stormpike

Teacher's Pet.flavorText: Really goes the extra mile to get the Hay+.

Tear Reality.flavorText: One time it gave me a black flower, a smiling pot, and a foil first edition Dracthyr.

Templar Captain.flavorText: You can combine two of these into a Captain Archon.

Temple Berserker.flavorText: He's back. He's angry. And he's here to wrap things up.

Temple Enforcer.flavorText: He also moonlights Thursday nights as a bouncer at the Pig and Whistle Tavern.

Temporus.flavorText: Follows adventurers, seeking the ultimate time magic: the ability to reload.

Ten Gallon Hat.flavorText: It actually only holds three quarters of a gallon, but that doesn't sound as good.

Tending Tauren.flavorText: That racial bonus to Herbalism finally paid off.

Tentacle Grip.flavorText: "WINTER VEIL WAS MONTHS AGO, WHY ARE YOUR LIGHTS STILL UP?"

Tentacle Tender.flavorText: It's a messy job but somebody's got to do it. Well, actually, nobody should do this.

Tentacle of N'Zoth.flavorText: Because EVERYDAY is the Day of the Tentacle of N'zoth.

Tentacled Menace.flavorText: He calls this one the "Calamari Special."

Tentacles for Arms.flavorText: That's right. Garrosh just slapped you to death with a tentacle.

Teron Gorefiend.flavorText: "You’re fine, friendly minions! You're fine! Don’t tell Mom!"

Terrible Chef.flavorText: Anyone can cook! But not them.

Terrorguard Escapee.flavorText: Poor guy is terrified, look at his faces.

Terrorscale Stalker.flavorText: Likes to scare his friends half to death.

Tess Greymane.flavorText: Those who cannot remember their card history are doomed to repeat it.

Testing Dummy.flavorText: Don't worry, they're having a blast. MUAHAHAHAHAAAA!

Thaddius, Monstrosity.flavorText: Feugen is positive that Thaddius will see play, but Stalagg seems negative about it.

Thassarian.flavorText: A natural born leader. And an unnatural reborn leader.

The 8 Hands From Beyond.flavorText: It was a one-eyed, eight-handed, giant purple planet eater.

The Amazing Reno.flavorText: "Reno!" "Please address me by my proper title." " Amazing Reno..."

The Beast.flavorText: He lives in Blackrock Mountain. He eats Gnomes. That's pretty much it.

The Beast Within.flavorText: Undoes years of obedience school training.

The Black Knight.flavorText: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament. We can pretty much mark that a failure.

The Boogeymonster.flavorText: Has 20 years of training in classical ballet, but ALLLLLL he ever gets asked to do is boogie.

The Boomship.flavorText: Dr. Boom ends his motivational speeches by dropping the mechs.

The Caverns Below.flavorText: Why can't it ever be The Taverns Below?

The Ceaseless Expanse.flavorText: If you play this for its full Mana cost, you know what? You win. Good day sir!

The Crystal Cove.flavorText: For some strange reason, everyone that hangs out at the Crystal Cove has the same name...

The Curator.flavorText: The Curator guards Azeroth’s deadliest creatures, but it’s secretly terrified of squirrels.

The Dark Portal.flavorText: Some say it's the source of Azeroth's greatest problems—aside from the gnomes.

The Darkness.flavorText: I would rather light a single candle than curse the darkness. But I'm willing to do both.

The Demon Seed.flavorText: Just need some elbow grease to get this working. Oh, and your soul.

The Exodar.flavorText: Limitless potential! Boundless hope! Fourth rate space insurance.

The Fires of Zin-Azshari.flavorText: One heck of a hot tub.

The Fist of Ra-den.flavorText: The mighty Ra-den was known as the Keeper of Storms. Unfortunately, he could not keep his fist.

The Forest's Aid.flavorText: Delicious Forest’s Aid! Made from real forests.

The Galactic Projection Orb.flavorText: Look closely in the ball and you'll see the expansion of space and time itself. Or their projections, anyway.

The Garden's Grace.flavorText: The perfect place to hold Conchella.

The Glass Knight.flavorText: She seems scary, but she's got a glass jaw.

The Harvester of Envy.flavorText: "Ah, permission shmermission! You can borrow anything you want, anytime, as long as if you give it back before it's missed. Everyone knows that! Right?"

The Headless Horseman.flavorText: This flavor text, you would expect to rhyme and reference, to great effect! It starts out strong, but as you can tell it doesn't end very good.

The Jailer.flavorText: At one point, The Jailer served as Arbiter over the souls of the Shadowlands. He was the epitome of an unbiased, righteous judge of character. WAS.

The Last Kaleidosaur.flavorText: “Impossible!” exclaimed the Silver Hand Recruit, his eyes filled with fear. Uther shook his head, turning the crystal until it caught the light: “Life finds a way.”

The Leviathan.flavorText: Built by Ini Stormcoil, this massive vessel can withstand almost anything you put it through... although she would prefer you didn't!

The Lich King.flavorText: "All that I am: anger, cruelty, vengeance, 8 attack - I bestow upon you, my chosen knight."

The Light! It Burns!.flavorText: Wait, if you're over there, then who's messing with the lights?!

The Lobotomizer.flavorText: This may hurt a little, but don't worry, you won't remember it.

The Marsh Queen.flavorText: Question: What's scarier, one giant angry dinosaur or 20 smaller vicious ones? Answer: AHHHHHHH THEY FOUND MEEEEEE

The Mistcaller.flavorText: Calling the mist doesn't sound all that great. "Ooooh, it is slightly damp now!"

The Nameless One.flavorText: Used to be called " , the Nameless," but everyone got confused.

The One-Amalgam Band.flavorText: Why be good with ONE instrument when you can be terrible with ALL of them!!!

The Primus.flavorText: As there is a Pantheon of titans, so is there also a Pantheon of Death, comprised of powerful rulers in the Shadowlands.

The Purator.flavorText: With the rise of the undead, the Curator sees it as his duty to take care of them.

The Rat King.flavorText: "I'm the giant rat that makes all of da rules!"

The Replicator-inator.flavorText: Dr. Boom is the greatest inventor in the Tri-Zone area!

The Runespear.flavorText: When asked what the runes do, the tauren smith smiled: "A little of this, a little of that..."

The Ryecleaver.flavorText: Legend has it that this dreaded blade is be able to slice through even the most stale of sourdough baguettes.

The Scarab Lord.flavorText: What did it cost? 41,400 Silithid Carapace Fragments, to start.

The Scourge.flavorText: “You speak of justice? Of cowardice? I will show you the justice of the grave and the true meaning of fear.”

The Skeleton Knight.flavorText: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.

The Stonewright.flavorText: She wrights stone better than she reads it.

The Storm Bringer.flavorText: Finally, Electra can work from home.

The Sunwell.flavorText: The Lich King had extinguished the light of the Sunwell once before - it will take all the might Silvermoon can muster to defend it!

The Voraxx.flavorText: I am the Voraxx. I speak for the weeds.

Theldurin the Lost.flavorText: He might be lost, but he knows where you can find these hands.

Theotar, the Mad Duke.flavorText: "I'm afraid you've gone mad! You're entirely bonkers. But I'll tell you a secret. All the best souls are."

Therazane.flavorText: You thought we forgot about her, didn't you? *nervous laughter*

Thickhide Kodo.flavorText: The introduction of professions was devastating for kodo populations.

Thing from Below.flavorText: Just can't resist the opportunity to hang around with a bunch of totems.

Thirsty Drifter.flavorText: Quick! Someone bring her a Manathirst card!

Thistle Tea.flavorText: Aren't Thistles prickly? Why would you drink them? I don't get Rogues.

Thorignir Drake.flavorText: Throwing your children at enemies qualifies you for Worst Mother of the Year.

Thorngrowth Sentries.flavorText: Maybe we shouldn't drink from this Oasis…

Thornmantle Musician.flavorText: She calls the hyena her "little chef". Not sure what that's about.

Thoughtsteal.flavorText: "What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc? Nothing!" - Tauren joke

Thrall, Deathseer.flavorText: "Do not be afraid. Approach. The dead will sleep… for now."

Thrallmar Farseer.flavorText: He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.

Thrive in the Shadows.flavorText: Why would your spells be afraid of the dark? It's easier to nap there.

Through Fel and Flames.flavorText: It's a Fel spell, but also a FIRE spell.

Throw Glaive.flavorText: "No, no, I said SHOW me the glaive!"

Thunder Bluff Valiant.flavorText: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating. I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.

Thunderbringer.flavorText: You can lead a horse to water, but you can't stop it from electrocuting everything in the water.

Thunderhead.flavorText: Most of his friends are still Metalheads.

Ticket Master.flavorText: You can exchange one ticket for a bear or save up thousands for a tacky light-up paperweight!

Ticket Scalper.flavorText: Takes ten percent off the top.

Ticking Abomination.flavorText: Abomination. Emphasis on the second syllable.

Tidal Revenant.flavorText: A big minion that clears the board and gains Armor? Wow, Warrior is really in their element now.

Tidal Surge.flavorText: Also good for removing pesky stains.

Tide Pools.flavorText: I know they look delicious but do NOT eat them.

Tidelost Burrower.flavorText: Burrowing may not be for everyone, but I dig it.

Tight-Lipped Witness.flavorText: People keep asking for her award-winning vegetarian chili recipe, but she just can't spill the beans.

Tigress Plushy.flavorText: The sheervalue of this card is undeniable.

Timber Wolf.flavorText: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.

Time-Lost Protodrake.flavorText: Weird way to say "late" but ok.

Time-Lost Raptor.flavorText: Much of his time lost no-lifeing Diablo IV.

Timeless Blessing.flavorText: To defeat the combined power of Murozond and C'Thun, Nozdormu would need heroes of Azeroth's past, present, and future.

Timeline Accelerator.flavorText: The future is NOW! No wait, NOW!

Timewarden.flavorText: When are we getting the Silver, Gold, and Diamond dragonflight?

Timewinder Zarimi.flavorText: With how generous Whizbang's return policy is, Zarimi has never been busier.

Tinker's Sharpsword Oil.flavorText: "Get ready to strike oil!" - Super-cheesy battle cry

Tinkertown Technician.flavorText: Won't you take me to... Tinkertown?

Tinkmaster Overspark.flavorText: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.

Tiny Knight of Evil.flavorText: "No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil."

Tinyfin's Caravan.flavorText: Movin' right along, mrgl mrg mrgl mrg.

Tip the Scales.flavorText: Hold on, I need to get some murlocs to weigh in on this.

Tirion Fordring.flavorText: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.

Titanforged Traps.flavorText: Always place it underneath their health pack.

To My Side!.flavorText: I hunt alone. Well, me and Misha. And Huffer. And Leokk.

To the Front!.flavorText: Except healers. You go to the back.

Toad of the Wilds.flavorText: "Someday we'll find it. The Oasis Connection. The peons, the caravans, and me."

Togwaggle's Scheme.flavorText: "Many minions equals many treasures for king. Kobold arithmetic!"

Toki, Time-Tinker.flavorText: Just a twist to the left, one quarter turn to the right and … oops! Well, we didn’t need that timeline anyway.

Tol'vir Stoneshaper.flavorText: He spends a lot of time keeping himself in stoneshape.

Tol'vir Warden.flavorText: Ferocious in combat… and even more terrifying in pet battles.

Tomb Lurker.flavorText: She hangs out in all the tombs, but she rarely posts.

Tomb Pillager.flavorText: After the guild broke up, he could no longer raid the tombs.

Tomb Spider.flavorText: Less serious than its cousin, the Grave Spider.

Tomb Traitor.flavorText: You enjoy raiding, I enjoying traitoring. We are not the same.

Tomb Warden.flavorText: Also known as an ancient copy machine.

Tome Tampering.flavorText: An overdue book calls for a do-over.

Tome of Intellect.flavorText: Just a compilation of napkins of intellect.

Tony, King of Piracy.flavorText: Tony prefers sailing on torrents rather than streams.

Tooth of Nefarian.flavorText: Nefarian: Lord of Blackrock, creator of the chromatic dragonflight, victim of several root canals.

Toothy Chest.flavorText: Do you want to eat an adventurer? I want to eat an adventurer!

Topior the Shrubbagazzor.flavorText: They got a dragon that burns 1000 gallons of anima a week.

Topple the Idol.flavorText: No Old Gods or Kings, only Naga.

Topsy Turvy.flavorText: "Help! I've fallen and I can't get down!"

Torghast Custodian.flavorText: Why is it a common? Well we couldn't make it a LEGendary minion!

Torrent.flavorText: Weeks of underwater cross-training have really built up her fourarms.

Tortollan Forager.flavorText: In the Tortollan tongue, Un’goro is known as the “Land of the Lost and Found.”

Tortollan Pilgrim.flavorText: A tortollan made it to the desert!

Tortollan Primalist.flavorText: I see pizza in my future.

Tortollan Traveler.flavorText: Tortolla, preserve my energy for this hike!

Totally Totems.flavorText: Hmph. Should've been Grace of Air Totem. Hmph.

Totem Cruncher.flavorText: When regular totem hours won't cut it.

Totem Golem.flavorText: What happens when you glue a buncha totems together.

Totem Goliath.flavorText: It was an art project, and nobody knew when to stop.

Totemic Evidence.flavorText: Every totem is evidence of a tree's murder.

Totemic Reflection.flavorText: "Upon reflection, I have decided that your board needs more ME."

Totemic Smash.flavorText: Trolls are the first group to have a totem survive atmospheric re-entry.

Totemic Surge.flavorText: It's not really advanced shamanic magic, you just draw nasty eyebrows on them.

Touch of the Nathrezim.flavorText: "You're giving your soul to me? I'm touched."

Tough Crowd.flavorText: "Your music's bad and you should feel bad."

Tour Guide.flavorText: "Here is the original blueprint for the Academy grounds! Don't mind those so-called dark chambers… They'll be at the end of the tour."

Tournament Attendee.flavorText: He was so excited to get season tickets to this year's Grand Tournament. He normally doesn't get them at first and has to buy them from Ogre scalpers.

Tournament Medic.flavorText: The medic tournament is less entertaining than the Grand Tournament.

Town Crier.flavorText: When he was younger, he was the town crybaby.

Toxfin.flavorText: I'm addicted to him, but I know that he's Toxfin.

Toxic Arrow.flavorText: What doesn't kill you makes you toxic.

Toxic Reinforcements.flavorText: In the event of a sudden loss of cabin pressure, a slingshot will be deployed for convenient evacuation.

Toxic Sewer Ooze.flavorText: When Sergeant Sally shows up unexpectedly, DO NOT FLUSH YOUR MANA CRYSTALS DOWN THE TOILET.

Toxicologist.flavorText: Double-majoring in culinary sciences was definitely a mistake.

Toxmonger.flavorText: Not all spiders are born poisonous. That's where he comes in.

Toy Boat.flavorText: Try playing seven of these in one turn fast.

Toy Captain Tarim.flavorText: Whizbang is now the sole proprietor of Un'Goro.

Toyrantus.flavorText: Dr. Boom was definitely a dinosaur kid.

Toysnatching Geist.flavorText: So THAT'S how the Geist stole Winterveil!

Tracking.flavorText: For the person who just cannot decide what card to put into a deck!

Trade Prince Gallywix.flavorText: Gallywix believes in supply and demand. He supplies the beatings and demands you pay up!

Trail Mix.flavorText: You can tell this is an escapist fantasy game because there are no raisins.

Training Session.flavorText: Instructor Razuvious's training turns the Scourge's Death Knights into hardened killing machines. His merciless routines focus on breaking down his underlings until they build up a resistance to his strength.

Tram Heist.flavorText: How are they gunna steal the whole tram!?

Tram Mechanic.flavorText: He looks at life through sludge-tinted glasses.

Tram Operator.flavorText: The guy in the back is screaming… because the train ride is so fun!

Trampling Rhino.flavorText: "Whew. I thought you said 'Trampoline Rhino.' Now that would have been scary."

Transfer Student.flavorText: Oh, the places you'll go! There is so much to fight! There are boards to be explored. There are dreams to take flight.

Translocation Instructor.flavorText: *Translocates behind you* psssh... nothin personnel, kid.

Transmogrifier.flavorText: All it takes is some imagination and a cardboard box.

Trapdoor Spider.flavorText: I can respect that they're important for the ecosystem, as long as you keep them waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay over there.

Travel Agent.flavorText: I could've hired her or some Dodo.

Travel Security.flavorText: "You're just gonna let ANY 8-Cost minion get past you!?" "...Yeah..."

Traveling Healer.flavorText: Some heroes have soft hearts and hard shells.

Travelmaster Dungar.flavorText: Our travel options will take you to Paradise and beyond!

Treachery.flavorText: Never look a gift minion in the mouth.

Treasure Distributor.flavorText: As the illiterate pirates always say: There is no 'I' in 'piracy'.

Treasure Guard.flavorText: The real treasure was the Naga we met along the way.

Treasure Hunter Eudora.flavorText: How hard could it be to hunt treasure? It doesn't even run away when you shoot it!

Treespeaker.flavorText: Honestly, his delivery is a little wooden.

Trial of the Jormungars.flavorText: The defendants were found guilty on 33 counts of wiping raid parties.

Trick Totem.flavorText: It knows how to sit still and do tricks. Still working on rolling over, though.

Trinket Artist.flavorText: Many Draenei found new hobbies on the long journey from Argus.

Trinket Tracker.flavorText: Dashing through the snow On an undead trinket craze Over the hills we go Tracking all the way!

Triple Sevens.flavorText: If you count the 'seven' in the name, there's actually four total 7s, not three. Huge oversight from the designers.

Triplewick Trickster.flavorText: You no take candle! Or second candle. You can take third candle though.

Trogg Beastrager.flavorText: Still angry that the Gadgetzan Rager Club wouldn't accept him as a member.

Trogg Gemtosser.flavorText: Oh no! You're throwing valuable gems at me! Please stop!

Trogg Gloomeater.flavorText: His breath smells like agony and despair, which is still better than most troggs.

Troggzor the Earthinator.flavorText: He keeps earthinating the countryside despite attempts to stop him.

Troll Batrider.flavorText: "Quiet! The bat can't hear where he's goin'!"

Troll Centurion.flavorText: Centurion? Ha, come back when you’re a millennion.

Trolley Problem.flavorText: If only there were thousands of hypotheticals to prepare me for this moment!

Troubled Mechanic.flavorText: In space, no one can hear you talk about your troubles.

Truesilver Champion.flavorText: It Slices, it Dices. You can cut a tin can with it. (But you wouldn't want to.)

Trusty Fishing Rod.flavorText: That's weird… I can only catch magic carps with this old fishing rod.

Tsunami.flavorText: Hop in, the water's cold! And angry. And alive.

Tundra Rhino.flavorText: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos. Or am I mistaken?

Tunnel Blaster.flavorText: And you always thought they wore the candles just for fun.

Tunnel Trogg.flavorText: Sure, they're ugly, but they live in tunnels. You try your beauty routine without natural light.

Turalyon, the Tenured.flavorText: "Let evil flee before righteousness; let the innocent live in peace. Let the day come when none need fear. For that day, I give my life gladly."

Turbulus.flavorText: "Passengers, we will be experiencing some minor Turbulus in the next few expansions."

Tuskarr Fisherman.flavorText: If you bring him 500 fish, he'll give you this sweet Kalu'ak Fishing Pole.

Tuskarr Jouster.flavorText: Just could not be talked out of using his turtle for the joust...

Tuskarr Totemic.flavorText: Turns out the tuskarr aren't real choosy about their totems.

Tuskarrrr Trawler.flavorText: "Fish scales? Junk. A gravestone? Junk. This weird looking puzzle box? Junk. AHA! An Ancharrr!"

Tuskpiercer.flavorText: It's the Barrens, everything has tusks! The Quilboar have tusks, the boars have tusks, the tusks have tusks.

Twig of the World Tree.flavorText: For druids who want to branch out.

Twilight Acolyte.flavorText: The dragons mostly keep him around as a snack.

Twilight Darkmender.flavorText: First she separates them from the lights, washes them in cold water, and hang-dries.

Twilight Deceptor.flavorText: Nobody asks questions if you're carrying a clipboard.

Twilight Drake.flavorText: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy. And Tacos.

Twilight Elder.flavorText: Just doesn't understand those Twilight Youngsters any more - with their comic books and their rock music.

Twilight Flamecaller.flavorText: Make sure you summon a Twilight Marshmallowcaller too! Mmmm Mmm Mmm!!

Twilight Geomancer.flavorText: "Ok C'Thun, repeat after me: 'Your mother was a hamster.'"

Twilight Guardian.flavorText: A result of magical experiments carried out by the Black Dragonflight, it's not his fault that he's a vicious killer.

Twilight Medium.flavorText: This twilight is too dark. And this twilight is too bright. But THIS twilight is juuuuuuuuust right!

Twilight Runner.flavorText: Every morning you find two dead cards at your doorstep.

Twilight Summoner.flavorText: If you strike him down, he shall become more powerful than you can possibly imagine.

Twilight Torrent.flavorText: I hope it’s the first one.

Twilight Whelp.flavorText: The twilight whelps are basically magic-vampires. Despite this, they are not a reference to any popular series of novels.

Twilight's Call.flavorText: If you’re experiencing resurrection sickness, press 1.

Twin Emperor Vek'lor.flavorText: Do they make decisions based on age? "I'm two minutes older therefore we burn this village."

Twin Slice.flavorText: The slice so nice, it'll cut you twice.

Twin Tyrant.flavorText: They can never agree on whether it's too hot or too cold.

Twin-fin Fin Twin.flavorText: They call him Murloc Joe, winner of the Big M Memorial Surf Off Competition.

Twisted Frostwing.flavorText: Not currently valid in the Twist format.

Twisted Knowledge.flavorText: People eat eight spiders in their sleep per year. Centaurs have two rib cages. Dwarves are just counterfeit titans.

Twisted Pack.flavorText: Twist it! Rip it! Play it!

Twisted Tether.flavorText: First, convince your opponent that you just want to play tetherball. Then, you GET 'EM!

Twisted Worgen.flavorText: Sometimes the Old Gods' corruptions gives you power untold, sometimes you get +1 Attack. We can’t all be winners in the Eldritch lottery.

Twisting Nether.flavorText: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.

Two-Faced Investor.flavorText: Should never have opened that joint account...

Tyr.flavorText: Brought me back to life, S Tyr card.

Tyr's Tears.flavorText: Liek this if u cri evertim

Tyrantus.flavorText: Millennia of evolutionary pressures turned his species into the Faerie Dragons we know today.

Ultimate Infestation.flavorText: Ghouls in the pipe, five by five.

Ultrasaur.flavorText: Evolved the really long neck to spy on its neighbors.

Umberwing.flavorText: Demon Hunters refer to these glaives as "the ol’ flappy-attackys."

Umbral Geist.flavorText: “After all, one can't leave his shadow lying about and not miss it sooner or later, don't you agree?”

Umbral Owl.flavorText: It sleeps with one eye open.

Umbral Skulker.flavorText: "Three gold?! Do you have any idea how long this quest chain was?"

Un'Goro Brochure.flavorText: Our Un'Goro package includes the Tortollan travel tour! Just don't mind the Devilsaurs.

Unbound Elemental.flavorText: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.

Unchained Gladiator.flavorText: We can't possibly buff this card any more, just look at him!

Underbelly Fence.flavorText: She’ll take anything you have—except scruples and a good work ethic.

Underbelly Ooze.flavorText: It's always accepting of the less successful adventurers.

Undercity Huckster.flavorText: Psst! Wanna buy a random class card (from your opponent's class)?

Undercity Valiant.flavorText: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.

Underking.flavorText: "Behold, the Underking! I'm always beneath you, but nothing is beneath me! I hereby declare war on peace and happiness! Soon, all will tremble before me!"

Underlight Angling Rod.flavorText: "I said I wanted the ASHbringer not FISHbringer!"

Undertaker.flavorText: In a world where you can run to a spirit healer and resurrect yourself, Undertakers do pretty light business.

Undying Disciple.flavorText: We get it, you're undead. But jumping out of a grave? That's a bit much.

Unearthed Raptor.flavorText: Still hunting for the ones who earthed him.

Unending Swarm.flavorText: swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm swarm -

Unexpected Results.flavorText: Sometimes science is more art than science. A lot of people don’t get that.

Unidentified Contract.flavorText: The terms of service are constantly changing.

Unidentified Elixir.flavorText: "Here, taste this." (Slurp) "What is it?" "I don't know, I found it in one of the labs."

Unidentified Maul.flavorText: When all you have is an unidentified maul, everything else looks like an unidentified nail.

Unidentified Shield.flavorText: The kobold stared at the bundle for a long time. “Ah hah!” he said. “It’s a shield.”

Unite the Murlocs.flavorText: Form feet and legs! Form arms and body! Oh. Sorry. I was thinking about Mechafin.

Unleash Fel.flavorText: Why'd you put it on a leash in the first place?

Unleash the Beast.flavorText: The Kirin Tor have always been lax in enforcing leash laws.

Unleash the Hounds.flavorText: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.

Unlicensed Apothecary.flavorText: Get the ingredients wrong on ONE healing potion and they take your license. What a world!

Unpopular Has-Been.flavorText: Oh man, she used to rock more than ANYONE back in the Year of the Kraken. I wish I could've seen her perform back then…

Unpowered Mauler.flavorText: After a stressful work day it really needs an outlet.

Unseen Saboteur.flavorText: Far more effective than the flamboyant saboteur.

Unsleeping Soul.flavorText: It's 3 am. Do you know where your soul is?

Unstable Felbolt.flavorText: Warning! Your minions are seated in the splash zone.

Unstable Ghoul.flavorText: Filling your Ghouls with Rocket Fuel is all the rage at Necromancer school.

Unstable Portal.flavorText: The denizens of Azeroth have no idea how much work goes into stabilizing portals. We spend like 30% of GDP on portal upkeep.

Untamed Beastmaster.flavorText: All it takes is a tummy rub.

Unwilling Sacrifice.flavorText: Stand right... there. Perfect, perfect! Now don't move.

Unyielding Vindicator.flavorText: Strike and smash, until it is done.

Upgraded Repair Bot.flavorText: It's the same as the previous generation but they slapped the word "upgraded" on it to sell it for double.

Ur'zul Giant.flavorText: Nothing personal, tiny human. I have many mouths to feed.

Ur'zul Horror.flavorText: You face face face face face Jaraxxus!

Ur'zul Rager.flavorText: The Burning Legion is host to many horrors, but a 3 Mana 5/1 is the worst of all!

Ursatron.flavorText: It's been programmed to include all the bear necessities.

Usher of Souls.flavorText: Nothing unburdens your soul like a good ushing!

Utgarde Grapplesniper.flavorText: Note: The dragon may be a little cranky upon arrival.

Uther of the Ebon Blade.flavorText: "Step forward. Confess! Once I was a mere servant of the Light. Now I alone stand in judgement."

V-07-TR-0N Prime.flavorText: Long after the titans' departure, Mimiron dreamed of creating something with an approximation of their power. He may have actually succeeded!

Val'anyr.flavorText: Recently unearthed in one of the deepest kobold caves. Traded for a large candle.

Val'kyr Soulclaimer.flavorText: My Ghoul friend is back and you're gonna be in trouble.

Valdris Felgorge.flavorText: I don't mean to pry, but you don't by chance happen to have six fingers on both of your hands?

Valeera the Hollow.flavorText: "Run away. Hide in your precious keeps, behind your walls and your bodyguards. Night always falls, and shadows will fill your hallowed halls. One day, one of those shadows will be me."

Validated Doomsayer.flavorText: Really feels good about himself and is in a much better place now. But… he sure does miss piloting those shredders.

Vanessa VanCleef.flavorText: Some people collect stamps or flowers. She collects enemies.

Vanndar Stormpike.flavorText: His favorite modes of transportation? Van, car, board, bike.

Vaporize.flavorText: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card. We may never know the truth.

Varden Dawngrasp.flavorText: Varden Dawngrasp could wield fire, summon hailstorms, and morph a night elf into a sheep with a snap of their fingers. Knowing how malleable reality could be, certain labels felt downright trivial.

Varian Wrynn.flavorText: Leader of the Alliance! Father of Anduin! Also he likes to play Arena, and he averages 12 wins.

Varian, King of Stormwind.flavorText: Man, this guy is so cool. Sure hope nothing happens to him.

Vast Wisdom.flavorText: My wisdom is SO vast that I can count up to THREE!

Vectus.flavorText: Don’t let that dark magic worry you. He’ll ensure they hatch without a scratch.

Veiled Worshipper.flavorText: If you’re not wearing your regulation cultist clothing, how will Galakrond know to devour you last?

Velarok Windblade.flavorText: His deceptive manipulations have dug the Bloodrock Company into a hole they can't get out of.

Velen's Chosen.flavorText: Velen wrote a "Lovely Card" for Tyrande with a picture of the Deeprun Tram that said "I Choo-Choo-Choose you!"

Velen, Leader of the Exiled.flavorText: For an exiled dude, he's pretty popular!

Vendetta.flavorText: A vengeful and vicarious vanguard against violent villains or vexed victims.

Vengeful Spirit.flavorText: Sheesh, even the spirits are edgy when it comes to Demon Hunters.

Vengeful Visage.flavorText: The mirror shows us nothing less than the deepest, darkest desire of our hearts: to go face.

Vengeful Walloper.flavorText: If you can't beat 'em, beat WITH 'em!

Venomancer.flavorText: Eight times the death of regular-mancers.

Venomizer.flavorText: Keeps getting banned for toxic behavior.

Venomous Scorpid.flavorText: Despite what Guff says, he is NOT a "nice little guy."

Venomstrike Bow.flavorText: "You know you only have to coat the arrowhead in poison and not the entire bow, right?"

Venture Co. Mercenary.flavorText: No Job is too big. No fee is too big.

Veranus.flavorText: As an empty nester, she just misses her little ones.

Verdant Longneck.flavorText: Always sticking its neck into other people’s business.

Vereesa Windrunner.flavorText: Good things come in threes: Windrunner sisters and arrows of Thori'dal.

Vessina.flavorText: She wasn't happy when Hagatha sent her back to Uldum. But her "angry" hiss sounds like her "happy" hiss, so no one knew the difference.

Veteran Warmedic.flavorText: In times of war, warmedics bring their own medics.

Vex Crow.flavorText: As birds of ill omen, these crows often summon Doomsayers.

Vexallus.flavorText: He only casts the spells once - it's Shmexallus that casts the copy.

Vibrant Squirrel.flavorText: Oh, they're cute now. Just wait till they unleash a Savage Roar.

Vicious Bloodworm.flavorText: Not to be confused with the Viscous Bloodworm.

Vicious Fledgling.flavorText: A youngster who is truly hungry for self-improvement.

Vicious Scalehide.flavorText: They make wonderful pets if you're not allergic to blood loss.

Vicious Slitherspear.flavorText: He goes by ‘Fun-Loving Slitherspear’ on his dating profile.

Victorious Vrykul.flavorText: Get three of these and you have a Trikul.

Vile Apothecary.flavorText: When he's feeling extra malicious, he uses the licorice-flavored one.

Vile Call.flavorText: "We're calling to inform you that your vehicle's insurance is about to expire."

Vile Library.flavorText: What type of vial library has 0 vials in it!?

Vilebrood Skitterer.flavorText: It aspires to be a Vilebrood Dancer, but it has eight left feet.

Vilefiend.flavorText: Dreamed of becoming a Stylefiend, but fel was never in season.

Vilefiend Trainer.flavorText: My Vilefiend Trainers give me a much better sprint than my Air Gul'dans.

Vilespine Slayer.flavorText: 'Cause slayers gonna slay, slay, slay, slay, slay.

Vinecleaver.flavorText: George and Karl! Thank the Light we found you!

Violet Haze.flavorText: Elite Tauren Chieftain's next hit single.

Violet Illusionist.flavorText: She’s much more cheerful after losing the ‘n’ in her name.

Violet Spellsword.flavorText: If you have to wield a spell and a sword, then neither is performing to expectation.

Violet Spellwing.flavorText: A bird in the hand is worth three missiles in the grave.

Violet Teacher.flavorText: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig. And then you get your name on the board.

Violet Warden.flavorText: He's got magic, a shield, and an unwavering obsession with the color purple.

Violet Wurm.flavorText: It's wurms all the way down.

Vitality Surge.flavorText: If your vitality lasts longer than four hours, consult a Priest.

Vitality Totem.flavorText: You can usually find these at the totemist's market on Saturdays.

Vivid Nightmare.flavorText: "I… I dreamed I accidentally crafted a golden Millhouse! It was so REAL!"

Vivid Spores.flavorText: Hey man, I just feel like... death is just a construct of our imaginations, ya know?

Void Flayer.flavorText: The Void, just like onions, has flayers.

Void Ripper.flavorText: You had to put the portable hole inside the bag of holding, didn't you?!

Void Scripture.flavorText: The Old Gods like to think of them as "Addendums."

Void Terror.flavorText: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

Void Virtuoso.flavorText: That is one interesting dress code.

Voidgill.flavorText: If you stare into the abyss, it’s said that it will stare back at you. What happens to those who’ve gazed at it their entire lives?

Voidlord.flavorText: Never let it hold your checkbook.

Voidtouched Attendant.flavorText: Don't TOUCH the Void. You don't know where it's been.

Voidwalker.flavorText: No relation to "The Voidsteppers", the popular Void-based dance troupe.

Vol'jin.flavorText: Vol'jin is a shadow hunter, which is like a shadow priest except more voodoo.

Volatile Elemental.flavorText: Currently in an anger management class with Raging Worgen, Grommash Hellscream, and The Angry Chicken. It isn't helping.

Volatile Skeleton.flavorText: These ice sculpures look so realistic!

Volcanic Drake.flavorText: Volcanic Drakes breathe lava instead of fire. The antacid vendor at Thorium Point does a brisk business with them.

Volcanic Lumberer.flavorText: The roots, the roots, the roots is on fire!

Volcanic Potion.flavorText: The secret ingredient in Kazakus's award-winning chili recipe.

Volcano.flavorText: Many young shaman summon a volcano as their first school project.

Volcanomancy.flavorText: Do it again, this time with Pompeii and circumstance.

Volcanosaur.flavorText: Always fun to say out loud "VOL-CA-NO-SAUUUR!"

Volley Maul.flavorText: "It's all fun and games until someone gets hurt." - LAME PARTY POOPERS

Voltaic Burst.flavorText: Batteries have three components: Cathode, Anode, and Overload.

Volume Up.flavorText: You have to pay Mana to do that!? I thought it was just in the settings menu!

Voodoo Doctor.flavorText: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.

Voodoo Doll.flavorText: "Aww, I love it! It even kinda looks like me."

Voodoo Hexxer.flavorText: The Silver Hand recruits shuddered in terror when they saw the dreaded totem of the Hexxer: A tiny little snowman, impaled with pins.

Voracious Reader.flavorText: But how much of it is skimming?

Vryghoul.flavorText: It's pronounced VERY GHOUL. Don't let anyone tell you different.

Vrykul Necrolyte.flavorText: If at first you don't succeed, vry, vry again.

Vulgar Homunculus.flavorText: Fortunately he has an even number of fingers.

Vulpera Scoundrel.flavorText: A spell is a spell, but the mystery choice could be anything! (It's also a spell.)

Vulpera Toxinblade.flavorText: The blade works well enough on its own… but this is just in case.

Waggle Pick.flavorText: Kobolds informally refer to its effect as a deathwaggle.

Wailing Soul.flavorText: This soul just wails on you. Dang, soul, let up already.

Wailing Vapor.flavorText: If you have The Vapors, your Humors might be imbalanced.

Wakener of Souls.flavorText: The alarm again!? Wake me up in 5 more eternities.

Walking Dead.flavorText: Watch out for the Scourge, KAAARRRRLLLL!

Walking Fountain.flavorText: The weirdest part is that it doesn't have legs.

Walking Mountain.flavorText: The hills are alive with the sound of YEEEEHAAAWWWW!

Walnut Sprite.flavorText: How do you make a walnut laugh? Crack it up!

Wandering Monster.flavorText: Not all who wander are lost. This one is lost though, for sure.

Wandmaker.flavorText: She creates incredibly affordable wands of all shapes and sizes. But not owls. The owl is all-natural.

War Cache.flavorText: It's much tidier than Illidan's storage locker.

War Golem.flavorText: Golems are not afraid, but for some reason they still run when you cast Fear on them. Instinct, maybe? A desire to blend in?

War Master Voone.flavorText: War Master sounds cooler than Dragon Sitter.

Warbot.flavorText: Mass production of warbots was halted when it was discovered that they were accidentally being produced at "sample size."

Warden of Chains.flavorText: Can’t stay out too late. I gotta head back home to the ol’ ball and chained demon.

Wardruid Loti.flavorText: “Ravasaur!” “Pretty scary” “…Blammodax!” “Is that a thing?” “SMAXODON!” “….now you’re just making those up.”

Wargear.flavorText: WAR! GEAR! What is it good for?

Warglaives of Azzinoth.flavorText: The blades glow green from things unseen, dark dreams whirling in the felfire gleam.

Warhorse Trainer.flavorText: He doesn't even get Sundays off. Every day he's hostling.

Warmaul Challenger.flavorText: Old gladiator rules: first one to die loses.

Warpath.flavorText: "Left, right, left, right, there's none of the enemy left… Right?"

Warsong Commander.flavorText: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.

Warsong Envoy.flavorText: "What do you mean we didn’t give the flag to the Druid?"

Warsong Grunt.flavorText: Where do you think the chickens learned to be angry?

Warsong Outrider.flavorText: When it comes to the Warsong clan, outriders are the insiders.

Warsong Wrangler.flavorText: "Me? Playing favorites? I love my beasts all the same!"

Wartbringer.flavorText: “Does she cause them with magic, or just…like have a bucket she brings with her?”

Waste Remover.flavorText: Always follow the three Rs: REDUCE their world to ash, REUSE their bones as paperweights, and RECYCLE!

Waste Warden.flavorText: Recycle that can, or you get the cuffs!

Wasteland Assassin.flavorText: They'll never see me coming, what with my glowing body, eyes and daggers.

Wasteland Scorpid.flavorText: After they get to a certain size, it doesn't matter if they're poisonous or not.

Watcher of the Sun.flavorText: "I've got my eye on y-AAA I'M BLIND!"

Water Elemental.flavorText: Don't summon a water elemental at a party. It'll dampen the mood.

Water Moccasin.flavorText: You need to be specific when you're ordering waterproof shoewear.

Watercannon.flavorText: There's a teeny tiny pirate trapped in each of the water balloons. Free them!

Watercolor Artist.flavorText: They've amassed a largely aquatic body of work, painting lakes, rivers and self portraits.

Wave Pool Thrasher.flavorText: Used to be called Wave Pool Splasher until 'The Incident'.

Wave of Nostalgia.flavorText: Ja, please don't freeze my minions. No stall, ja????

Wax Elemental.flavorText: Takes double damage from wick-based weapons.

Waxadred.flavorText: Waxadred the dragon fought for his king, frolicking through the fields melting everything!

Waxmancy.flavorText: The waxmancer works with flame and form, giving shape to figures warm. Some think he's a crazy creeper, but crafting minions is simply cheaper.

Wayward Sage.flavorText: Carry on my wayward sage. There'll be peace and no more rage.

Wealth Redistributor.flavorText: WOULD YE LIKE CASH BACK? [ ] YAR HAR [ ] YO HO

Weaponized Pi\u00f1ata.flavorText: It'll be fine. It's not like they have any reason to hate us.

Weaponized Wasp.flavorText: Dr. Boom had one simple request: wasps with flippin' laser beams attached to their heads.

Weapons Attendant.flavorText: Hotel policy states that you must leave your weapons at the front desk. But GOOD NEWS! You can also buy weapons at the back desk!!

Weapons Expert.flavorText: "Yes, Your Honor, this appears to be some sort of blade."

Weapons Project.flavorText: Harrison Jones was kicked off this project.

Weasel Tunneler.flavorText: He's the reason the First Bank of Gadgetzan has steel floors.

Webspinner.flavorText: Spider cocoons are like little piñatas!

Webweave.flavorText: O, what a tangled web we weave, hoping spiders dodge the cleave.

Wee Spellstopper.flavorText: Bane of spellcasters and spelling bees everywhere.

Weight of the World.flavorText: Unluckily for him, Azeroth has a tendency to get bigger every 2 years or so.

Whack-A-Gnoll.flavorText: Need closure on your Hardcore WoW character dying in Westfall? Step right up!

Wheel of DEATH!!!.flavorText: Why don't the good guys ever get a wheel?

Whelp Wrangler.flavorText: "Gosh darn it! How did these winged, airborne creatures manage to escape my knee-high, fenced enclosure AGAIN!?"

Whetstone Hatchet.flavorText: A bad hatchet can make a good spear better.

Whirling Combatant.flavorText: It's called capoeira! And yes, it is dangerous!

Whirling Zap-o-matic.flavorText: If you pay a little extra, you can get it in "candy-apple red."

Whirlpool.flavorText: In the southern hemisphere, it actually summons all minions instead.

Whirlweaver.flavorText: Of all the creations from the Construct Quarter, a naga combined with water is the most intuitive.

Whirlwind.flavorText: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell "wheeeee" while whirlwinding.

Whirlwind Tempest.flavorText: And your minions with mega-windfury get... dizzy.

Whispers of EVIL.flavorText: Madame Lazul’s ASMR program is off to a promising start!

Whispers of the Deep.flavorText: And in the darkest of depths, the sailor heard a command from inside his own mind… “You will also buff my original card to 9 Mana.”

Wicked Skeleton.flavorText: It's minions like these that give normal, law-abiding skeletons a bad rap.

Wicked Stab (Rank 1).flavorText: Always go for the glowing weak point.

Wicked Whispers.flavorText: When the Old Ones whisper, others will scream.

Wicked Witchdoctor.flavorText: You can easily defeat her by either dealing 4 damage, or dropping a house on her.

Wickerclaw.flavorText: They say pets tend to look like their owners.

Wickerflame Burnbristle.flavorText: Wickerflame spent years as a recruit for the Goons, never making the big-time because he always fired his chest-cannon too slowly. "Hey," he thought, "maybe if I keep my beard lit on fire, I can do this faster." BOOM, promoted.

Widowbloom Seedsman.flavorText: Sometimes a blue thumb is better than a green one.

Wild Bloodstinger.flavorText: Tame Bloodstingers would politely invite your minion to tea.

Wild Growth.flavorText: Grow your own mana crystals with this Mana Crystal Growth Kit, only 39.99!

Wild Pyromancer.flavorText: BOOM BABY BOOM! BAD IS GOOD! DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

Wild Spirits.flavorText: Wait, this card just released! It should be Standard Spirits!

Wilderness Pack.flavorText: Don't bother asking, "Can we keep them?" The answer is no.

Wildfire.flavorText: The Barrens were a lush jungle. Then this happened.

Wildheart Guff.flavorText: Guff faced his biggest challenge yet: making friends on a battlefield.

Wildpaw Cavern.flavorText: Adventurers were quite confused when they saw how many boots were frozen to the ceiling.

Wildpaw Gnoll.flavorText: A big fan of four-claw discounts.

Wildwalker.flavorText: She was born to be something. She is just not quite sure what yet...

Wilfred Fizzlebang.flavorText: He can summon anything, even a FEARSOME DOOMGUARD*. *He's pretty sure this is going to work out.

Wind-Up Enforcer.flavorText: Code 6404.5 clearly states that all Enforcers remain in their packaging until told by authorized personnel.

Wind-Up Musician.flavorText: Sure to wind up your opponents.

Wind-up Burglebot.flavorText: Don't blame the bot for his crimes... Blame whoever keeps winding him up!

Windchill.flavorText: The thermometer says it’s 0° right now, but with the windchill it feels like -25°.

Windfury.flavorText: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.

Windfury Harpy.flavorText: Harpies are not pleasant sounding. That's the nicest I can put it.

Windshear Stormcaller.flavorText: Don't ever doubt Al'Akir's love for basic totems.

Windspeaker.flavorText: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

Wing Blast.flavorText: Emeriss uses Wing Blast. It's super effective!

Wing Commander Ichman.flavorText: “Mulverick, it’s not your flying, it’s your faction.”

Wing Commander Mulverick.flavorText: “A board full of 2-Health minions? This is what I call a target rich environment.”

Wing Welding.flavorText: This is not how you train your dragon.

Winged Guardian.flavorText: Take these broken wings, be reborn, and learn to fly again.

Wings of Hate (Rank 1).flavorText: For one day each February, they become the Wings of Love.

Wisdom of Norgannon.flavorText: Now all we need is the power and courage of Norgannon.

Wish Upon a Star.flavorText: "What are you going to wish for?" "I wish I had just a liiiiiiiittle more Attack and Health!" "...Really? You don't want, like, a million more?"

Wishing Well.flavorText: Wishing upon a star? Pssshhh, that's so childish. Anyways, let me throw all my Coins into this well.

Wisp.flavorText: If you hit an Eredar Lord with enough Wisps, it will explode. But why?

Wispering Woods.flavorText: We didn't actually fire the guy who named Dark Wispers.

Wisps of the Old Gods.flavorText: They're just normal wisps, actually. The "Of the Old Gods" bit is just marketing.

Witch of the Arch-Thief.flavorText: A minion fit for a king.

Witch's Apprentice.flavorText: Is she a frog that became a witch, or a witch that became a frog?

Witch's Cauldron.flavorText: Eye of murloc, ear of bat, foot of Fordring, fur of cat…

Witching Hour.flavorText: The gates to the Gilnean pet cemetary MUST remain locked at all times.

Witchwood Apple.flavorText: An apple a day keeps the worgen at bay.

Witchwood Grizzly.flavorText: You know what they say about people with big hands? Small bears.

Witchwood Piper.flavorText: She rids villages of annoying pests, like rats and children.

Wither.flavorText: The opponent's minion can't live wither without you.

Wobbling Runts.flavorText: The fourth one fell off in a tragic accident. They don't talk about it.

Woecleaver.flavorText: Turn that frown into TWO frowns!

Wolfrider.flavorText: Orcish raiders ride wolves because they are well adapted to harsh environments, and because they are soft and cuddly.

Wolpertinger.flavorText: Scholomance student Brewfest prank gone awry.

Woodcutter's Axe.flavorText: It's a lumberjack's axe and that's ok.
