Woodland Wonders.flavorText: Is this a standup fight or another bug hunt?

Worgen Abomination.flavorText: Does anyone want to play dead!?

Worgen Greaser.flavorText: Hair products are 79% of his monthly budget.

Worgen Infiltrator.flavorText: If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, "No! Bad boy!"

Worgen Roadie.flavorText: "I asked for an instrument, and you give me a CURSED BLADE!?"

Workhorse.flavorText: Give me ONE reason why a horse shouldn’t be allowed in the travel agency.

Workshop Janitor.flavorText: She works in a magical toy shop and they just gave her a regular mop? Make it make sense.

Workshop Mishap.flavorText: IT HAS BEEN DAYS SINCE LAST ACCIDENT.

Worthy Expedition.flavorText: This isn't where I parked my mount.

Wound Prey.flavorText: You steal the cranberry juice, you pay the price.

Wrapped Golem.flavorText: The end result of one of the greatest wrap battles of all time.

Wrath.flavorText: The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.

Wrathguard.flavorText: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.

Wrathion.flavorText: Wrathion, son of Deathwing, is a dragon. Why isn't he tagged as a dragon, you ask? WHAT, ARE YOU TRYING TO BLOW HIS COVER??

Wrathscale Naga.flavorText: If throwing glaives is what you crave; summon tokens and make 'em broken.

Wrathspike Brute.flavorText: You scratch her back, her back scratches back.

Wrathspine Enchanter.flavorText: If he could see, he might be better at targeting.

Wreck'em and Deck'em.flavorText: ...and Check'em for any signs of life.

Wrenchcalibur.flavorText: Whoso pulleth out this wrench from the toolbox is rightwise king of the lab.

Wretched Exile.flavorText: If you're cold, they're cold. Let your wretches inside.

Wretched Queen.flavorText: Mind your head when you're around her.

Wretched Reclaimer.flavorText: "Ok, here's the plan. We kill you, then bring you back." "Stronger?" "No, about the same."

Wretched Tiller.flavorText: If you ever tried to plow permafrost, you’d be wretched, too.

Wretched Tutor.flavorText: "If you like my tutoring, you'll love my sister the art therapist, my father the driver, and my mother the housekeeper."

Wriggling Horror.flavorText: Created to scare. Born to wriggle.

Wyrm Weaver.flavorText: Studied basket weaving as an undergrad.

Wyrmguard.flavorText: They think they're trusted guardians. Dragons think they're convenient snacks.

Wyrmrest Agent.flavorText: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority 1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!

X-21 Repairbot.flavorText: The circle bolt goes in the square hole.

XB-488 Disposalbot.flavorText: You'll be so surprised when you figure out what XB stands for.

XB-931 Housekeeper.flavorText: "WHAT IS MY PURPOSE?" "You gain Armor." "OH GOD."

Xaril, Poisoned Mind.flavorText: It's basically your own fault if you go around drinking weird green potions handed out by creepy mantid dudes.

Xavius.flavorText: Xavius has grand nightmares of summoning Sargeras into this world, but a few Satyr will have to do for now.

Xhilag of the Abyss.flavorText: When ancient heroes drove a felhunter into the sea, they thought it was the end. But for Xhilag, it was only the beginning...

Xor'toth, Breaker of Stars.flavorText: We started his stats at 50,000,000,000/50,000,000,000 to be lore-accurate, but it was just a nudge too powerful.

Xyrella.flavorText: On the Night of Falling Stars, Xyrella had a vision of a shattered naaru. "Go to the Barrens," the being said. "Seek the shards of my broken body. Restore me, and I will restore your daughter."

Xyrella, the Devout.flavorText: Xyrella thought she was only saving her daughter. Her actions may very well have saved the entire world.

Y'Shaarj, Rage Unbound.flavorText: When he's working out, he binds all that rage back into a ponytail.

Y'Shaarj, the Defiler.flavorText: Y'Shaarj made an excellent office intern, doing the copying AND defiling.

Yelling Yodeler.flavorText: Maybe it's OK for the Grimtotem to destroy some music forever.

Ymirjar Deathbringer.flavorText: Purple cotton candy is the snack of choice in Ymirheim.

Ymirjar Frostbreaker.flavorText: Also gains +1 Attack for each time your opponent mispronounces his name.

Yogg-Saron, Hope's End.flavorText: I spell your doom... Y-O-U-R D-O-O-M!

Yogg-Saron, Unleashed.flavorText: Has been known to monologue before he strikes.

Yoink!.flavorText: Saying the spell’s name makes it work better.

Young Dragonhawk.flavorText: They were the inspiration for the championship Taurenball team: The Dragonhawks.

Young Priestess.flavorText: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.

Youthful Brewmaster.flavorText: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews. Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!

Ysera.flavorText: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream. Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?

Ysera the Dreamer.flavorText: Quick! Quick! Write it down before you forget them all!

Ysiel Windsinger.flavorText: Reach down into your lungs. The wind that resides there is your greatest treasure. It provides the gift of song, which is free. *But not less than (1)

ZOMBEEEES!!!.flavorText: In your brain, in your brain, Zombees, Zombees, Zombees-ees-ees.

Zai, the Incredible.flavorText: Following this act will be her younger brother, Frank the Mediocre.

Zap!.flavorText: The material components for this spell are wool socks and a rug.

Zealous Initiate.flavorText: Ok, Initiate. You need to settle down and do your job. In this case, that means die so someone else can get a minor buff.

Zephrys the Great.flavorText: "Of course it's perfect, you're just not seeing how to use it."

Zerek's Cloning Gallery.flavorText: Cloning can be a jarring experience.

Zerek, Master Cloner.flavorText: His original name was Aerek. Then the first clone was Berek. They went evil around Merek.

Zilliax.flavorText: Everything but the kitchen sink. Oh wait, there's one on his back.

Zilliax Deluxe 3000.flavorText: It only took us 2998 prototypes to figure out how to make the perfect card... by having YOU do it!

Zixor, Apex Predator.flavorText: A living terror. Teleports at will. Feasts on tainted helboar meat. No head scritches unless you're Leoroxx.

Zok Fogsnout.flavorText: Despite having only 3 digits on each hand, Zok plays Bass like he has 5.

Zola the Gorgon.flavorText: Her name seems a bit cheesy.

Zoobot.flavorText: The Murloc is taking the picture.

Zul'Drak Ritualist.flavorText: Generosity is a core value in cult culture.

Zul'jin.flavorText: If you can dodge an axe, you can dodge a ball.

Redgill Razorjaw.flavorText: One fish, two fish, red fish replaces blue fish.

Redscale Dragontamer.flavorText: Sir Finley made this look a lot easier three expansions ago...

Reefwalker.flavorText: A gentle giant with some not-so-gentle friends.

Reflecto Engineer.flavorText: The whole thing's based on the Rubber-Glue Phenomenon.

Refreshment Vendor.flavorText: Menu: Funnel cakes, carrots, popcorn, jormungar steaks. It's hard serving a diverse clientele.

Rehydrate.flavorText: Just doing our part as the Hearthstone development team in reminding you to drink more water!

Reincarnate.flavorText: It's like birth, except you're an adult and you were just dead a second ago.

Reinforced Plating.flavorText: I am become death, destroyer of azerite.

Relentless Pursuit.flavorText: If you steal a Demon Hunter's corn dog, you'll get what's coming.

Relentless Worg.flavorText: It's the Year of the Worg! Wait - what do you mean 'wolf'?

Relentless Wrathguard.flavorText: Ugh, for the love of... could they just send a Relenting Smileguard for once!?

Relic Vault.flavorText: Holds Sire Denathrius' most prized possession - his teddy bear, Jeremy Bearimy.

Relic of Dimensions.flavorText: A glaive is a glaive, but a mystery box could be anything! It could even be a glaive!

Relic of Extinction.flavorText: Faster than an asteroid, and just as effective.

Relic of Phantasms.flavorText: Xy'mox chuckled. "You mean the Chaos Emerald?"

Reliquary Researcher.flavorText: What good is a researcher if they're just gunna keep it all a secret?

Reliquary Seeker.flavorText: The Reliquary considers itself the equal of the League of Explorers. The League of Explorers doesn't.

Reliquary of Souls.flavorText: These three represent Anger, Desire, and Suffering. Much like raid night guild chat.

Remixed Dispense-o-bot.flavorText: "Mine gave me free money!" "Mine gave me free ice cream!" "… mine gave me two sheep that explode. They were free but I still want a refund."

Remixed Musician.flavorText: Like every bard I know, he's a chaotic Neutral jack of all trades.

Remixed Rhapsody.flavorText: "Is this real life?" "No, this is a card game."

Remixed Totemcarver.flavorText: Music always sounds better on old, wooden speakers.

Remixed Tuning Fork.flavorText: You can tune a fork, but you can't tune a fish.

Remornia, Living Blade.flavorText: Was it the lead pipe... the candlestick... or the unhinged, sentient, bloodthirsty sword?

Remorseless Winter.flavorText: In the Badlands, this is a Rare.

Remote Control.flavorText: For some reason, my dog keeps trying to eat this.

Remote-Controlled Golem.flavorText: Someone got a little too excited inventing a can opener.

Rend Blackhand.flavorText: Rend believes he is the True Warchief of the Horde and he keeps editing the wikipedia page for "Warchief of the Horde" to include his picture.

Renew.flavorText: I am rejuvenated, I am renewed, I am my own nightlight!

Reno Jackson.flavorText: Reno is a four-time winner of the 'Best Accessorized Explorer' award.

Reno the Relicologist.flavorText: All his life, Reno Jackson was only a gatling wand away from becoming the greatest and most terrifying mage who ever existed.

Reno, Lone Ranger.flavorText: With an uncertain past and a questionable future, Reno was lucky to find his home on the range.

Renowned Performer.flavorText: Cutting the assistant in half is the easy part.

Repackage.flavorText: I don't want to play with you anymore.
